column10: Review
Mostly miss a export possibility, it’s a key feature for apps like this.
Please provide a time stamp to this app. Instead of having to type in the time each session I write. Please app developers read this!

This journal has lots of great features, especially the prompts from your photos and calendar events.

However, what is the point of a digital journal if you don’t have a search function? Journals are often used to reflect and being able to search for keywords would be amazing.

column9: Please add a text search feature
column10: Please add a text search feature.
I have not been able to open the app after the last ios update. ios 17.3.1

Cursor keeps jumping to the end of an entry when I'm trying to edit.

Formatting is problematic if you copy and paste from another source.

For these two simple reasons, it's completely useless to me.

column9: Annoying to writing entires on it
column10: The page your writing on keeps moving, switching where you can’t see what your writing sometimes. It kind of gives you a sense of vertigo while you write. I’m sure they’ll fix it eventually, but for now, it’s real annoying.

I’ve kept a written journal for over 30 years now and I will continue to do so for the next 130 years. I decided to try this journal app because I’m not able to write in mine every day but want to document what I do and things that are going on more often and this app makes it really easy and convenient to do it right when I’m thinking about it.  I don’t see it available for iPad so which is disappointing since it’s easier to type with that.

Great idea and would love to see this improved, but the actual text editor is atrocious. Was it even tested at all?? No headers, no easy way to do bulleted lists, no padding on the bottom, and it continually jumps to the top of the page when writing a long journal entry. Also, not available on my other devices?

- does not have search, - Not supporting tag. - Amount of picture per entry is very limited. - Does not have calendar view to choose a day and see that. - Not available for iPad or mac or at least via browser…
This app would completely remove my need for other journal apps.  It’s great to have on my phone, but I like having a keyboard when I journal.  Thanks so much for adding this tool for iPhone!
It used to work so well before. But upon updating on the new iOS, the journal started crashing whenever i try to attach photos on my entry

column9: App is great - long term not thought out
column10: I love love the way the app functions in use. But then it only lets you use iCloud to store. Which I do not use, I use another service and there is no way to download and save your journal in any way other than iCloud. I feel now I will have to delete the app and lose the memories I saved here in the last few weeks. Unfortunate and I will be sure to check that before starting on another app.

column9: Excellent application but needs iPad & MacBook support
column10: Needs MacBook support

The app is okay. I like how you can add voice notes and pictures. However, I wish we had more options for editing. Things like different font styles and colors and etc would be nice. I hope that it is something that they could add in the future.
It is more easier to type and do things in iPad.

I really wish this was available for IPad as well and to be synced . For me using a pen to journal is more therapeutic that text typing. Voice texting is okay if I’m alone but sometimes there are things you don’t want others to hear. I hope this is updated other wise I’ll stick to my paper journal.

Fix the bugs! When editing paragraphs or absolutely anything thats not at the end of the entry the cursor will jump to the end of the entry constantly! And to top it off any edits being done will be undone when it does the jump. Extremely annoying!

It would be perfect if the exact time I record
can be added to the list

For a high school programmer. 
Total embarrassment for Apple. An app that punishes users. No export, no recovering deleted entries, no “select all” text tool. 

What is this, 1982?
Limited to only iPhone I’d love to see this rolled out to iPad & Mac. It would definitely be more appealing if you could write in the journal with and iPen or use the larger keyboard from my Mac.

column9: I love the minimalism although wish you could sort your entries
column10: Although most journaling apps have all sorts of useful feature sometimes you just want something simple. This app is great except I wish you could sort you entries in folders

I decide to write journal again because of this app.
But it would be better if imaging when you have hundreds pages of journal and that is very stuggling to search for a specific date or piece of memory you want to revisit.

I find this app incredibly useful, but it’s made me realize that I would love to be able to do more with my journalling data. For example integration with Apple health for trending of mood or social interaction or work intensity would allow me to be more insightful about managing my mental health overall.
Can we get an iPad supported version 😭

I absolutely love that Apple has added this app and I use it practically every day BUT I want to be able to find an entry again after I’ve written it. I’m already finding it difficult to find an old entry because I have to scroll so far down. Other then that, this app is fantastic! I especially love that I can add photos to my entry's and I have been using it to log my outfits everyday.

column9: No sync and no changing password
column10: At first I thoughtc what a nice idea. I liked it even, until I took a look at the app and realized I can’t get it to sync woth my  Macbook. And on top of that, I cannot change the password. Everyone in my house knows my password, so writing in this ‘private’ journal is actually not private because I cannot change the freaking password. What a disappointment
Apple should learn a bit from Microsoft Notes😉

My first complaint is that at very minimum, for something this stripped down to even have a chance at useful, it would need to be multiplatform with a nice iCloud web suite version. Don’t even get me started on how this is like a notepad I can attach photos to with ZERO frills. So disappointed. If I could at least access it everywhere, it would be ok. Maybe put it back and let it cook a little longer.

The app is great for journaling except it’s not functional enough. One can hardly undo or redo text, and can’t get formatting options like the ones available in the note app. You also don’t get the choice of a fully-embedded media especially pictures in the notes.
It’s simple to use, but I need more tags to categorize my diary/journal.

It is nice to have an appreciation like that. However the main point of a memoir is to be capable to dig through its history. I mean any one writing a journal will need to search for an issue , a title or a date. The main drawback of the app is missing the search option. Search option should be available

Probably the most under engineered piece of sw to ever come from Apple. I tried it for a month or so till I tried to look back for something I had entered already.

NO word SEARCH ? Really?

NO EXPORT? Really?

So if I enter an event six month ago then I have to scroll for 30 minutes to find the data.

Come on.

We should add an option to highlight words in different Colors, to Bold, and Underline.

Thank yous Love yous

You can’t export your journal, so it will be forever locked to you iPhone. It doesn’t event sync with iPad. Also mood tracking and journaling should be linked. It’s very basic app, and might be good to get started, but soon you’ll want something better.
A search function would be so extremely useful. Why? Why leave it out?

It would be awesome that this app would be available on iPad and other devices, it’ll give you the freedom to access to it on any Apple device and I know that being able to Journal with the stylus on the app would unlock new benefits for the user.

I am a lover of any notes app. I had high hopes for this one to be like an actual journal, but so far it has been very glitchy. If you hit return twice to create a paragraph, you get sent straight to the top of the journal entry. This also happens when you write for too long. Also, recently it has gotten worse and typing is lagging and will glitch and send the cursor back a few letters. I hope things get better on this app and I can see the potential!

there should be a password lock option instead of face id (for me personally it’s not just my own face saved in my phone) 
it’s also very glitchy. if i try to go back up to something i typed and add more it’ll just take me right back down to the bottom and it’s really annoying.
Really enjoying the journal but I would love to be able to share with my iPad so I can do entries on both devices. Thanks

column9: First journaling app help me through my battle with cancer
column10:
Really happy someone suggested this app. It’s been great the last few days updating my family and team of care on all that happens in a day. 

However, I will have to rate the App 1 star instead  if I can’t UnDo randomly hitting a button after working on something for 2 hours.

Any ideas?? I didn’t accidentally hit Cut since nothing is pasting. Really don’t want to lose that writing. Left it open. Haven’t used cut or copy once or did any additional letters so it should be the most recent UnDo. Please help. Thank you!
If you want to download this app don’t it tracks me a lot from eating at McDonald’s to pooping to opening a door

Why isn’t this on my iPad and Mac? With iCloud storage!  As for features, i use the app to journal my guitar practice, so being able to duplicate yesterday’s entry would be huge, along with “select all” when I edit yesterday’s entry.  If I had this on my iPad, I wouldn’t need my iPhone in the studio…

-Needs more privacy. 
Having extra passcode for it would be good
-Not show each journal as a note, maybe just show date of entry and than open. 
-compatible with the other apple devices

Absolutely love this app! I’ve been wanting a journal app where I can reflect on each day. Also, I appreciate the feature to change the date of the entry.

One update I’d love is the ability to make categories within the journal. For example, I’d love to have a category or grouping of journal entries where I focus on gratitude in the morning before I start my day, another for a reflection, etc. Then I can click on the grouping and only see my entries for gratitude and not mixed together.

I love this new app. I was always the person to want to start a diary/journal and did it for a few day, then stopped. For some reason I dont have that problem with this app. I’ve been using it for two weeks maybe and I just make an entry whenever I feel like it. I love the photos and maps features and also the reflection/ promos are nice. This is by far the easiest best way to journal for me.

column9: Great app but needs Mac OS
column10:
I’ve been using the app for a while now and it’s been great for taking note of nice moments or reflections.

I really wish it was available on Mac as longer entries would be much more suited to a physical keyboard/bigger screen.
It needs “search” so we can more easily find stuff

column9: To the devs ( thanks but work still needs doing here )
column10: I love the app but when you have so many entries and a lot in them the app freezes and goes so slow. I can’t find my self using this app to journal cause it can’t take the amount of entries I currently have 33 and in one of those I have journaled everything that’s going on in my life every day and now when I enter that journal entry it’s sooo so slow and freezes that it’s hard to write in anything and I don’t want to lose what’s there. Please help with that because I like the app but if I can’t journal in it what’s the point.

column9: still quite early stage and basic but can see potential
column10: So far this is quite simple and basic but think there’s much potential to improve and link all the information in the phone with artificial intelligence for suggestive journaling ideas. example like significant events that is out of trend or norm recorded in the apple health app or mental wellness or workouts, calendars - apple or email apps and significant usage of certain apps (eg time spent on social media or travel app when planning or apple wallet spending or banking even work email app, excel, powerbi etc). indeed a lot of information is available on the phone that could be journaled in these days where the phone does so much and hours spent on it!

This is overall a good application. It provides you space to write/enter your everyday moments with photos, videos or even audios

I will suggest that this app must show the TIME of writing/entry. So that, along with the date, you can also remember the time at which a specific moment was logged .

column9: Whoever at Apple made the “Journal” app, good job.
column10:
Whoever at Apple made the “Journal” app, good job. It’s a great app. I find that writing down my thoughts can be of significant benefit to my mental health.

So to the app developer(s), well done. You’ve designed a useful and practical app that is a good addition to the apple ensuite of apps.

Bye.

There is soooo much potential here and I truly hope Apple actions on feedback. Its user friendly and helps a lot with panic attacks. 

This could possibly replace that other app. Iykyk.
Great way to journal. However I with this available on my iPad. It is easier to journal on my iPad than my iPhone. Perhaps I’ll use it more whenever they make it available on the iPad.

Love the concept of the app. I’m so glad there’s a journal app now. I do wish all the features that Notes have were features that Journal have too. I also which it had a search option. What type of document would you have without some way to search it. That’s just not efficient. Please add the Notes features and a search option (hopefully to both).

I like the convenience of this app. However, I don’t like that to find a post. I have to scroll all the way to the bottom to reread something because there’s no option for you to look at a specific post. It would be great if they added some sort of search function like in the Notes app or search by tags

column9: Please improve it so I can rate it 5 stars!
column10: I like this app, but I want to love it. It would be really helpful to be able to tag posts, search posts, bold, italicize, export, imbed urls, etc.

This is the best journal app I’ve ever had. It’s simple as it should be. It is uncomplicated, and please leave it that way. It is missing nothing and if you want more, there are so many apps that will do that for you. This one is just right.
How is this different the the notes app. Just write in there. Or pages app. Nope let’s force everyone to have another app that doesn’t do anything new and then pretend we are great innovators.

I’ve been journaling physically for a while now on paper, but eventually every year I’ll slowly stop or forget. I still end up getting one every year.

It’s good to write as it’s good for your mental health, as according to therapists and psychologists. And my mental health is not the best, which I believe is extremely common in todays world. 

Since this app is on my phone and it has reminders, I’ve been writing everyday so far. Hopefully I can keep up.

Pros: 
-Typing is so much easier than writing. A lot of time I stop writing in my journal is because my hands gets tired.
-I can attach pictures or locations 
-Prompts are nice!

Cons:
-My only major con is the return button while writing. It’ll scroll up and i can’t see what I’m typing until it goes to the next line. Really annoying, please fix.

A concern is privacy as it’s on the phone but I honestly don’t have anything interesting if for some reason a hacker wants to read my journal haha; it’s more for improving myself. Still I prefer the privacy. 
My other concern is what happens if this app disappears or Apple goes under. Nothing last forever. Will all my entries just go in smoke? That’s the main selling point to pen and paper compared to digital.

The journal app is very entry-level compared to others. It would be beneficial, i think, to be able to have multiple ‘books’ within the app. Essentially a folder for journal entries, maybe another for quotes, or passages from books, a folder to noting goals etc.

column9: PLEASE add this to Mac & iPad
column10:
It’s a fantastic app and I absolutely love the recommended feature for moments to reflect on.

However, it is a huge missed opportunity not having this on Mac and iPad. Who wants to sit and write journal entries on a tiny screen and keyboard? Sure I can use a Bluetooth keyboard and prop up my phone at a 45 degree angle but that’s just not natural.

Please, listen to your users and make this amazing app native for Mac & iPad.

I’ve started paper journaling this year after many years of not. I am really happy that Apple have brought this out. It’s very straight forward and simple to use. I think they will bring out updates in the future with extra features. Great that it allows you attach photos/videos to whatever it is you are journaling about!
I enjoy using this app. I wish there's a calendar feature so you can easily go back to your previous old entry and I also wish this is available on my macbook air. overall, will continue to use this!
Please, please, please put a search function into this app. Currently, it’s like using a diary with one page.

Has the potential to be a good app, and I like that it’s Apple and I’m not trusting my journal entries to yet another third party - but honestly, pretty bad job on bringing it all together. The typing interface is very glitchy, continuously moves your curser, no good options for text formatting. 

Would be great if it also offered you to save multiple templates, for instance if you had a set of questions you like to ask yourself. Better yet if you could say on Monday morning prompt me with ‘xyz’ and Monday night prompt me with ‘123’ … end of each week prompt me with this, end of each month prompt me with that, yearly prompts etc. 

First app review I’ve ever left because I’d actually like this one to work well - which it doesn’t. 

Also, would be great if this app worked across iPad and synced across your devices. I feel that using the Apple Pencil on iPad for journaling g would be a powerful addition.
Overall it’s a good app but I hope the display of entries can be changeable as in vertical and horizontal display

I have been enjoying using this app for a few weeks now and find it very easy to use. I enjoy the photo feature a great deal. My only issue is that I cannot share my journal. I am using the app as a travel journal and will be unable to share it, I’m going to have to find a different app.

column9: I wish there was more I could do.
column10: I like the app a lot it really helps me put down my thoughts and what not but it could use some tlc. I think you should be able to move the photos and crop them however you like, if you put a normal sized photo in it just uses the top or bottom of the picture and I can’t see what I’d like to see without tapping on it. I also think you should be able to add any contact or song that you want to talk about not just the recommended ones. Needs some work done and hopefully soon because I really do like the idea of the app.
That’s it
It desperately needs a search function to be of any use. Once this is added I would use it.
The app functioning is not good.
This app is great to create memories. It works very well as a diary. Makes me wonder why it is not available on the mac. Please add this.

column9: Great app, needs a family version too
column10: It would be great to have a version of the journal app that could be shared with your family so that those memories can be shared
Excellent app, but disheartening to note that it is not available on iPad. Please make it available on iPad too.

column9: Make it more fun to use
column10: I love using this journal on my iPhone, it would be better if it had different fonts  sizes, colors, gifs and more exciting stuff added to it.
Need more prompts lease

Such a cool app but I’m not going to spend hours typing journal entries on my phone and wish it was iPad and laptop compatible. The voice note thing is cool but not a solve. 

Plz give us iPad at least!!!
Your abs sent me a suggestion that needs to be fixed. The punctuation should be like “this.” NEVER like “this”, because “this”, is 100% INCORRECT.

The good:
- Good use of encryption to ensure privacy
- Recommendations are pretty handy

The bad:
- Needs a MacOS version, writing more than a few lines on an iPhone keyboard is tedious and distracting. I really like the idea of using the iPhone to start an entry, and then finishing off in the evening over a proper keyboard. 

- Poor text formatting; how do you add a heading to a blank entry!

- No search or organising features.

this app is great I can put all my emotions into it and I tried paper journaling but I didn’t get round the hang of its bad didn’t have time but now it’s great that it’s on my phone defo recommend this app I start using it everyday!

Five star app except you need to be able to search entries!  I’m thoroughly enjoying this app and especially being able to easily dictate entries. I’ve never been someone to consistently write in a journal, but I have been able to easily add thoughts, photos and events throughout the day. Add a comprehensive search capability! Please!
This is a hidden gem for overthinking relief. It appears to allow one to “pin down” wild thought by giving them a “place” or “position” in your understanding and perceptions.
Please add export to other formats

I’m loving this new easy way to write thoughts, notes, tracks. Even more so that this can be linked to workouts and routines. I think it is a step in the right direction. Some ideas I think would hugely benefit: 

- I’d like the ability to tag each journal rather than just bookmark, this way I can easily identify some journal entries over others (Example: Gym journals, Mental Health Journals, Food Etc) 

- I think also being able to add more from Apple health into this journal would be amazing; Meditation time, Calories Tracked, Weight, Heart Rates etc etc) 

- The ability to maybe customise the Journals a little bit more so they feel more tailored to yourself. 

So far so good please keep improving!

column9: Needs a way to export to pdf
column10: Would be great if I could save a copy of my journal so I can share it with friends and family. Also having a backup hard copy I can print is nice considering I write about my life in this app.

I am on a trip to India. Perfect time to try the new Journal app, tell the story behind all the photos and share with my friends back home.  But the app does not permit sharing!!  This is a huge limitation when journaling a trip or some vent.  

Other limitations:
- There are a max of 10 photos per entry!  I have 128 GB on my phone and it can only hold 10 pictures?  I’ve had to split each day into multiple entries. 
- Photo thumbnails are cropped in strange and unpredictable ways. Yes, the resulting arrangement is pretty, but I often can’t tell what’s actually in a picture without opening it. If I have to do that, what’s a thumbnail for. 
- All type is bold.  Cursor scrolls randomly off page.  
Seems like a nice first effort for an inexperienced programmer.  But not at all what I expect from Apple.  The positive reviews bewilder me.

column9: Why is there no search function?
column10: The app is still too simple, even the most basic search function is not yet available.
Not bulk, not single entry (unless you want to select text, copy & paste)

Adding a search function by word, date-based search, and a customizable tag system could indeed enhance user experience and functionality. 

Adding a feature to mark each day with a color corresponding to your mood would provide users with a visual representation of their emotions over time. And seeing a colorful summary at the end of the year could be really insightful for reflection and tracking personal trends

column9: Journal save date but not time of entry
column10: Can you change the app to also save the time of the journal entry?
I will never use this app unless it provides ability for user to export all their posts and media to file, why would I save all my data in this app for it to be trapped in there?
Crashes when adding posts and changing the date to an older one. Journal ‘pages’ no longer open then. Wondering if I will ever get access to that content back again! ☹️
I love the journal feature please make it available for iPad soon!!

So I love the prompts. But when I remove a highlight of photos it would come back in two days. Also my main thing is attaching a photo to my journal entry. Even though the option is there to add it won’t add the photo.

column9: This App should be on iPad first rather than iPhone
column10: I prefer to write journal with the pen on iPad and I don’t get why this app is launched only on iPhone. It doesn’t seem very smart decision anyway. I know many people already talked about this so I won’t need to repeat. But the whole idea of launching this app only on iPhone is quite ridiculous. Not sure how the app development team of Apple works. Same like the famous Calculator app…
Great app for diary! Please create this app for iPad and Mac too 🙂

column7: double j to the A yoooo
column10: I was using it as a place to store possible short excerpts from my stories (I’m a writer), and I noticed that the longer the entry, the glitchier (and slower) the note is.

Nice app though somewhat wierd

it will have been good to add tags to allow for customized search for a group of events

also pictures and pretty attachments should not be stuck at the top. there should be flexibility

It's really crazy but the app keeps deleting some of the most recent text I write. As soon as you stop writing and wait for a bit then there is a risk that it will delete the most recent paragraph written. It makes it very difficult to reliably use the app
It ist not working! Iphone at apple for repair. No problem found. Journal installed. Started >>> hangs. Delete app. Reinstall app. Try again. >> hands. All the time!

I got this app cuz I wanted to use something other than the notes app to journal but there’s no way to add an account on this app so I’m afraid that if something ever happens with my phone and I lose the app, that nothing will be saved. I just don’t trust that my entries will be saved which defeats the purpose of downloading it cuz I’m copying and pasting it in my notes anyway. There’s also this weird glitch that moves the page to the top while you’re typing. Despite all that I actually like the simplicity of it and how all my entries are in their individual boxes for me to see with the dates.

Update: 
I deleted the app and redownloaded it to see if my entries would save and they all did. Everything was just as I left it. But I’m still unsure of whether not it would save if I got a new phone. Regardless I’m satisfied with the app now that I know my entries are automatically saved even without an account made.

column9: Love it, but I would prefer it if it could have more options for organizing
column10: So I have been using this app daily since it was released and I love it. However, I keep different types of journals, one for reflection and experiences, one to record my dreams and then I have another for a meditative practice I partake in, in which it is suggested to keep a journal of experiences. I still find myself having to reach for the notes app because that lets me organize my thoughts into different folders. It also has a search bar which makes it easier to retrieve a specific note when I need it. If those functionalities were added to this app, it would be seriously perfect.

I started journaling on my iPad us in Microsoft OneNote a week before upgrading my iOS that includes this app. I was excited to try this app. Please that it does exactly what I need and a little more. Sadly it is only available on the iPhone, not my iPad or any other Apple devices. I need to be able to float between devices for this reason I gave a 3 star and will go back to using Microsoft One Note. Hopefully, the app will be available for other Apple devices soon.
Please make this journal for iPads, it’s easier and I think that we all would enjoy it more

At this point in time, with all our technological advances, why can’t we collaborate online with our loved ones, especially with our growing children on this app? Where has Apple’s intuition gone? This journal writing is definitely an opportunity to connect to them further, away from the public eye and social media, and back into the privacy of the family, and learn more about them and watch them open up their written feelings.
I would love to be able to long press on the app to record a journal entry faster. Otherwise, I love how lightweight that app is. A “journal” should be as simple as paper and pen.
Not available online

This is a great app, I can write down what I need to in no time, adding bits and pieces from my day (music I listened to, walking steps, etc) is a great feature to me. Especially being able to log locations and record voice memos.

Apple, can we have the ability to change the color of our text as well? 

That would help if I’m trying to organize updates by grouping text!
Looking forward to get this app on mac!!!
App crashing when adding photos and selecting recent screenshots

Definitely needs more features like how they save, save/file view. I’m wondering if I v should just go back to notes or why this is different? How it could be different. I like the lock feature even though I’m not using it. I don’t need it care for suggestions but can see the benefit. I’m mostly concerned about how to store or find old entries; how to find multiple unfinished entries I keep coming back to  etc.
The overall app is ok but PLEASE ADD OT ON iPAD
When making a journal entry, the keyboard suddenly becomes slow and unresponsive, missing keystrokes and haptics being delayed

column9: Feels like an Early Beta Version, not a Finished App
column10: I really want to like this and have been using it in place of Notes for journaling since it came out. Constant bugs got frustrating. Every time you go down a sentence it will automatically scroll to the top. And now it will erase whole sentences after I type them. I had to them back in several times. Also, you can’t paste images into the journal and when you add a photo it will just pin it to the top. That is frustrating when I am writing about an image and want to drop it in there. This feels like an early beta version of the app that got rushed to launch.

No search option, No on this day.

Very basic app.

It’s a start but needs some TLC. I should be able to search. I would like to select a date and my entries show for that day. I should be able to edit the title. The ability to personalize it would be nice.

column9: Why can’t I search my old journals ?
column10:
It’s a good app but there are performance and one big issue with it. I don’t understand why you guys haven’t implemented a search tool engine for us to search our older journals. 
With Apple apps being some of the best, I don’t why how this little feature wasn’t thought of in your journal app. 
Please add a way for us to search our older notes and please fix the stutters when scrolling through the app. It kills the whole experience. 

Thanks you
It would be great to add search functionality, tags, and a Mac or iCloud option.
I think the specific time at which a diary has been written is important and yet this application lacks this feature.

When you try to edit something, it persistently wants to jump to the end of the article, or some other random location in the narrative. It is very sneaky about it as well. You have to constantly watch what it is doing otherwise you’ll spend ridiculous amount of time screwing with it.

column9: Journal has a way to go…
column10:
Good minimal app, but REALLY needs a search function. Using it to put thoughts down is good, but there is no way to easily find a thought you had days or weeks ago. Scrolling through day-by-day doesn’t work. 
Lots of others have commented on being able to change and set colors, fonts, etc. I second all of that.

column9: Make it so I can have it across devices
column10: I like it! And I want to be able to add to it on my MacBook. I’d love to be able to journal digitally across my devices on one place.
I had very important entries in this app and it managed to delete EVERYTHING. NOT a single ENTRY was saved. Unbelievable that apple has control over the information you write!!!!

column9: Simple app missing some crucial functions
column10:
I like simplicity of the app. 
But where is the search function?
Why it doesn’t support horizontal keyboard?

It looks nice but it’s missing a lot of features and metrics. By journaling, I’d like to correlate mood so eg correlating mood from the health app. There’s also no way to search through your journals for keywords. No metrics on days you journaled and days you didn’t. No metrics on weather. No historic data.  IMO it feels way too comfy. Like the journal entries themselves are way to wide so scrolling through them feels weird. I’d like them to be more compact for easier scrolling. And grouped by month and year, like a timeline view. It suggests journal titles based on the activity you did that day (fitness, phone call/FaceTime, photos/videos taken, maps direction, etc) which is a nice gesture but i find it annoying since I much rather journal about my whole day than a phone call that might have been 5 minutes

It's simple to use and is great alternative to these overpriced journaling apps. One thing I would add to this app is option to export all the entries in a form of diary or just a simple pdf with photos. I would really like to have this feature.
Great job!

Love that you can record audio entries but I hate that you can’t set a custom password, it has to be the same as your phone lock code which isn’t ideal if other people know this. Please consider allowing us to make the journalling experience more private with a custom text password.

column9: Love it, but I have some suggestions.
column10: Great journaling apps. But, maybe for the next update, photos and videos added can be placed "inside" the journal, not only as attachments above it. Kind of like a blog, so it'd feel like we sketch on a book journal. Speaking of, maybe you could also add sketching! Journaling plus sketching would be dope. I don't really know if those features are available on iPad or Mac, but that'd be a great addition to iPhone. Anyway, love it!

I love the app but it needs a few elements, search function is number one, then add some headings, folders, tags or categories…it works fine for now but if you journal for a few months or a year - you’ll definitely need some structure to go back to what you’ve written and not just scroll down through a years worth of entries (not user friendly at all in that way).

column9: Adding songs and your own prompts would make it 10/10
column10: Works fabulously on the iPhone 13 and it's great for busy people. But I've been wanting to add songs from Spotify as kind of prompts, so it would be great to integrate Spotify so I could either add a song as a prompt or as an audio reference. Also, I'd love to be able to add my own text prompts to the rotation of Apple prompts. Or even just add them to the journal entry, but to be able to format them the same way as the Apple prompts so that they show up in a nice little color box on the feed.

I love this app because I’ve finally made journaling a habit for the last year. However, I LOVE organization and would really like the option to have folders. I mainly use journaling to write my newborns milestones, things I want to be able to look back on and share with her one day but I like to keep track of my own day to day and workout routine/progress. So I would just like to be able to separate these entries rather than seeing them in a list format.
Can this app be made for MacBook too?? Please I want to be able to use it across my devices

column9: It’s solid, but has lots to go to be great
column10: I’ve always wanted a place where I can journal my thoughts on my phone and also include video and audio, so I was very excited when this journal app was launched for iOS. Some of the recent entry suggestions and recommendations from AI are not that great. But I can see this app being really awesome in the near future, assuming Apple continues to work on it.
I wish I just continued using the not apps because there are so glitches on this app

overall good and simple design to quickly input pictures for journal. 

could include more features like (apple pen/ipad), folders to sort journal entries, mood/habit tracker, questions to guide our day.

column9: Beautifully simple. Needs some tweaks to get to perfection
column10: Need to add hyperlink support. Currently any link added in body text isn’t even clickable
Please add a search for all notes and tags
i mean its okay, i wish you could put the photos where you want like the notes app, i would still use notes but its getting really crowded 😔

column9: Not working in my iPad mini 5
column10: Please let it work on I pad … 😏😢

column9: REQUEST to add this to the Mac and IPad! 🤗🤷🏻‍♀️
column10: I’ll preface this by saying I am a desk job employee, this is also my first review ever, and I just started journaling again. I was very excited when this app came out, I dabbled a bit on my phone. This morning I decided to dive in further, got up to journal on my Mac, but was disappointed by the fact that i could not download it on my Mac for it’s primary purpose. I was also disappointed that I had to go grab my phone from the other room to leave a review on this app . I’d like to think this something that will be fixed in 1.1 :) The app has great potential and will be very successful. I also appreciate the fact that it is backed by apple’s cybersecurity policies as a cybersecurity employee myself. However, the app NEEDS to be on Mac and iPad. Apple has invested a lot of money, time and energy (of all sorts) building amazing products. This needs to be one of those cross platform apps for user preference and ease. Request to please add this to Mac and IPad in the next update. For now, I will continue to use the pages or notes app at least you got me journaling again - Applemate2024 🤗

My only disappointment is that it isn’t available for my iPad. 

I use a Bluetooth keyboard so it’s easy to add entries. I can easily go to any date entry to reread what I’ve written.

column9: Dev team, please make available edit audio title
column10: Guys, the app its fantastic. Need some upgrades but ok! Make available to edit the title of the audios and images.
This should be available for ipads. It’s almost criminal that the app is not available for iPads!

column9: Huge potential waiting to be unlocked
column10:
The idea of a journal app that is native to the Apple ecosystem is huge, and for it to be one of the best out there, there's a couple of things that should be added.

1. The ability to search within all my journal entries, whether it is a keyword search, date search, location search, or even a hashtag search (more on this in #2), which would be awesome for coming back to memories that were written down previously, especially when there are hundreds of entries to search eventually.

2. The ability to add hashtags for each entry would be great as entries could be categorised into topics or themes, which would be extremely helpful for looking back at journaling patterns or re-exploring certain phases in life.

3. iPad and Mac compatibility would be much appreciated as well as I would spend a significant amount of time on these other devices as well.

I really like how simple and easy to use this app is. As soon as I open the app I can see all my entries which I like. I also use the add photos function so i can look back on what I saw and rmb what I did that day

column9: some features i wish was added
column10: i love this app and i’m sure in the future there will be more features. some features i wish was added was being able to add titles. without titles it makes it kind of difficult to be able to read back on older journal entries because it all just kind of looks jumbled together. also i wish we were able to add custom folders or custom filters or something to be able to keep it more organized. being able to highlight words while we’re writing just to be able to make it more customizable. i feel like making everything more customizable would make it so intriguing. if we could change the font colors or the background colors. also if i could change the font size so i could add subtitles cause i tend to rant a lot clearly. all in all customization and organization is the biggest thing.
I’m enjoying the app so far, but I think a search function is an absolute must in any kind of journalling/note taking app.

column9: Integrate with health + state of mind!
column10: At the time of each journal entry, if I could integrate with the “state of mind” inside of Apple health. That would be a killer combo. Weird it’s segmented. The two relate very strongly… at least for me.

it opens a random previous entry / suggestion every time you open the app, instead of just showing you the list of your entries. Super inconvenient to open the app and be greeted by something completely random that I've already entered before I can do anything else
I like this app and but I think you should add more topics to write about

App crashes when I try to upload some recent photos. First noticed this problem about a week ago and I’m back in the same situation. It tends to happen with newer photos such as ones that I screenshot prior to using the app. I tried restarting my phone and that did nothing. 

It would also be nice if we could add music that aren’t a part of the suggested nine. I’ve run into that problem as well as wishing that I could place photos in certain parts of the entry, but that’s a smaller hurdle than the others I’ve mentioned.

column9: Great potential; need to copy entries and save deleted entries
column10: It’s pretty good, but I need to be able to easily copy my journal entries. It should also save deleted entries until a certain date.

column9: Bare bones and no desktop version
column10:
Having to input journal entries from my tiny iphone keyboard is not encouraging for long form writing. It’s a job for a keyboard. Journaling can be long and almost like writing a story of your thoughts.

The lack of formatting options is odd, i expected it to have formatting options like the notes app. it’s rudimentary like writing in text edit. no control over size/ no bullets or list making ability. 

the prompts are nice, but it needs to be more flushed out. they probably had “simplicity” as a goal for product design. I think i would describe the end result as more barren.

I love this app so far! I’ve been wanting a journal app to be added to the iPhone for a long time!! I typically would write down little snippets of my day/events in my calendar. This is way better! 
A future suggestion would be to show the entries from the past month grouped together in maybe a calendar type graphic or something. Just so it’s easier to quickly see at a glance instead of scrolling down. But it’s a great start!

column9: Will change review if available on MacBook
column10: Only available on iPhone. Basically useless
Only complaint I have is that it’s not available on Mac or iPad
This app just popped up on my phone. I don’t want to write a journal. Deleted.

Would have been better if you could choose the code for the app yourself. Instead of it being the exact same as your Iphone’s. So, someone that knows your Iphone’s code can’t snoop in your private thoughts :)
I love this app so much. But always feels like something is missing in the basic app features. Like the home screen can have many more things.

While I appreciate the privacy features this extremely simple, barebones journal app provides, I have a hard time justifying use of it every day.

Lack of a search bar, attachment options outside of photos, video, and IN APP RECORDED audio (not any audio you can import from voice memos, for example) makes it hard to use. I wish I could link to notes I have taken, or voice memos I have recorded.

As an aspiring educator, I often record audio in conferences to take notes and better myself. I wish I could at least add a link to said audio recordings so when I look back on how far I’ve come I can listen and reinforce what I’ve learned.

The lack of search bar and titling/tagging is annoying. I would love to be able to filter by anything other than just photos/media in the future as my journal becomes filled out.

This app is nice however, for stream of consciousness writing, that gets thoughts to paper so to speak.

I journaled through most of 2023 using Notion and was quite happy to continue with the platform this year until Apple released Journal app. I love the prompts, interface, and layout. I know the app will improve overtime and I’m happy to grow with it. Journaling has helped me regulate my emotions and process very difficult feelings and thoughts that I refuse to store in my mind.

The absence of a search capability makes this app far less valuable.  Imagine compiling half a year’s worth of entries, and trying to find something that pops up in your memory.  You’d have to scroll and read.

column9: i love the app but i have some recommendations
column10:
i really hope you would listen to this since i have became an avid user of this app ever since it came out. here are my list of recommendations on what features you should add for the next update: 

• calendar in which you could view your entry/ies on that specific day. 
• search bar
• freedom to arrange the photos/videos added
• freedom to select a background 
• and other customizable contents 

the main thing that i really want to see in the next update is the calendar. please, apple. i’m begging. it would be a wonderful addition to the app. and also, thank you for adding this app to our phones. it’s a big help! 

please listen to the recommendations. have a great day 🤍

can we please have the opportunity to catalog our own - the only filters are  auto generated and reflection only refers to suggested reflection questions.
i would like to be able to add my own reflection questions and like others have said, be able to have headers or titles that aren’t just bold italic or strike through

It’s a really beautiful app, I like that I can add pictures, it will auto include places I visited etc. the organization is terrible. You can’t go back to a specific journal entry without scrolling through every single entry. It really badly needs a CALENDAR feature! If this was added in it would be far more organized. I have yet to see any updates. Originally was 3 stars, now only one star unless we see some improvements soon.
Not sure what I had in mind; but I am not impressed. Deleting it.
Just missing the option to pin/anchor a note(s) to the top

column9: Easy and free way to journal that actually works
column10:
I’ve been trying to journal for quite a few years, but never really found a good way to do this. This seems like a very basic easy-going application but when you get under the hood, it seems to have a lot of power in the background things like the simple nudges for reminding you to journal, the way, it’s free to do your own structure from entry to entry, and just the ease to add pictures and other information into your journal is simple.
I really do like the way the suggestions work, it’s good way to kind of give you a little kick to start writing about something.
I know that there will be APIs added for other applications later, I am looking forward to seeing how that will work.
But all in all, for being such a new app, I really enjoyed it. thank you Apple for putting not only this the security in front of this application, but the little extras that make this application so warm and helpful.

column9: Need for organization and search tools
column10:
While the simplicity of this app is great, its organizational features leave room for improvement. Currently, diaries are only accessible by scrolling through the main menu, which is uncomfortable when I want to review or locate specific ones. And what if I have hundreds of diaries in the future? Should I just scroll down repeatedly?

I hope there will be additional viewing options, such as a calendar format for weekly or monthly navigation. Also, incorporating more functionalities for organization and search capabilities would make managing the diaries more efficient, which seems necessary eventually.
would love a search function and tags!!!
Great app! Can u guys make it available for iPad and Mac!? Pleaaaaase!

The app itself is great and I’ve been using it for over a month now. Sadly it‘s rly buggy and it keeps deleting my txt in one of the entries. I‘m rewriting it over and over again but it gets deleted. My girlfriend has the same problem. There is even a Reddit post about it. Pls give us a fix!
please add the ability to search in the diary. Also, I would like to see a calendar so that you can easily go to the desired date from the past

I like this app, I can see it being really useful for homeschoolers to record their data and progress for reporting purposes in New South Wales. I’d really like to be able to do it on the iPad so that I can see things clearer And present it to an approved person on the iPad rather than my phone.

column9: Needs so much work to make it more appealing
column10:
I like the clean look of this but the lack of functionality that comes with Notes makes me not want use it. I want to be able to add heading, bullet points, change colour of text, highlight etc all the things available in Notes but with the clean look. 
I don’t just want a journal to ask me to reflect on things that have no relevance just to make it look pretty. 
Far to basic for me to want to rally get any use out of.

column9: A few changes I’d love to see!
column10:
I love this app and the suggestions, but I think it’s a little too simple to be used long term. A few things I’d love to see changed in the future.
- different password for the journal app than my phone (optional) 
- pinned entries at the top! Just like messages, if there’s a journal entry I keep coming back to, I’d love to have it pinned.
- calendar view, I have been using this daily since it came out. I have tons of entries and I’d love to see a calendar view I can scroll through.

I’ve been like a month and it has helped me in many ways :) 
The only thing that could be better is adding a mood tracker. 
I hope they listen to my suggestion.

I’m loving it!  I only have one critique,  when I am pasting a copied section in a specific day it keeps scrolling up.  I have to watch carefully and scroll back down to paste.
It’s a glitch of some type.

Thank you,

Debby Blue

column9: no export or print feature i can find
column10: what is the point of doing this if i cannot export it and save it or print it.

Very useful but it needs to be for iPad as well and even more importantly it needs a search function. It is crazy to have to scroll through countless entries to get to a specific date or topic etc. Ideally a “word” search and a calendar to click on to bring up a day will be added soon. I’m surprised it wasn’t built in straight away. Or is it there and I’m missing it?

The cursor keeps jumping to the top of the note, or top of the paragraph, during typing, making this app almost unusable.

It is supposed to promote a contemplative mindset, but every 30 seconds, it jumps around, too distracting.

Also, making Bold or change font size takes many taps, and the notes feature is so easy.  Why not use that?  

I’m going back to journaling in notes ti they figure it out.

To use it is simple but just clicking a + symbol. 

But after a few days of writing I find that why exactly am I writing it in a digital platform if I have to scroll and read to see what I have written on a particular day. No scope to sync with laptop. No scope for putting a password if it’s a personal diary. Don’t know, if my app gets deleted then where will the data go. Moreover, no provision for searching or calendar view to check when I missed etc. 
So Apple, keeping it too basic kills the purpose of the digital platform. Other comments have way too good technical suggestions, DO SOMETHING. I am switching the app right now.
So far so good. Its simple to use and helpful. My only gripe is that it only works on my phone. It would be great if I could use it on my MacBook and iPad too.

Here are some features I think would greatly improve the app
1-Integration on MacOS to type more quickly and freely 
2-Search feature 
3-Tag or label feature to categorize entry type (relationship, fitness, etc.) 
4-Consider integration with mood tracking on the health app. For example, if you input “Feeling Unpleasant,” related to Work, you may get a prompt to journal about it where you can expand on that
I would love to write some entries from my computer and be able to access my journal from my MacBook. Please make a desktop version that sinks with the iPhone app!

column9: Cool, helps me documentate and look back into my mental state a bit better
column10: I like the app, the reflective questions I’m asked, the basic ability to write and look back on the previous days and just generally keep myself in check. I hope some new innovative features can be added over time, as for what those could be? I don’t know to be honest, but anything different would be cool.

column9: Has to be on iPad and Mac

column10: Just perfect
Wish it was available for iPad Pro.

I’d like more style and customization options, a journaling app needs the ability to sort your entries into folders at the very least, I would like a double tap to edit your entries feature as opposed to opening the options and having to select edit.

the beauty of this app is lost with frustration

deep in thought i am venting into this journal…only for the page to keep jumping every few words 

it is SO annoying 
i really enjoy using this app but this flaw is seriously bad

you have to scroll down or up, start typing and it jumps again and again

such a simple feature to type without a glitch surely? 

apple pls do better :( pls update asap !!! xx

First of all, I would like to thank you for developing this much-needed application. I would like to make a few suggestions to make the application more user-friendly. 
 1- Entries in the Journal should be categorizable. For example, it would be better to see memories from a trip in categorized folders rather than mixed with short daily thoughts on the same page. 2- Entries could be viewable on a calendar. This way, someone who regularly keeps a diary can easily access information about what they did on this day 5 years ago. Or someone keeping a travel diary can track where they were on specific dates more easily.
It’s really simple to use and I like that a lot. I wish it could have the ‘find’ feature. Then it’ll get the cigar.

Why isn't it available for ipad? 
Need a ipad version for more writing space and not able to use pencil pen on iphones so make sense to have it for ipdad just my opinion.
I’m loving this new app. I would like to be able to share my journal with others and the availability to print.

column9: Can’t add title also support Apple Watch
column10: I love the app just wish it was compatible to the Apple Watch as well, being able to add titles would also make it more beneficial.
Please add voice to text feature.

Quite frankly I don’t want loads of bells and whistles. All I want is to write my thought and add photos, easily. This app does that. I would also like to print them sometimes as an aid to creating photobooks. I’m sure that will come. It’s good that you can add maps for when on holiday or sailing trips.

They’re onto something. Better to start using it now in the beginning rather than wait.

Would love multiple bookmarks. Can’t attach a playlist once in the entry, but can make one from the suggestions.

Would love to be able to attach a photo album to it rather than only individual pictures. Makes screen shots into a journal.

Amazing app, I use it literally every single day, I love that I can set an reminder through the app every day at 8pm and it’s so relaxing to use and it’s not overly complicated or overwhelming, it’s nice, simple and easy to you.
I would however like a key word search to make it easier to look through my entires and it would also be good to have a calendar search to quickly find what entries I submitted on that date.
It would make it easier to use the app without too many complications.
Apart from that, it’s beautiful and I will continue to use it daily❤️

Love the lay out of the journal and the ease of use HOWEVER there is no way to search! I have been using #keywords but there is no search function what so ever. This is a huge miss especially for an app by Apple, I’m sure it will be on there list shortly.
Please can you add a search facility and make it available on Mac :)
This could be a brilliant app but until it allows me to export my journal I’ll stick to journaling with a pen and paper.

column9: No searching by word nor folders
column10: It would be an amazing and perfect app if it had a search bar, hashtags and proper folders a bit like in notes app from Apple that I adore. Because of lack of those functionalities it renders the app very hard to use for me. Looking forward for updates….

column9: Need to improve user interface and more customisation
column10:
I like the app. It’s good and useful. 

Areas for improvement: 

The interface is pretty basic and there is only a top to bottom list view rather than a tile view for all the entires. More customisation would also be a welcome change. 

More control over formatting each entry rather than the basic pictures on top and text under it format. 

Allow color coding entries and sort by tag or other indicators

Would love to be able to sort my own entries. Unless there is a function and I’m not seeing it, but it seems like you can only bookmark certain entries. I wish I could sort entries into my own categories.
Crashes when I try to add a photo. Other than that I like the app.
Does your whole family have access to your journal if you are on family sharing

column9: It’s like notes but without the functionality
column10: Another reviewer wrote that and that’s exactly it. Plus there’s this awful issue with the screen scrolling up and down while you are writing. There are some positives, mostly aesthetics which is typical of apple, but the option of setting a reminder to journal is nice, though honestly that works with reminders and alarms and notes too. So I’m not seeing much that is unique with the added disadvantage of being irritated while writing due to the glitching.

Love the idea and started using it once I got it on my phone. Believed in feature-wise there are many more to developed and it is acceptable.

 My concern is more about the basic function, some words that I have typed will disappear or while typing, suddenly it will jump to another paragraph automatically.

Hope the issue can be solved and enable us to use the app on iPad so we could have more flexible on the journal like putting the picture wherever we want.

I REALLY don’t like that anyone who has your passcode can access the contents. Many people have at least one person in their life such as their spouse who knows their phone passcode. It doesn’t make sense that there isn’t the option for a custom passcode.

It’s honestly absurd that iOS doesn’t support this type of security. Basically anyone who has access to your passcode has admin privileges to a massive amount of sensitive apps and files.
The app should apply separate password íntead of  use the same password with cellphone.

Well, I wish there was a widget for the Journal. I still love the app though.

I journal and I do a planner typically that’s what I use my iPad for. Really nice to be able to use my phone to journal in now. I wish I had some type of planner with it. Maybe a scale down basic version of a planner like just a monthly or maybe just a to do list? But now if I’m somewhere and I’m over thinking or I need to remember or something happened and I want to make notes about it I have this journal I like it.

Only thing I think would be cool, if there was an option to have a different password or code to open instead same as phones passcode. Otherwise it’s so helpful to jot down feelings in a meltdown moment.

It keeps refreshing while I am typing that end up losing my writing repeatedly. 
Also the scrolling function is acting weird, the position of the journal or the cursor while typing is quite unpredictable and dumb.
I like the simplicity of the app, I just wish I had the option to change the background color. Also, it would be nice to have a reader mode. Other than that, it’s great!
I’m a huge journaler but only on devices where the keyboard isn’t two inches in length like the one on my iPhone. Please bring to iPad and I think more people would find it easier to journal!!

column9: Love the app, would like some upgrades
column10:
I have been looking for a journaling app that felt natural to use, like pen to paper.  And this one comes close at least for me.  I love the ability to add pictures and the hints or suggestions of topics to write about.  This is great for mental health.  Vacation memories or just day to day memories of life.

I would like to see more suggestions or maybe we could choose the topic the suggestions comes from.

I would like to be able to change the font and colors.  This maybe possible and I just haven’t found it yet.  But I do like to switch up the colors and even the thickness of the “pen” I write with when journaling.

Please make this available for iPad and with that upgrade allow the use of handwritten entries as well.  A long journal entry on an iPhone keyboard board is not easy for older hands or hands with medical issues.

column9: I actually really like this app but I wish it had a iPad version
column10: I really do enjoy using this app however I wish there was an iPad version. Just because I feel that I could do more with it with a larger screen however, on my phone is nice and it suggestion engine is actually really good. It allows me to go in and see possible suggestions for things that I never even thought of.
Best thing I’ve ever used. Now I can write the dumbest things on the planet and sing the pink panther theme into the microphone as much as I want to
The app is great, but without a search feature it will be difficult to navigate as the number of entries grows.  Please add search.

column9: Hope they keept it alive....and reflect
column10: This is it, apple nailed the idea how to formulate inspirations for your next entry with the potential of its ecosystem of devices and apps. Yet no export functions or ability to navigate through your entries like in an ordinary paper notebook stops me from investing my time to create the content there. If you value only the process of reflection and treat your content as a subproduct with no future use, it may work. Not for me at the moment.
Come on.... no iPad version, you have to be kidding me.

A great app but improvement is definitely needed. Where even is the “search” or “find” button for me to search for keywords on the things that ive written? Also, would be great if i can filter the journal by month so it’ll look more tidy and easy to search rather than having to scroll endlessly.

The app is pretty good, and I like how you can integrate the workouts from the day, and it gives suggestions for your entries, but I wish there was a way to import from other journal apps.
I know they probably released their pretty quickly so that people could start using it but I think a lot of people have hesitation to leave their other apps behind because there isn’t the option yet.
I started using the app and enjoyed but once I realized that I cannot export my entries I stopped. If I ever need to move them I won’t be able to so it’s not worth to use it anymore.

So far I really love using the Journal app. 
One thing, though: 
We need an iPad and Mac vision!

I love that it reminds me according to a schedule I set. It’s so easy to jot down memories daily and keep up. It’s also fun that it suggests things to write about based on where you’ve been. (Or creepy, lol, take your pick.) It would’ve been the perfect app for me except for one huge downfall: I can’t export my entries. They’re stuck only on my iOS devices.

column9: Won’t get off my home screen when I delete it
column10: Instead of just fading away, the icon just stays there with a minus mark on the top left, like it’s frozen and refuses to leave, this app is just garbage
This can be fun when I’ve time and patience to sit at my iPhone. But when I want to sit and type out some long form thoughts, I can’t, as it’s not available on my MacBook Air.

Why the h*ll isn’t there a way to restore accidentally deleted journals or entries? I have a journal with several voice note entries. I meant to expand the voice note but instead accidentally hit the ‘x’, apparently permanently deleting the voice note and completely ruining the context and flow of my entry. And there’s just no way to get that voice note back from what I’ve been able to find online 😡

column9: Best Journaling App for its simplicity, but add tags please
column10:
The app is great, intuitive and I really appreciate how you visualize things. It’s extremely useful that you have everything visible as a card. I do appreciate it more than any other apps. It does few stuff but incredibly good. I have a suggestion, which would be incredibly useful to everybody.

 It would be great to insert tags visible as a sticky menu above and horizontal which is scrollable. Just to give you an idea, what Muse diary did. This is super useful to navigate, and it allows customers to organizing stuff but having tags visible. With folders, there would be no difference with Note App, but with Tags it will still look as a Journaling App.

My biggest frustration with the app is that there is no undo button. So if you accidentally delete something it gone forever. The photos inserted get cut off and text is not customizable in terms of color or extra fonts and sizes.

So I had to give this app 1 star simply because I never downloaded it myself. In fact one night my phone wasn’t even plugged into the charger nor did I give my permission/accept/allow/approve (which normally it has to be) for not only my phone to update the software but to download an app over night which was odd. However I never used the app for those very reasons that I stated. And if u enjoy or like the app, then good for u.
Please add a feature where u can directly go to maps from a journal location entry
Make it available on laptop. Sure as f won’t be typing on phone for half hour.
I need it in my mac 🥲

If the cursor remained in sight and didn’t get covered by the keyboard this app would be 5-stars for me. 

This seems like a simple fix and I hope it is addressed in the next update. 

Otherwise - I love the minimalist interface and the setting to remove the daily prompts. This app is the reason I now have a daily journaling habit and I love it for that!

It’s just a little too buggy for more than 2-stars at the moment.

The idea of an app is cool. 
Thanks a lot for the automatic installation of such a useful app that is completely impossible to being used. There are soooooo many bugs. I can’t write anything at all! There is no space between the footer panel and the lowest row of the text. When I try to edit the text, it jumps everywhere, words disappear, actions cancels without my command. It’s a shame guys. So weird that simple text editor has such an amount of bugs. I’m disappointed. You gave me inspiration for writing and then fully destroyed it in a day. Thanks A LOT.

I was really excited to use this app. I have been using the Notes app to Journal using voice to text for the past year or so, and I have known that it is really just not the best app for the job. So when the Journal app suddenly showed up on my phone, I opened it and it looked like exactly what I needed. I thought it was great that I could add pictures and videos in. This could allow my journaling to really advance and be so much more fun to look back on. Unfortunately, it just doesn’t work very well. As I mentioned, I like to use voice to text to Journal. I have physical limitations with my hands so it’s really the only way for me to Journal. Unfortunately it is just not smart. The most annoying thing, which really shouldn’t be a thing at all in 2024, is that the screen doesn’t scroll as I speak, so once I have more than a paragraph or two, I can’t see what is being typed anymore. I can scroll down, but it will scroll back up to the top for no reason and I just have to hope that when I’m done talking the text will be there. It’s so much fun to dictate my journal for five minutes just to find out that the app stopped listening again for no apparent reason about 30 seconds in and I didn’t notice it because the app makes it impossible to see the text that is being added as I dictate. Why put out software that isn’t finished? Just polish the code a bit. Have another set of eyes take a look. Maybe do some testing.

Updated: When will embedded search function be added? And indexing into Siri Search? 

very much look forward to the day, where the Apple journal app can replace my current digital journal. However, in its current state, it lacks necessary features. once this app has all of the features that Day One has, it may just take the cake.

column9: Love it in iphone, need it on macbook, ipad
column10: It is a great app which is built to suit the requirements. One drawback is that it is for iphone only and not for macbook or ipad

The idea of the app is great but in fact the app isn’t ready to compete with other similar services. 
Please, add a feature to share notes with a therapist, make a calendar or something to track notes. 
And fix a bug: I’ve got iPhone 14 pro and when I’m typing all the text accidentally scrolls up and makes me unable to see what I’m currently typing. I have to scroll down several times to complete my note. 
Btw the recommendations for notes are great, make it filled more with other things.

column9: Great potential app, need desktop version
column10: I so like an idea of this app. Integrations with apple services, notifications to not forget do describe some event in your life. But it’s just inconvenient to type on mobile, I wish there is a desktop or at least Ipad version so I can use a normal keyboard

Great design as typical of Apple’s native apps. Missing features like multiple journals or different views of entries. The entry recommendations are nice, but I’d like to see the app fleshed out a bit.
Some bug frequently deletes last typed words, forcing to type them again

I don’t really write in the iPhone although I do journal my thoughts. It would be better if the journal app was on iPad where I do all my writing. It only makes sense and I don’t know why it didn’t get introduced to the iPad in the first place.

Could use more features like drawing tools, bullet points, an option to use different fonts, create folders for specific journal entries, ability to save photos taken within the entry to photos, and notification reflection suggestions

I  am really enjoying this app! I was curious one night and opened it up and realized that the suggestions were great. I instantly started my first entry. I see it as easy as posting on social media but for my eyes only. I really like this approach. 
I wish I would of had it on a recent trip overseas . It would make a great travel journal because it also gives you suggestions from maps, etc. I am currently using it as an everything journal. I journal about big events (thanks to suggestions), things I am listening to, prompts, etc. it’s all very easy and intuitive. I am curious to see further updates. I also love that there is really no wrong way to use this app. Write one sentence or a few paragraphs. It’s totally up to the user. Write everyday, once a week, or whenever. It is all up to the user. For a person who always wanted to journal but usually abandoned it after a few entries, this iPhone version of Journal is working for me.

Is such a great app. It enabled me to start off my journaling journey, that I’ve been procrastinating over 7 months. Well, the most interesting thing about it, is it’s linked to your iCloud so it gives out  suggestions based on you recent activities like; new pictures, a song that was on repeat for quite a while and many more. I really enjoying the slick and interactive nature of the app. And I hope they release the Mac Version soon. 😊

column9: really good in helping to reflect
column10: i’ve been using the notes app forever to look back on my mistakes and jot down my feelings (like a diary bc i’m too lazy to write w my hand) but with the journal app i can not only do both, but the app gives me prompts that really open my eyes on things. it’s kinda like a digital sketch book lol 10/10

I have location sharing completely off for this app, but it still knows I where go.

Is there any option to turn this off?

The Journal is a great new invention by Apple as it gives you an option to share your experiences and achievements with you and you alone. You can add anything important to it, acknowledge what you did and review it all. Awesome!

I thought the app seemed nice, but it kept tracking my location. Even though I had location services off I would still get notifications saying something like, “Journal about your time at ________ location.” I don’t like having apps track me when it’s unnecessary, especially since I said no to tracking my location.

My sister turned off location tracking, but the app still tracks her location.

For example, a prompt will be: “tell me about your night at ______ location”

The app should not be allowed to track her location since it’s turned off, and the fact that Apple is lying about this feature is unsettling.

I have been trying to find a journaling app for a while. I was so excited when this was downloaded on the update. This is bringing me back to the online journals from the early 2000s. I agree with the above review that I hope it comes out on iPads. But otherwise I am enjoying this app!

I’ve been vibing with this journal app lately, it’s a solid tool for daily writing and Super easy to use and all that jazz. However, there’s a little problem– it deletes content If you forget to hit save after every sentence poof, your words vanish. It’s like my thoughts are playing hide and seek and it’s a bit annoying. Dev team, if you’re out there, a fix for this would be awesome! 🙏
Disappointed with the limited number of photos and videos that can be added to an entry
I wish it was available on iPad ! It’s way too basic but great to see something on journal
To Export into a printing layout would be nice - will this be possible?

Thank you for a journaling app! 
But please please add a search feature.

Journals are a great tool for reflection I’d love to be able to search for key words, like “joy”, “discouragement”, the names of friends, etc.

Love the app but right now I only update and write about special days (birthdays, parties, holidays, etc.).
But I would really love to write every day reflections. But for that I would like to have Maps. So maybe one map I could name “best moments” and one map “journaling”.

Nice app. 
Want to see and write on iPad and MacBook or maybe on iCloud web.

been looking for a simple journal app from a long time ago, and this app is perfect for me! I love the simplicity of it, and I love how it feels like it only need small efforts to make a new entry

but if possible, I really need more feature in the filter, especially for the entry that was bookmarked. I mean what’s the point of bookmarking if I can’t find it easily?

but overall it’s a great app! thank you!

I love this app and have used it everyday since it arrived.  It could be 5 stars with a few additions.  

First, an iPad/mac version and cross-device syncing. It would be nice to type on a keyboard. 

Second, calendar view and searching.  I already have a lot of entries and it’d be nice to be able to view and search them, instead of scrolling one direction.

I like this app for many reasons and began using it with ease right away. As an artist/teacher, I use it first thing in the AM before I go to work. Then on the weekends when I have to to process and expand on life and my experiences, I can go back and pick out things to sketch, create or honestly for me, just remember. 

This app is much of the reason I ever post on Facebook. Journaling and memories. This app makes that commentary that I mostly want to leave for myself as a memory keeper, more private. 

My only wish so far is that it was available on my iPad. I do not enjoy typing on my phone. I use this in the morning when my family is sleeping and I don’t want to wake anyone by using speak to text. So being able to type would allow me to use more. 

I do hope this happens sooner than later. Thanks for creating what I consider for my own creative, busy self, a very useful tool.

Great for causal entry and will mostly do the job 

Issues: 
-using the text to talk feature was very buggy, mess up a lot of words, and sometimes put them in this in the wrong order. 

-improvements need to be made to the lock feature of the Journal. There needs to be an option for a separate pin. That is not your iPhone entry pin similarly to guided access settings

- Needs more ways to organize the journal entries such as folders or individual note books in the app. After all people journal for various different reasons.

-include font changing options and text option changes

Hope to see some of these changes soon, thanks
Can we have a blur on the preview of the journal app? I wrote some very personal things on there and anyone can read it as soon as I open it.

column9: I love it but ONE THING is MISSING!
column10:
PLEASE FIX THIS!
The app is seemly simple and good for journaling.
However a search function like in the notes app is missing so you can find specific days, because you can search for them, at the moment you have to scroll all the way down and find it, which is impossible!
Thank you, I appreciate the app!

column9: Nice to have Search and Group functions.
column10:
It would be nice to have “Search” feature so end users can easily find the relevant entry by key words, especially when the entries are becoming more and more every day.
“Group” or “Tag” features are also quite important for better organise the diary content in a more structured way.
Pls add the features! Thank you!
Would be nice if you could have custom passwords to the journals instead of just using the iPhone one
after uploading video, photo... we could not down load it back.

column9: Love the app, but needs a port to iPad and Mac!
