column9: Good app but it lacks some features
column10: The app is really simple which is good, but it lacks of a Bookmark by categories feature. I like to write meditations and phrases throughout the day, after inputting a lot of entries it seems impossible to trace back specific ones.

I’m frustrated that app keeps deleting my words as I’m writing them. That is frustrating as I’ll write and all of a sudden the words from the sentence I’ve started disappear. I just started using this app so I don’t know if it a glitch. I like the app  it needs some work.

So you see when I had a journal that I had to carry around make sure it was with me. It was too stressful especially because I’m a schoolgirl and it’s just people are nosy soooooooooooooooooooooo nosy so Journal was a great app for me I didn’t have to take it everywhere. I could just write in it when I got home I love. journal.🦋

So I honestly never thought I would have an app like this on my phone and I have no clue why the rating is so low bc it’s such a great app!
Really it started with me seeing it appear on my home screen and I was like “This looks kinda cute!” And I opened it and then I was like “Ugh Journaling…” I have never been a fan of writing at all in my diary bc my hand always hurts at the end I never told myself to do it. But I’m actually so much better than typing since I use it way more in my daily life. It’s good to write down memories and so far I haven’t had a bad things about it. I love how everyday they give you suggestion on what to write about. I’m proud of myself for writing in it everyday! Overall it’s a great app and I suggest more ppl to use it!
This all has just wiped all my entries and ceased to even work

column9: More text and photo/video options needed
column10:
This app needs to be able to have more text editing options like on the notes app and be able to attach photos videos in between paragraphs. A doodle option would be nice too. I don’t understand why they would put in the effort to make a journal app that’s a just a lesser version of the notes app. I was really excited when this came out and I think it has a lot of potential… I love the privacy settings and prompts.

It’s also sooooooo glitchy.
Stop auto scrolling to the top every time I add a new paragraph.
I wish this was available on Mac
Please fix the issue where the arrow continuously moves down when editing the text. This happens regularly. Please focus on solving the problem. Thank you!

I enjoy using this app and how I can quickly use it to journal my thoughts or etc. However, when I am trying type my thoughts the cursor constantly jumps all over the page and the app tries to automatically correct my thoughts or diverts back to something that was previously typed, but erased. I believe that is a bug that needs to be fixed and updated. Other than that I really enjoy this app. 

Hopefully these things are fixed soon.
Need to add SEARCH, TAG, DATE STAMP, DATE TIME LABELS. I hope they quickly add these features and more.

column9: Great potential, with more features would be amazing
column10:
I’d love to see the ability to see how long a phone call was, sort through all your past phone calls or text conversations, as it will suggest some phone calls but not all. Another thing is, I take photos with my camera and add them to my iPhotos, but the journal only seems to let me add photos from my phone itself. What would be sooooooo amazing would be if I could easily attach the recent DSLR photos from my camera roll and then have it intelligently put them together with photos from my camera around that same time. And then could even suggest adding a location to those photos, as that is something I usually have to do manually. Feel like there’s a ton of potential in this app being a way to nicely Interface with your photos/exercises/phone calls/etc and reflect/organize them, some additional features would be great to have. Another annoyance is there’s no way to set default date to be the date of the activity. I am going back and writing about things from this week, each one I have to manually select to use the original date not todays date.

Edit: another very useful thing would be the ability to integrate with Apple health’s state of mind features: make a journal based off a recent state of mind entry, or be able to be prompted to do one after the other (maybe you can be prompted to do state of mind first in this app, then journal, and have it display together; or after you do it in the health app you can have it prompt you to do a journal entry, but that’s harder cause there are many different journal apps maybe they don’t want to explicitly plug this app there)
It is soooo awesome it helps me everyday I highly recommend it for this app.

column9: Difficult to write in really long journals

This journal is nothing more than a basic note taking app with Face ID.

I'm sure there's thousands of good journal/qotd prompts out there just find and use em

I agree with everyone else. Needs a bit more I’ve never been a journal on phone type. This app is a good entry to it. But I want it to expand which I know it will! Keep working on it. Has the potential to be amazing and help a lot of people. Because I believe journaling is a necessity to human condition! We have to all peacefully write our thoughts somewhere safe and free.

I love the new journal app. So many things are going on in my life I need to get out and notes just doesn’t have the same feeling. I just want to know Journal is completely safe from hackers and is bug free otherwise great.

column9: Nearly Unusable - Day One is way better

I really tried with this app - makes no sense how poorly this app was ‘optimized’ - I literally have to retype the same sentence multiple times because it keeps being deleted as I’m typing it.

It has all the makings of a good app - but I can’t type on a journaling app. That’s like not being able to see your balance on a banking app. Lots of work to be done on here. Sad because it integrates a lot of the information your phone provides.
Will be awesome if you give us the option to share our content if we wish too, and save button. Will be great if you give us the option for searching!

Idk where to write that. 
I love the app!!!! It's more a gadget but for me it's sooo usefull

I would add something to see for the times we edit the writing, and at which time.

column9: i love it but i get annoyed
column10: i have never really kept up with diaries and all that stuff. but i figured this would be a cute and fun way to look back on my past when i’m older so i started writing. and i really do like it. it’s very easy and fun to right in. it’s like i’m gossiping with a friend that can’t talk back to me and is just listening. anyways my only two complaints so far would be that whenever i’m typing sometimes if i pause or delete a word it will automatically go back up to the top of the screen and then scroll back down when i keep typing. it’s not a huge thing but it irks me when i’m writing a lot and then it does that and it throughs me off. also i would personally like to be able to add more specific pictures and music. i like adding that into my daily journal so that i can look back and see what i was doing on that day but it’s a little difficult when i can’t choose the specific ones i want. like if i’m listening to a sleep playlist it automatically chooses that as the music i was listening to throughout the day even though it wasn’t. so that’s frustrating and then the pictures are just like sometimes i take pictures of my work or random things and not rly a “memory” but it won’t let me specifically choose the one i want. but that’s it everything else i love. it works well.

column9: Please come out with a iPad and/or desktop app
column10: I would absolutely adore this app if I could use it from my iPad or laptop. Right now my entries are short simply because I don’t like writing long form content on my phone. Please add this to the iPad/mac suite of apps so I can type my entries instead of ‘tap’ them.

Its a great app to use. There can be a lot of features added. Examples
1. Titles to the entries
2. A mood bar that evaluates overall mood
3. Search bar to look up entires
4. Add it to icloud apps so we can write on a windows browser. 
5. Themes, more colors etc.

column9: Needs some glitch fixes and DEFINITELY want on my Mac!
column10: I love the reflections! Being able to add photos and locations is also super fun. I feel like there is a lot of potential for more features here, like the ability to arrange content myself or add comments to photos, change fonts, colors, or add stickers to the page. Only problem I’ve had has been screen glitches where the app will close out while I’m in the middle of typing or I can be inside of an entry and need to make an edit at the top, then all of a sudden my cursor is forced to the bottom of the page in the middle of a word, which is pretty annoying and it happens often. Still love the app! Hope to see it on Mac soon!!

I’m happy that this app was created! I find myself journaling more often. However I would like custom schedules. I can’t journal at the same time every day, and the app only lets you set a single schedule to either repeat everyday, or be turned off for specific days. It would be great to be able save multiple schedules and to presave and assign a prompt to a schedule.
I really like the concept of this new app from Apple. I just wish it was easier to add external media such as gifs and stock images.

column9: Feature requests: Shared entries & photos to past entries
column10:
My partner and I keep a weekend journal- just a few bullet points in a notes app to remind us of all of the fun things we get up to. I love the potential of this app to relieve my notes app- but am missing the ability to share posts. Would love to be able to add the photos from my phone AND his phone. Would love to be able to get that functionality. 

Additionally, would love to be able to, from the native photos app, add a photo to a past entry. Currently, when I go from photos to journal, it starts a new post.
Have nothing to complain, but I would like to have options to choose different layouts to view my notes.

column10: IM LITERALLY TRYING TO FREAKING JOURNAL FOR THE PEACE AND LOVE OR WHATEVER AND THE SLIGHT SCROLL UP EVERYTIME I REACH A NEW LINE MAKES ME FEELING EVEN MORE ANXIOUS AND FRUSTRATED AND MAD AND I WANT TO THROW MY FREAKING PHONE ACROSS THE ROOM PLS FIX THIS OMG

column9: way too easy to delete entries
column10:

Next, a nice feature would be a return arrow  button, as i often make mistakes and it is all to easy to delete an entire paragraph. 

I believe these features would help the users to feel more relaxed when using the app. 

(I also agree with the reviews of having an additional search bar)

this app really helped me start journaling daily. The convenience and simplicity is what I really needed to start.

I want to see my record in MacBook

i really love the ability to connect with our phone in such a way that we can use a recent call or photos to add in pretty effortlessly. i would love for this to be iPad compatible with apple pencil compatibility. it'd be really nice to be able to treat that like a real journal but with the connection of all the memories we store digitally so easily.
I love it. I just have one suggestion, could they also have it on my iPad. I’m used to writing with my Apple Pencil too.  Other than that it’s an amazing app :)
The premise is good but it’s missing just a couple things Allowing us to search posts/entries would be the top one for me at the moment. Simple feature and yet it’s missing.

column9: Wish for app for Mac too
column10: I like this app a lot, I would only love it I could link it with some app on mac, so I could write from both of my devices.
I love this app

Only posting this so that the app developers realize and fix the following issue: when trying to edit a journal entry, the cursor line frequently, (if not every time) jumps to the end of the entry. This has been an issue since it’s release, and is a shared issue amongst many forums online. Great app idea, but currently not practical until this is fixed!
It’s pretty good because you can add pictures and you can write a lot of things that happened in your life for the day and it’s like a diary!

column9: Notes offers much better text edition options
column10:
While I like the simple design of he app and the journal reminders, the text edition is hell and clunky.

I wanted to copy in a numbered list from elsewhere and answer each point on my own behalf. I keep being sent to the bottom and can’t break off the list.

Beautiful app but way too minimalistic. Would be nice to have more features to suggest ideas to write down (things to be grateful of, learned today, stuff to rethink, positives/negatives, etc). More AI features to suggest notable events based on location, apps use). 

App for iPad OS is a must. We need to use keyboard to write and bigger screen. I am not going to dictate my Journal.

I use this app actually since release, and it helps me so much. Rarely happens to me, so here a review from someone who has adhd and really needs a journal to sort their head. What I need: 1. tag system. And a search function for said tag system. 2. time limit for videos (app can’t save big data, so it would be great to know). Or give us possibility to cut videos. 3. theme based questions from the app (what’s your favourite movie and why? Which game replayed you the most? Which person of history do you admire and why?) Just some individual here, but it would be helpful. Also I love the layout and handling. Keep it simple and don’t „overdo this“. And please, no more reminders or stats or anything. Let us just co exist in humble silence.

I’m trying to use this app, I want to use this app but I’m still forced to use Notes or another Journaling app instead because of these bugs that are so annoying: 
1. can’t move the cursor to anywhere in the text to make changes without the cursor automatically moving back to the end of the entry all by itself. Very frustrating. -1 ⭐️ 
2. Once you start a numbered list like I have here, you cannot change the format back to a regular sentence or paragraph. -1 ⭐️ 
3. Can’t change the font style at all like you can with Notes. Everything is bold, can’t underline, can’t change any of that. -1 ⭐️ 

Fix these simple bugs and I will update the review and use the app. Thanks.

I mostly enjoy the simplicity of the app because if I had too many options, I would lose focus on my thoughts, but I REALLY hate that you can’t manually add a song to a previous entry.  You either have to start a new entry by sharing from the Apple Music app, or else you have to try and pick from songs that the app has decided matter.  I also wish it had the ability to add bullet points.
This app should be available on ipad.

Improvements:
• text styling like apple notes (adding headsets and subheadings)
• search function
•streaks
• smoother, as I type longer paragraphs it will sometimes shoot my cursor up to the top of screen

Great app, and I keep on using it in hopes that it will get better.
Add time next to day and date. I need to know when exactly I wrote what I wrote.

Hey Apple! How about adding a time stamp to each entry. I like to look back and see not only the day but the time. Also some personalized backgrounds or color schemes would be nice. Thanks and I hope you take this into consideration.

column9: Great potential, please add search date feature
column10: It would be great to be able to search specific dates so I can know what I did on a certain date. I do love how easy to use this app is!

Love the app so far and excited to see the updates and added features in the future. Many reviews here already mention a lot of features I’d like to see (ex. Tagging, search etc) but one important feature I think would be great is to share or add contributors to selected journal entries.

column9: Has a long way to go…

column9: Privacy. Make the app itself have a password, passcode or lock.
column10: Lock the app.

Why on earth you wouldn’t make this available on the iPad as well, is beyond me! I like that it suggests ideas and I can reflect on my activities but I don’t want to write extensively about my feelings using my thumbs..it’s uncomfortable!

I love the simplicity of this app. I also love that it just showed up with the most recent update. If there is one thing I don’t like about it, it would be that there’s no way to customize your journal! No background, colors, fonts, or other fun details that add a more personalized feel that’s catered to everyone. I’d like to be able to set my background to a particular photo, or theme, and add stickers to an entry. The options are endless😁
Much better than Day One and it is free. I feel my data is much more protected too.

column9: keep it simple, keep it excellent
column10: I like that it is almost as simple as a plain text editor. I hope the iPad version will come up soon.

column9: Thé journal app didnt load today
column10: So when I opened the journal app today to write, it just showed me a purple screen and didn’t ask me for my password as it normally does. I have closed and opened it several times , nothing changed.

If you write a lot of text you can’t “scroll” to get the bit you’re writing in the middle like normal, it gets stuck with the text you’re trying to write half hidden by the keyboard, really annoying and needs an update. Did no one test this before launching? Is the app even finished?
I really appreciate how simple the app is as there aren’t distracting features that keep me from just writing. That being said, I would appreciate a search feature. Thanks!

I love the simplistic clean design, very Apple. I have only wrote a couple of journal now and I love how you can add pictures and the prompts on what to write. Unlike in a handwritten journal nobody will find this! It’s great, no complaints from me.

I love its purpose, I use it to help me remember things I normally forget I did. However, I think it is extremely simple, I would like to try new features. I think it would be great to have a search engine to find old notes. I would also like to add sentiment stickers and other information. It might be useful to link this app with Apple Health to have a complete record of my daily life.
When it will be available for MacOS?

- should be available on Ipad who wants to write their whole day on a small iphone screen 
- am i the only one who types words then it automatically deletes itself? very frustrating
I like the app and its purpose since it helps me a lot to stay calm these days. However, I would love it so much if it has themes. I want it to be customizable to really reflect myself.
Please put an UNDO BUTTON, a huge part of what i was writing got deleted and got replaced with a letter huhu

It’s okay and fun to use, makes good suggestions about photos and strolls and all. I like that, but 
a) why the heck is this app not on Mac and iPad. I mean I couldn’t dream of a better place to write journals than a mac’s keyboard. Who would want to type of a phone.
b) navigate the app feels half-baked unlike other Apple apps. Editing a journal isn’t that intuitive
c) missing a lot of features such as placing photos between text, and styling fonts adm scribbling

A lot of room for improvement
Would appreciate a feature to sync the journals to cloud and let users export them in some excel format.

I have been so happy with this app. have been typing into it many times a week and now i can't type anything what's wrong? I have restarted the app and taken it out and put it back in but nothing changes.

column9: App crashing when I clear something I wrote
column10: I had a written numbered point on notes which I copied from notes and pasted on Journal now when I press the backspace on keyboard in the same entry it closes the app. Probably crashes.

column9: Laggy to the point of unusability
column10: See above. Try to journal. I dare you. You’ll see.
If you like writing. This is your app 💭

Thank you for implementing this app with the update. I’m sure it’s helped many, many people. I personally feel that an immense amount of people (and their mental health) can benefit from a form of journaling. This app has made it easier than ever for me to quickly jot down my feelings/thoughts/emotions and the interface is aesthetically pleasing. I also love the prompts provided to help me get my thought process started. Great, great app overall, especially for bring free!

column9: Great but could use something more
column10: This app is so good when it comes to the suggestions. I wish the layout could have a couple different options. But the thing that would make this even better is the option to export it to PDF. Who knows maybe one day I want to create a physical copy of my journal and would need that option.

I wish I could categorize my entries with tags. It would also be nice to be able to search for specific words referenced in the entries. I would also loooove to be able to use this app on my iPad with the Apple Pencil. I know there are many other digital journaling methods that would allow this, but I am really enjoying the simplicity and traditional Apple feel of this Journal app.

I have an iPhone 14 plus; I use for 4 things: a phone, short texts on the fly, a calendar keeper, and a camera. Yes, I know it can do so much more, and for many of those things I use my iPad or Mac. Why? The keyboard on the phone is too stinking small for my big fingers and since all three devices work as one for the most part I prefer to use the bigger keyboards. I have read several reviews and it seems to be a good app, but until it's available on the larger devices I won't be using this app.

column9: I love using this journal app
column10:
I really like using this journal app so far. I never thought I would ever use a journaling app, but I’ve been using it ever since it came out. 

The issue I have with it is I haven’t found the ability to make the text size bigger. I have low vision and it’s hard for me to read the default text size.

This is a good concept but there are some things I would want added: you can only write in bold which can be very annoying, there is no way to share any of your posts, you can not add any icons of individual songs only the ones they recommend and I would like for there to be some way to search for old post that is not scrolling.

column9: Great start, search function and others would be great!
column10: Love the minimalist and intuitive interface but would love a search function to look for a specific date or word! Also ended up using it more like a diary so it’d be great if I could turn off the journaling prompts.

column9: It’s great but I want this to be noticed.
column10:
Why is there no back button to undo a delete? 
Why is there no deleted section?
Why is it locked on vertical mode?

I like  idea of this app, it’s ability to be locked with FaceID is also nice but it’s lacking a lot of functionality that is in  inherently in Notes which I don’t quite understand.  

Journals should be more than writing self expression, they are creative outlets in many ways and I think this app should reflect that.  

Another issue is classic to Apple when writing large walls of text, the cursor goes all screwy and the auto grammar correct is so annoying

column9: It’s good, it works the way it’s supposed to, but one suggestion
column10: I think the journal app is good, it works like it’s supposed to, it has various abilities that are good for journaling. The UI is pleasant and nice. However, it would be neat to have the ability to create different journals, folders, or some organization system because I have been trying to find an app that would allow me to keep separate journals for just personal daily use and especially for tracking my dreams after I wake up. I think adding a journals, folders, or some organization system could really improve this app so much as it is only one single journal at the moment.

I wanted this to be good and I want to use it but unfortunately it’s full of glitches.

When typing, it jumps up and down the page and randomly deletes recent text as I’m writing it! Very frustrating!

The addition of recent events etc. needs improving to be able to add anything from other apps used that day. At the moment I only seem able to add events from Apple apps i.e. Apply Music, Apple Podcasts, Apple Photos… I can’t seem to add items from third party apps for example Spotify, Kindle, Netflix etc. It would be useful to allow the app to access all apps to add events from them, especially purchases, viewing, listening and social media apps. 

I’ll keep using it (for now) in the hope an update addresses the glitches and improved interactivity. If not, I’ll be offloading it. 

Here’s hoping.

The app has many features that are spot on but missing two important things for me:
- can’t export or import
- can’t create tags (would be nice to have multiple tag capability)

column9: Please update/fix before I start using it
column10:
I was thrilled when this popped up on my phone! I immediately opened it to see what it was about and it’s (almost) everything I wanted in a journal… (almost).

I want to be able to use it on my phone AND MacBook - why is it literally only available on iPhone- not even iPad?! Reading other reviews have me excited and nervous at the same time… 

I really want to use it, but some updates/upgrades have to happen first.

Please
Journals uses the iCloud as storage and therefor isn’t able to store anything if you don’t have a large, paid for storage account.
Needs a calendar view for dates of entry and a search feature

Awesome concept but poor capabilities.
Unable to edit text conveniently. When you are inserting text or any content, after pressing ‘Enter’ to add next line, it jumps all the way at the end of the content, which is extremely annoying. Plus having hard time to insert content the way I would like to arrange. Many links, just show the link symbol but not content associated with it.
This app has a tremendous potential if developed properly.

Apple always does a slow drip of adding features but it crazy stupid that tags which are in Notes don’t exist in this app from day one in 2024.

It would take your developers 5 minutes to add that feature.
I loved to receive this app on my device automatically with the latest IOS update. I started to use it immediately but I need a laptop version too :-)

I was looking forward to this app. I started using it but I noticed that whenever I have a long text and I a new line is started, the screen jumps to the begining and comes back to my new line. It is very annoying, please fix this bug.

column9: Didn’t want to like this app
column10: This app auto installed on my phone with the latest iOS update. Immediately thought it was ridiculous…. quickly realized it’s not. I set mine up to remind me every day to journal and it also has an option to give you ideas for what to journal and you can add pictures or places on the map. It’s helps tremendously to express your current frustration or excitement on paper and then move on. You can hide the icon so no one accidentally clicks on it and reads your “diary” 😉 But I’m really loving this app so far!

column9: Love it on iPhone, Need it on iPad
column10:
This app uploaded with the last upgrade on my iPhone. 
Would love to also have it on iPad, so that they can sync. 
That way i can journal on the go,l with my iPhone, AND when seated at my table with my tablet
I hope that in the next update I will be able to divide it into many sections like each notebook for many writing purposes, thank you very much.

Not sure why they released an early beta-quality version of this product as an official release like they did something meaningful. poor app. i’m sure one day it will be, at best, adequate. at least it’s free but honestly, you might as well use the Notes app, this thing is so trash.

I really like the is app. Great for me to record my day when on vacation traveling and maybe I will continue to use for daily life. My memory is not so good so it is a good tool for me. I wish I could add more than 10 photos per day. The reason I am giving it two stars is that when I write it keeps deleting it. I will write a sentence then pause to think about next sentence and poof 💨 what I just wrote is gone.  I have to click done after each sentence to get it to save.  Very annoying. Please fix!  I’d attach a screen recording of this if I could.

column9: Make it for all the devices please!
column10: You make most of your apps compatible for your devices why not this one? Not just the phone please
I saw this app pop up on my phone update. I thought I’d try it. I really like it. I can put encouraging things for each day to help me with my mental health.
I think this is a new app but whatever give it a chance guys who knows it might be good one day

There are pros and cons to this app:

Pros:
- I love the layout of this app. 
- Its great that I can set a reminder to write in it just before I go to bed. I never forget
- I like being able to attach photos

Cons:
- A big one for me: no option to print or export as pdf. Come on Apple 
- Not being able to filter by the month/year 
- No option for fonts

These are simple fixes that would make the app perfect. Please do an update and get with the programme!
Hey, Apple developers - why don’t you roll out iPad and desktop version as well?
No iPad support at launch? Really? $1,600 for an iPad Pro, $350 for a Magic Keyboard and I can only type on my journal with my iPhone? Will give better review when it’s on iPad.
I’m supposed to spend even more time tapping into my phone’s tiny screen?! Seriously, Applelites, what were you thinking?
it’s an amazing app but i wish wish wish wish WISHH it was on iPad!! ive been using on iPhone and was so excited to use on iPad with apple pencil but its not available :(
This is a cool app for the iPhone, but it doesn’t seem right that there isn’t a version for MacBook. A Journal app should be MacBook and iPad compatible. Unless I’m missing something?

The app repeatedly automatically forces the cursor to the very end of the entry. If you go backward to add writing or edit anything this bug makes it difficult to write. It forces you to the end so you have to scroll back trying to find where you were attempting to add writing. It is a pain. This bug needs to be fixed.

• Template functions
• Quote of the Day
• Export Functions
• Interacts with apps
Good idea, but needs updates like not skipping lines when you’re trying to type something.
A nice and well-put app. The only missing feature is the ability to add tags to entries
My phone died, now all my entires are gone. Much sad.
It just froze - pls fix this

It might be helpful to have an easy way to journal that is already linked to my locations, photos, family… but there is no export or sharing capability.  This app lets you stare at your phone and tap with your thumbs for a while and then the time is gone.  If you’re trying to tell a story to anyone else you’re out of luck

column9: Neat app- needs to be on iMac.
column10: I’ve always been one to journal & log about my day, and I enjoy certain features within the app. I truly just wish it was available on iMac, would make it much easier.

It's an overall nice app but often when i happen to be writing an entry or so the letters i type suddenly don't appear in the entry unless i exit and it sometimes saves some and other times its fully gone. I hope this bug is fixed🩷.
I love writing on this app and i like that i can record a voice and upload photos. I just wish I can organized my journal like the notes app.

Aesthetically pleasing, streamlined, and enjoyable. No unnecessary functions. 

Thanks Apple
I downloaded this app on my phone and love it. I was so disappointed today when I realized there isn’t an iPad version. Any chance one is coming?

So I like the app I do I do. But I wish there was more opinions for how one would like to journal. I wish there was a way to change the size, colors, and font of text if wanted. A place you can doodle with different colors. But I will say the prompt are cute. But I wish we can make our own prompts as well or add stickers would be nice. Make it more like a journal.

I like the app a lot and especially like all the things you can add to your journal entries, they really allow you to record memories nicely.  The only things I wish are that I’d be able to write/draw like you can in the notes app. It’s just fun and cute lol. Also, it would be cool to be able to share the entry with somebody like the notes app, like to have a collaborative entry.

column9: Missing IPad Support is an opportunity missed.
column10:
I absolutely love the idea of an Apple supported journal app. I was excited to use on my iPad Pro but realized it’s only supported on iPhone. 
I personally have no desire to write long paragraphs or thoughts on a tiny phone keyboard. I will not use this app until iPad / Mac full keyboard support is enabled.

column9: Doesn’t sync with MacBook or iPad
column10: What a dumb idea to release a journal app that can only be used on a phone.
Needs a mac companion app, and sesrch function. Very bare bones the way it is now. Has great potential though!

column9: No iPad and no Mac App
column10: Why? I don’t wart to write only on my iPhone. 👎🏼

Where are the gifs memojis stickers?.. I would prefer more options to make it more personal. To add different style or background photos. I could just download a note taking app and do everything on that tho.

Whilst I am typing or I am putting things into the app that I have copied and pasted for some odd reason it keeps on scrolling up to the very top. It usually gets to this stage whenever I have written more than what seems like a screen full of page. This is really frustrating because the more I write means the more I have to then scroll down again to finish off my sentence. Regardless of whether it’s just when I am copy or pasting, when I write more than one page full then it starts to randomly as I am typing go all the way to the top. Please fix this. I enjoy using this app because of the layout and it is easy to navigate but the scrolling to the top is really testing my patience.
Needs sooo many more features to actually be useful. Really disappointing to have waited so long for this.
I love this app so much, but the problem it’s not working with ipad.
I want to use this but I need something I can use on laptop, iPad and iPhone. Also, how is this really better than Notes?
I wish you could add a background to the stuff tho

I found this app for the first time less than 30 days ago. It’s great! I love Apple’s seamless integration and inclusion of unique content suited for you. I wish it had more filter or sorting options to sort by a date range, see unique timestamps on creation date, and maybe even have folders or tags. Please consider these features!

EDIT: Oh, and please make files downloadable within the app. I’d like to download any file I add, whether PDF or a photo.

I am trying to use this for documenting my day and take sermon notes. Some issues: when adding a photo it goes right to the top instead of where the text is in the body; when typing after a while it would undo things randomly, but often. Very frustrating. A waste of time. Hopefully updates will fix this. 

I hope they update soon and make it much better. I am totally willing to make use of this app. But will they take it away like iDVD and Music Memos if I begin to like it?
Please add a feature where we can search for keywords so we can find specific journals written.

It defies belief that there is not the ability to search at all in the app. The whole point of a journal is so you don’t have to keep them in your head, and to be able to locate them later. Unable to use the app or give it more than 1 star until this is added.

Without having to retype a prompt into your journal entry so you remember what the prompt was, I would love if the prompt saved in the entry itself! Maybe provide the option to delete it for users who don’t need/want the prompt to be visible but personally, I would LOVE if the prompt automatically saved within the entry for future reference.

Journal is slick and clean and everything you would hope for from an Apple app. It genuinely makes it easy and enticing to journal. Pop it open, maybe select from the auto-generated list of suggested items and make a note about your day. Would love to use it and replace Day One (my current journaling app), BUT… it is missing some basic features that would indicate it is here to stay, rather than being an exploratory “hmm, maybe this could be cool” app that Apple might retire in a couple of years (remember Music Memos?) 

Until it is available on iPadOS and macOS, until there is at least a Notes-like tagging and folder system, and most importantly until there is an option to batch export in some clean markdown format that guarantees we will retain control of our notes and be able to access them past the end of Journal or switching to another platform, I can’t recommend using it. Yet. Fingers crossed. 

(And of course, import would be nice too…)

This app does some things I wish journal apps did for a long time. Link to  music or a  playlist. Which I’m very happy with But it still feels incomplete like  add a specific song. The app is very minimal which isn’t all bad but I think if it had a few more basic features it would go a long way. Features like password setting or ways to integrate more links to other things I have done in the phone.  That would make it more of a digital scrapbook of activity I personally would really like.
would be nice to have the app locked using face id
I like this app. But need some development. I hope they can make archive section year by year. Also I hope I can use this app on my macbook. Thanks for making this cute app

So I really like this app super good way to write down my feelings and I loved it until a few days ago I typed in my journal something personal but nothing about where we were going ( my mom and me) and stopped to go eat good dinner and but the next day I got a notification from journal saying “ eating at an Agave you should right about this” it freaked me out I typed nothing about going to agave or even to a restaurant!

I’ve noticed that I can’t select a screenshot when I am in Journal! The moment I tap on the screenshot, the app throws me out and closes itself! I should’ve go to Gallery and select my screenshot and tap on Share and then select Journal… It’s wired.
And also the part of the app that is about adding location or the contacts you’ve reached in the day wont update… the last news I have there is about 15 January!
As the title says - there’s no option to draw.
Well i love it sm but i hope u guys add the time with the date it would be so nice pls pls

column9: multi device suport will be extremely helpful
column10: I have tried several journalling app, and I like the simplicity of this one. but sometime I like to type on mac or on iPad. Looking forward for the improvement!

I use this app almost daily. I love that I can jot down a thought or a prayer in an instant. I would love to see more options for fonts and editing. I’d love to be able to center things, or underline words. These are just examples, but there’s the potential to do so much more with it if you’ll make those changes. Also, fix the stall, or open the screen so it doesn’t keep jumping when you get to the bottom (middle) and you can no longer see what you’re typing. This could easily be a five star app.

I like the purpose of the app.  I deleted the app from my phone but now added it again. I’ll give it another go. I didn’t like how the interface was hanging up while i’m trying to write some BRILLIANT thought that i needed to get down before it slipped away.
Anytime I try to insert a picture it automatically boot me off.  I was able to do it in the beginning few times, not anymore.

column9: Pretty good with some minor annoyances
column10: We should be able to add photos straight from the app.

Why does this not work on an iPad so I can write with my Apple Pencil seeing it on a bigger screen and being able to use the pencil would actually make this app better but like this I just won’t be using it

column9: Please add the ability to draw
column10: I would really like the ability to do little scribbles like you can in the notes app
Dont know much about this journal app. If i write in it daily can it be printed at some time?

Hello. I really like using the journal app but I wish you can do more with it. Like create folders or something like that. Im a Boy Scout and when you go up for an eagle they ask how did you come along with your project? So I kept track in the app but sometimes I have trouble keeping them together. Also becuase I don’t write everyday and sometimes I do. Consider it?

column9: Okay as a start but needs more features
column10: Journal is okay but it’s very bare bones. It is just suggestions and reminders and then ability to add entries and enter locations or pics/vids. There’s no way to access a calendar to select a particular date yet. It’s okay for now since it’s a new app but hoping Apple improves on this with a calendar feature and eventually a highlights or memories type feature.

This APP has a lot of potentials —

1. Please add a search function so I can quickly locate a journal containing certain keywords and/or OCR model to search for images included as well

2. Would be nice to have a feature (which you can choose to turn it on or off) to log in your mood/ energy level/ daily habit tracking, etc

3. The images added to the journal stay on top of the entry and can not be moved around. Please change this so that the images can be rearranged freely.
I just wish it was available on the iPad, that’s all.

1: the entry's should be more organised, ex:
only show some photos, title, + day and date
2: increase photo limit
seriously? only 13 photos and videos? 
3: customisation
a journal is something very personal and private hence why we should have the ability to customise it a bit like changing the colour pallet

I would love to be able to use it on my iPad as well so I can also add some bullet journal aspects to it. 

A promising app.
I wanted to put the recordings that i had and it didn’t work. It just let me MAKE the recordings not add it.

I have a physical diary but this one seems very awesome because you can add images, answer prompts, etc. My favorite part is that you can do a diary entry as a VoiceMemo for yourself to listen to and reflect. I think that’s awesome because sometimes I’m too lazy to type with my fingers but my lips are not usually too tired to speak out loud. I might definitely use this as a back up.
Would be like to get version for Mac.

column9: Could be so much better, the notes app does a much better job.
column10:
Problems: 
I can’t search within my entries… how am I supposed to find them? I can’t even organize them 

The copy button doesn’t even work unless I’m editing. 

There are so many things that could be in this app that aren’t, why even come up with this app without really making it better? It’s too simple

column9: Good Idea but still poor App
column10:
Why don’t you just let me paste a photo from clipboard???

Why can’t we add hyperlinks, that works as hyperlinks instead of texts??

why there is no search? 

Why you can’t just sort?

I mean, c’mon Apple, are you employing novices or are you letting highschool students to develop apps under your name?

column9: iOS only, no export, limited tools
column10: I was happy to get the journal app and started using it. A week later I wanted to journal on my Mac - nope. So I tried my iPad - nope. The Journal app is iOS only. So, then I wanted to export my entries even to text or pdf - nope, no export capability (wait, what?!). Literally the most limiting journal app out there. The only plus, which is worth the one star, is that it prompts to write and provides suggestions based on where you’ve been. Sometimes the suggestions are good, other times they miss the mark but they are good reminders. Until Apple decides to do some major updates and releases it for other devices there’s nothing to see here.

This is the coolest app ever! I am able to journal without worrying about anyone reading it or anything like that bc I can lock it. I have only been using for like a day but I am super mega impressed. It is super easy to transfer stuff from other apps (I used Notes before) and if you are looking for prompts it has a ton. You can also change the date so that it matches the whatever date. I recommend using dark mode for it. It looks a lot better. 

 Edit: I thought of a few suggestions! Maybe if you could lock individual entries as well that would be nice. Also if you could create folders so I can keep track of stuff better I would also appreciate that. Another suggestion would be adding titles. Thanks for reading!

Edit: been using it since the day I got it and I am loving it! Highly recommend!

I love the journal app but wish there was a way to copy and paste. I got on a roll last night go so much I needed to say put into words but now I’d like to send the thoughts to someone but can’t without retyping in another format.  Why can’t we copy?
I would luke to see available on mac as well, it would be easier to write in. Wish it could be linked with apple health like with mental wellbeing / state of mind to track my moods and emotions.
Nice and minimalistic design which is all you need for a journal. Please add the option to put photos at the bottom for the text section.

column9: Makes me look forward to writing
column10: I’ve recently picked up journaling, and I don’t know what I was doing with my life before. But this app allows you to add pictures, phone calls maybe even a message that was sent to you and they’ll suggest that you use that as a stem for your journaling and you can write about that or you can just add those pictures and come back to them maybe like a couple months later or years later. My only dislike so far, also the reason why I did not give this Five stars is it because it’s not available on iPad. I do hope that they can make it available on iPad and also maybe iCloud so everything that I’ve written on my phone can transfer to my iPad.

column9: Waiting for updates and more features!
column10: Please let me put my health info& other things without doing it through the suggestion page 💓

It needs colours, maybe fonts as well? And I wish I could have more options for the bookmarks so I can categorize my thoughts and remember, for example, anecdotes, travels, work…
I gave the app a try and, even though it is very basic for now, it includes what we need to make it a good app, let’s wait to see if it will be a great app eventually

column9: Great start but please more features!
column10:
Started using it on my phone, as many other I love the simplicity of entry and don’t mind the suggestions. 1 huge problem: no syncing between devices. Very annoying that you can’t have your journal on your IPad, phone or Mac. Went back to using the Note app for journaling. Please add synch with the Apple ID. 
Also would be nice to be able to create templates. 
Again, love the concept and looking forward to seeing what you will do with it.

If you go back and edit text in the middle, it will make you skip to the end, garbling your spellings and messing up the words.

There’s also no way to search your previous notes using a key word or phrase.

Cross platform option!!! Pleas! 
In general not bad…

First of all, I love this app since I can write whatever I wish to write—my feelings, thoughts and reflections for the day—without worrying whether it will be read by other people. 

Now, regarding the images, I love how I can add them so that I can put a visual representation or depiction of what I wrote.. it’s just that, how I wish you can put them down along the page and not stacked in the thumbnail. Thanks.

I am enjoying the suggestions provided and I like the links to photos and fitness.
I wish all the text would stop automatically going bold and it keeps flicking back up to the top while I’m writing-is this a bug?
Not stable enough to use long-term. Notes app is much more stable. Scroll with no issues. I would like to see more integrations with the Bible app. But overall, find it difficult to use.
Why I can’t download this app on my iPad?
I like this no problems only benefits I already wrote a poem about my dog

It lacks the basic features:
- search 
- tag
- folder

But the idea of an intelligent assistant helping users documenting and curating their day’s activities is great!

column9: It’s okay, but needs more features and more robust journaling capabilities.
column10: Good Stuff: - Suggestions do an okay job at grouping pictures, walks, and locations into journal entries. Bad Stuff: - 10 item limit on journal entries means you’ll need to make multiple entries per day for e.g. a vacation - Tapping text box doesn’t immediately go to the spot you tapped — it just brings up the keyboard - Switching the app immediately erases any changes you’ve made to a pending post (e.g. changing the title of a suggested moment) or in your search (e.g. tapping “More” or being in Recent vs. Recommended). It just sort of starts over once you come back. - No iPad support - No way to share entries to e.g. Instagram, a friend via AirDrop, anything. - No way to share from other apps (e.g. Strava) into Journal. - Cannot merge suggested entries.
I can’t access half of my previous posts because the app freezes when it gets half way down. Irritating as I have no other way to access previous posts.
It’s really a shame that the same app is not on Mac. I’d like to write on the computer and also maybe smaller notes on my phone, but just on the phone no

column9: Great concept and beautiful GI but details need improvement.
column10: This really is terrible and it is so disappointing. I had been so looking forward to this app being rolled out by Apple for iPhone. Finally something that can replace social media! Something that can recreate the original use of a photo sharing platform such as Instagram but without the notifications or the void that you seemingly must now enter in order to participate in it at all currently which I am personally not interested in. Ultimately, I do however miss having a tool in order to journal. However, there are multiple flaws that need to be ironed out in order for this app to be functional. First, practically, there is a glitch which prevents you from being able to write a journal entry (unless you wanted to write a few lines, which I usually wouldn't with journaling intention) by temporarily moving the page up and down. This is also extremely disorientating. Also, there is no option to use horizontal view. I can understand the reviews saying suggestions are off (I think they're cool) and the others asking for social aspect integration. Although, as a digital minimalist, I suggest social integration within reason, I think some kind of share option would be nice.

The features it has and the suggestions it gives is pretty cool, it makes it easier for me personally to string together my thoughts and get the ball rolling, but I am giving it 3 stars because it’s ONLY on iPhone. For a company that likes to use walled garden approach for the sake of integration between devices it puzzles me that it’s not available on Mac or at least for iPads. Please add this app to your other devices Apple. It would be a lot easier to type on my MacBook or my iPad Pro with a keyboard, rather then on my phones screen.
This game is awesome write on it every day cause its awesome how you can write what ever you want.
How did this app on my phone? And why would I share my thoughts and feelings when Apple already knows everything else about me?

column9: Nice feature but still quite minimal
column10: Really like the concept and it’s easy to use. Like others have said though, it feels a bit unfinished. Needs a calendar, search and export function to be useful - also small gadgets like weather and temperature would be nice. Hope these will be added at some point!
This app would be more helpful with iPad version. It’s too hard to take notes on iPhone
Continues to freeze , lost my journal entries that I was able to use in the beginning. Needs work ASAP. Would love to use on my app for my studies.

column9: Very useful journaling app but immature
column10: Even though this app is very useful it is in its infancy. The main feature this app lacks is a search option. As my journal entries are getting bigger there is no way buy to keep on scrolling to find a particular entry. I wonder how Apple can miss such a main feature!
I did not install this app and somehow i found it on my phone screen.

Great app. It's still early for the app so i know there are still improvements to be made. 
So this is mine: 
1. Ability to rearrange audio and pictures and text. A normal physical journal goes text and  pictures in between. This currently puts all audio and pictures at the top and text at the bottom. While a normal flow would be, write maybe, do an audio. Write. Insert a picture. And write. And all these should follow one another. From where cursor is to media below when inserted.

However, I cannot download a photo I made directly in the diary, please fix if possible
I was very excited when I saw this app on my iPhone. But I prefer to journal on my iPad and when I saw it was an iPhone only app,  it became instantly useless.

It does not matter if the car is super nice if it does not move

column9: Can’t export or print or share.  Why?
column10: Great app if you are ok with not having a way to export it or print it.  What is the point?

seems seriously lacking in usefulness. Apple Notes is much superior. 
Perhaps some bright spark thought a classroom level thing is a thing.
A lot of bugs. Needs a lot of improvement before it is of any value.

I loved using the notes app to make diary entries because of its simplicity. This app is really nice for how simple it is but there are some fundamental missing features. 
Where is the way to classify things? Create albums/folders/separate diaries?
Also any way to ad a tag or hashtag to sort things more easily and most importantly where is the search/filter function?
In the future the app will be filled with entries and how do I do it to reread a specific one without having to scroll though hundreds of entries?
This app is going to right direction but I sure hope they keep updating it.

column9: Great idea but not on iPad?
column10: Great concept and idea and love the prompts. But how is this not available on iPad at all?? I’m not going to journal out all my life’s thoughts with just two thumbs; using a keyboard connected to an iPad is a minimum.
Is it possible to get features similar to Timehop or Facebook Memories that you can opt into?
just awesome

I thought there was a feature to report a bug through the app store but I do not see the ability to do that so this what you get…

When I’ve placed the cursor somewhere else to add or correct my writing, the cursor keeps jumping down to the end of the copy. This is incredibly frustrating when you’re ugly crying trying to journal your feelings. Please fix. 
(iOS 17.2.1) 

Other than that, it is a super simple journaling app that feels completely private since it unlocks with Face ID. I’d like it if it wasn’t for this ridiculously frustrating bug. I started using it 3 days ago and I’m ready to abandon it.

I like the app, but there's ZERO options. Would be nice to have a search option, calendar view, visual customization (colours, themes, etc), an app settings menu... I'm sure others have mentioned other great ideas. I look forward to new features!

Excellent, intuitive, and fun overall - I wish there was an option to search or to search by date or location. 

I also wish there was a way to print or export the notes to preserve in case this app ever is discontinued.

I don’t really write reviews but I was mad at this feature. When I updated my phone and saw the journal app I was super excited because sometimes you just need to jot your feelings down. Well I want this app to be locked as when you write an entry it’s right there when you launch it. It’s not in a folder or just the title. You can just straight up read the entries without clicking on them. But it won’t let me lock the app unless I have a lock on my phone. Which is stupid because if I have a lock on my phone why would I need to lock the app. Where as me I don’t care if my husband goes through my phone so I don’t lock my phone so I don’t have a passcode. But certain feelings I like to keep to myself. So I think it’s stupid that to lock one app on my phone I have to lock my whole phone.
It was the best thing you did, I'm just very grateful
I had entries fir whole last two weeks. They have disappered. Fix this back!

column9: Not That Much Different from Notes 🤣
column10: When my phone updated and added this app, I opened it and turns out it’s not much different from the Notes app, only you can add pictures and voice memos and there are writing prompts 🤣 But I am using it as an alternative for Bublup and Pinterest (saving pictures of craft ideas and memes), so there’s that! 😊

This is a great concept but it was released without completing all necessary features. 
Search is an absolute must!! Adding tags would also make the usability better.
The user could then categorize entries. 
I hope the next version has these added features or I will be abandoning this app.

I managed to get this app in my iPhone 12 mini. It was found installed in my iPhone after a software update.
To my surprise, no such app were found after the software update in my iPad. It would have been better if the software was installed in the iPad. Apple is requested to do the needful.

column9: Great but needs to be a universal app
column10: I can’t believe this was built for iPhone only. I don’t like typing on my phone. My thumbs cramp up after a while. I’ve actually started a journal in Pages so I can jot down ideas on my phone and then really write meaningful entries on my Mac. I love the integrations in Journal (location history, music history, podcasts, etc) but I just can’t write decent journal entries on my phone.

For me, it’s a useful app for quick recap while I have a lunch meeting, since there is a record option also to make easier in collecting some info and documented in one app.

However, when I need to edit the previous text that I wrote already, which I have to scrolling down, it always auto-direct back to the bottom of the page.

Please fix this.
Can you add an option to search by text or/and by address ?

Started using this recently as a means of documenting my anxiety, depression, and panic attacks. It’s made it so easy to just open up and start typing out how I’m feeling and what I’m going through. Most wellness apps I’ve tried have specific prompts and paid features, when I just needed a way to put my thoughts in writing. I realize it’s not the full intention of this app to have such a feature, but I wish there was a way to share my entries for when I get back in to therapy.

column9: Bug: insertion point keeps resetting to end of text
column10:
When I try to edit text in the middle of a paragraph, I guess the app refreshes/ saves progress every couple of seconds because the insertion point keeps resetting to the end of my text. This makes it almost impossible to edit text in the middle.
Please fix this!! Otherwise, good app.

I love the app. However, I would love for it to be compatible with my other Apple devices. Also, I’d like to be able to share journal posts to my friends without having to screenshot them. I do not want it to be public or like a social site but the send option would be a great addition. More features would set this app apart. I love the recommendations feature. It has such potential. The developers need to listen to the consumers for future updates. However, I still shared it with my friends because I love what it is at this juncture.
Would love to write on the screen rather than typing. I think it would be great with this addition.
Please add an option to display time of the note was created. It is very inconvenient to distinguish morning notes from evening for example.

When is MacBook App coming? It’d be nice to be able to write on both devices.
Also, joining with spotify so you can log the song of the day and being able to log the time you are writing in
I really like this app BUT I REALLY NEED IT FOR MAC too. It is fundamental to have it on both devices.

column9: No iPad version are you joking?

You want me to use one device, my iPhone to journal? Who ever got paid to pitch that should be promoted to chief product idiot.

Hey Apple, thanks for bringing this concept by default. This a great self retrospective app required for everyone who wants to reflect on their life through journaling. 
Yeah as everybody else I have some suggestions too and I’m sure the kiddo app will it make it to the top since it’s still new : 

1. Visualisation needs to be improved more colours like sticky notes can be introduced and the view can be according to calendar if possible. But atleast needs more colours. 
2. Suggestions are great but can improve on the questions part. 
3. Try to bring artistic view on the app because journaling is creativity.
I absolutely love this app it really helps me keep track of everything

column9: Nice and Happy to use a native Journal app
column10: I was shocked when I first saw this app on my screen like I didn't install any journal app lately so why it is here. It turns out to be Apple's, so I was more than happy to use a native app. I have been only writing a few entries so far so I haven't fully used all of its functions yet but I must say, so far so good!

The basis is there for this application but needs work with the following 3 the main issue:

1. Formatting options need to be added such as the ones in Notes

 2. Template options need to be added

3. Export options need to be added

There is also an issue where the cursor jumps to the bottom of page when trying to edit or type. 

Please fix this application as really want a digital journal and love Apple notes.
The app is great overall. I haven’t run into any problems but it would be cool to have a feature where you could export your entries.
App is fun and intuitive, but lacks basic features like searching entries by location/free text/people, tagging contacts in line to allow for searching, customization (adding titles, changing fonts).

column9: Need iPad and Apple Pencil Support
column10: This journal app is so good. So intuitive, user friendly, and simple. Apple, you nailed it. One request: please… PLEASE bring it to iPad. Writing in a journal is best when you are writing, not typing on a phone keyboard. Apple Pencil support would make this app SO much better.
The app lag so much especially when typing in languages other than English. Most lagged app on my iPhone
Why can we not customize the way the journal entry is? It keeps sending me to the bottom of the entry. Stop making it so automated please. Thanks

I'm really impressed with this app's potential. To make it even better, I'd suggest a few enhancements: a calendar view for easier navigation of entries, a categorization feature for quick retrieval of past entries, engagement prompts or notifications to encourage regular reflection, a freeform mode for doodling and adding creative elements, and a 'memories' feature to celebrate anniversaries of journal entries. These updates could significantly enhance the user experience.

I love this app, but am SO frustrated it’s not available on iPad. I would use this so every day if it were available on iPad. Don’t get me wrong, I enjoyed the convenience of being about to journal from my phone on the moment, but more often than not, when I sit down to journal it’s to write. I still enjoy the physical act of writing, even on my iPad. Please consider adapting this app to iPad asap. I think you’ll find the ratings skyrocket.
When it will be available dor ipad?

column9: Problem: no ability to allow notifications

column9: Good idea - failed after a few days
column10:
I love this app, it has great potential and worked great for about 2 days, the suggestions on the recent tab were great. Then I realised my friends version let her add more than one event to one entry. Even if mine are on the same day I have to do separate entries. I checked my friends iOS version was the same and that the app had no updates and both were the same. This was annoying me for a few days but I could deal with it. Then for the last 2 days it’s not picked up any locations or any pictures I have taken, I’ve checked my settings which have all access turned on. 
Like I said good app but needs more development

Love having this new app BUT…
1. it is annoying how it keeps going to the end of the entry when I’m trying to make edits in the middle of it. 
2. I wish it has more formatting options like in the Notes app— bullets, numbering, indentation
3. It would be GREAT if font colors can also be changed.
A key feature is missing from my pov: A function where more then one person can work in the journal. Something like a family function…
I like it but it needs a search bar by date/keywords or hashtags like the notes app. Also a version for the iPad

I just decided to stop journaling in notion for this, I really miss the option of add tags or hashtags to the entries, it’s really useful to categorize and organize your journal and your mind, add a title to each entry

I really enjoy how linked the journal is to the rest of my daily activities (exercise, photos, travel, etc.) and how they are used as prompts for journal entries. 

One that seems to be missing that I feel would make sense is to have Apple Health State of Mind entries be available to expound upon in the Journal. 

Even better, embed the state of mind survey in the journal so I can immediately reflect on one or more of the feelings and triggers I select in the state of mind survey. 

Thank you!

column9: Only bad thing: Not on iPad
column10: I don’t understand why an app like this one is not available on iPad.

I was eager to start using this app and had been making a ton of entries, plus moving certain notes over from the notes app and deleting them from there. Then the screen went completely blank. Tried all the usual tricks to get it to work again. After turning off the Face ID unlock the text “Journal” appeared in the top left corner, but there’s no option to click on anything or add entries. All the entries I previously had are gone. I decided to delete the app and reinstall (despite not wanting to potentially do away with all that I had added to my journal), but that did not solve anything. Still a blank screen when I open the app. Nothing works. Don’t use this app to put down your thoughts or dreams or anything else that might be important for you to express. It could all be deleted!
This could be very useful. Would love to see color coating for different topics needs an iPad version. Would also like to be able to link to calendar.

This is one of the best apps Apple has released for iPhone and it makes journaling so simple and quick to do every day. I find myself picking up my phone with thoughts and the quick and easy access to a place to write thoughts or memories down has caused me to use it daily, sometimes multiple times a day. Despite being someone who uses a paper planner, I can’t beat the convenience of an app like this with the ability to integrate thoughts with location tags, photos, etc - love it!

What I have loved about Apple products is that they are ecosystems of devices and software that integrate almost seamlessly. Journal may have some useful features, but if I can’t use it on my other Apple devices when I need/want to (as I can with Notes), it’s worthless. 

Apple, you’re really moving away from what has set you apart. Sad!
Such a pity, as a diary shouldn’t be a particularly difficult app to make, but Apple managed to disappoint me once again…

I am using this app for writing books and I LOVE this app! But when I was writing today, it kept deleting some of my words! It got so frustrating that I had to immediately write a review! Over all this app is amazing!

column9: WHY ISNT THIS AVAILABLE FOR IPAD????
column10: I like to use my iPad four journaling and serious stuff like that. And I like my phone for fun stuff so !???

Or this should be one of the i-life apps like notes or pages where it can be accessed on iCloud as well.

Very excited to have Journal on an iPhone, but it would be even better to have it on Mac and have it synced. Also, it needs more methods of input, such as drawing, collages, different text etc. I think it would work much better if some of the options available in Notes were introduced in Journal.

In a huge misfire from Apple, this product hit the market well before it was out of alpha testing. Apple’s vaunted idea of sharing everything across platforms is missing. Exporting data is also missing. Availability on anything other than an iPhone is missing. 

Complete misfire.
After updating journal crashes when trying to add anything to it. Have deleted app & reinstalled it, but still no luck 🙁

Decent, simple journal app. Folders and headers would be helpful. Having the ability to search entries after several months or years would be helpful to go back and reflect on growth and/or changes.

column9: This is a great start to journaling
column10:
I have been using a journal for over 12 years now, I started with Momento and then moved to Day One and both of those apps are excellent.

I really like this one because it gives me new ideas. I like the provoking thoughts yes I think this will get better, but I hope it doesn’t lose some of its early strengths.

I will continue to use Day One, but I’m going to use this along it.  When I write something of this app that I find really useful, I simply copy it over to Day One so that I can do all the other things that Day One allows me do eg check out what I was doing for the last 10 years on this day. Well done Apple it is a great start.  From somebody that’s been using a journal for a long time I’m finding it really useful and will continue to use it.

I’m sure, like everything else, Apple will continue to develop this and turn it into a fantastic product.
Allow to add screenshot and draw (like Note)

i really like the idea of this app and think it's super cool but one thing that i really noticed is that there isn't any room for sorting... i hope that there's a new update that allows me to be able to sort my notes as well as lock some of them and keep them private like notes does.
I love this app so much  😃

 2.tag function( can add tag and filter by tag)

A journal should have a password. Anyone using my phone can just enter it and read. The entries are the first thing that pops up when you enter the app, not even titles but the full entries. This is not a good app, journals should have more privacy options
I enabled it yet nothing except the stupid reflections things I don’t want that I want my journal suggestions it worked for a second then the next time I open the app gone like it never even existed

This inspired me to begin journalling again something I haven’t done for years. I would like more control over what I include in the journal without the restrictions. Add things like workouts, meditations, and other apps that I would like to include as part of my daily reflection is clunky. This is relatively new, so with time I suspect it will improve, and I will be happy to give it five stars, hopefully sometime in the future. I’ve been using this now for a couple of weeks and one of the things that drives me crazy is that it keeps skipping to the end of my journal entry when I go and add something in some other part of the journal. Yes, you can put pictures in but you don’t have any control over where they’re placed they’re all at the top of the screen. And it shows the workouts but I’m not overly impressed. I plan to keep using this because I like to put down my thoughts, and it will be interesting to someday in the future reflect back on them. Apple developers whoever is working on this app please continue to look for ways to make it shine. 

I see someone else suggested adding a search function. Period.

I love this journal app. No one can argue with me that it is very great but I just need to say this needs to be available on tablet. If I could have gotten it on tablet it would’ve been a five star review from me

Couple thoughts:

1) When you are back timing your journal, have the app intelligently suggest items from that day you are on ie bring up photos from that day. When you search photos it doesn’t even show what day the photo was from so it becomes a huge ordeal to back-journal.

2) Allow more customizations within the journal please! Custom templates would be awesome.

3) Allow multiple journals!! This is what stops me from using this app. If I want to have a journal for myself then one for my adventures and one for my family, this app forces it to all be in the same journal. Other apps I can make a special journal for each category.

…though I don’t know why you’d rush out a journaling app. Anyway, it still has pretty limited functionality—no tags, for example, or block quote formatting. Most problematically, the interface jumps around erratically when your entry extends past the initial screen space (i.e., when you have to scroll). It’s also very difficult to use the app for writing when you get to that point because there’s no “typewriter scrolling”: your text remains all the way at the bottom of your screen, rather than having a cushion added automatically. The prompts feel gimmicky, but they can be disabled, thankfully. And I like the ability to lock the app with Face ID. Looking forward to this one being improved.

column9: Something I noticed after I downloaded this
column10: So I have a real diary at home but anybody can find the key and the book but this one has Face ID I know it’s not completely safe because of hackers but since this is that kind of app I’m pretty sure I will have protection. RIGHT?
Too many glitches, try to  add a pic to a journal entry?  crashes every time.👎🏻 A bit laggy. Must be a better option?
This apps is too basic. Need otger language!
I love this app so much and I literally only just began using it!! Definitely recommend and I can’t wait to see the new updates they hopefully get futuristic wise 🫶🏻

My main issue is that it keeps scrolling back up to the top every time I hit the return button.  Also, there’s less functionality than I’d like, but I excuse it due to it being a new app.  The notes app is a better journaling app than the journal app, so that should say something.

I would love it more if there was a search function.  If I’m trying to recall an entry involving something like “tacos” for example and I had hundreds of entries, then it would be nice to just type it into the a search menu like there is in the Notes app.
I just wish you change the password from the phone password, other than that great app!

I think the journal is a great initiative. However, I think there should be stickers or banners to select and customize reflections and media added don’t need to be clumsy at the top. They should be generic like the notes app and sequential. 

More fun stickers so we don’t miss our book journals

Appreciate simplicity, but not even integrating it with the mental health logging makes no sense. You can also put in exercise, but closing rings or awards, nop, take a screenshot instead, good luck with that cause the image on the card will crop it and you have no control on the positioning. The dates are so small, you can barely read them and doesn’t give me journal vibes. Would be great to get some tags too to. Overall, trying to use it, but it’s so barebones and with the mental health, it’s 2 things to log, I feel like these 2 should have been better thought out as 1, I’ll probably end up doing none, already missing almost 2 months. Hoping this improves on iOS 18 cause they’re good concepts.
It suddenly installed itself on my phone. I didn’t even notice. Why?
Quite straightforward. Good for jotting down something with no fuss. I would like it to have export function to other app such as email or file.

column9: Would be awesome with a few added features!
column10:
I’ve been using the Diary app for over a year. I like that Journal offers a bunch of fun stuff to add like podcasts and contacts but I probably won’t use those.

I would love if a time (11:22 am) stamp feature to see when each entry was (optionally of course) for each time a new entry so we can see how often we really add to it.

1. I love this app it's much more organized than the notes app for journaling. 
2. When will it be available on MacBook? I enjoy typing much more on it!
3. I think it needs a format bar on the bottom just like the notes app where we can add a number list or format the text to italic, bold, etc.
It’s a nice app, but not being able to export makes its non essential. How will my grandchildren read this one day?

Needs
-The ability to search keywords in the journal.
