column9: CURSOR INCESSANTLY JUMPS TO THE BOTTOM
column10: Journaling is supposed to help boost creativity, improve your writing skills, encourage awareness, boost self-esteem, reduce stress, and help you manage anxiety. I LOVED that Apple created a journal and thought it was going to be the perfect place to collect my thoughts. But, I don’t always journal my thoughts in perfect sequence as if I am writing an email. Furthermore, even with an email or with this review for instance, I’m able to easily go back and add anything I want to the text without any issues. I enjoy having the ability to jump around the page with my thoughts. Insert ^ a sentence or a word that comes to me later in a spot that makes sense for it. Sometimes, I like to copy & paste a paragraph or two of some advice I’ve found on a website and maybe even edit it just a bit to make it apply to me and my situation. It’s my own personal & private space to let loose and say whatever in the h#ll I want to myself. But this journal is making that dang near impossible!! I move the cursor to a particular location on the page and begin typing aimlessly, only to look up and see that midway through my first word,  the cursor has jumped down to the bottom of the page, making me lose my place and having to scroll and fix both spots. I can handle such a minor glitch if it only happened once a session every session. But, it does it over and over and over and over again!!! If I put my cursor in a particular spot on the page, I don’t need it moved back to a spot that I have repeatedly moved away from and can easily get back to on my own if I wanted to. I don’t have health issues, but I could literally feel my blood pressure skyrocket after the 15th time around for one log. This application has the potential to be improve many areas in my life, but it ain’t happening with cursor jumping to the bottom of the page issue.

I have read the reviews and I rated based doily on this: I am unable to access on my iPad Pro (5th gen) 12.9”. I have recently lost my husband and I was advised that writing in a journal can be therapeutic. Well I thought why not be able to use this on my iPad where I have a keyboard so it’s easier to type and put entries into it. Low and behold it’s not for iPad only iPhone. I understand that you make an app to be for an on the go journal type deal but you guys just wasted a genius idea. A lot of people don’t have iPhones, but they have MacBooks and iPads. So for them they can’t reap the benefits of all Apple developed apps if they aren’t available for them. I absolutely love the app I would give you 5 stars if you would make it accessible on the iPad and MacBook.
Very basic with no export. Pretty much a no go considering there are other feature rich alternatives. I expected much more from an Apple app.

I’ve only just recently started journaling again and before I used Day One, which despite having more features and functionality (something Apple needs here), I hate to use because of its layout and design. Typical of Apple, the app and user experience is beautiful. However, it lacks key features. For example, the ability to search and catalogue your own entries; functionality on Mac and iPad; the ability to add music of your choice; the ability to record the number of entries and perhaps a streak counter for the amount of consecutive days with an entry; as well as the ability to share or export an entry to other apps or contacts. Of course the app is in the early days of development and I have every confidence Apple will improve it with time, it would just be nice to see some of these features.

“Good, better, best” so they say. This app is not the best and it’s not better than the other apps; however it is almost good.

Two more features highly requested that I see frequently on app reviews:

1. Please make this app available for iPad iOS.

2. Please allow indexing so that the user can perform a quick word search through all the journal entries.

Thank you, Apple

There seems like a decent foundation here, but from my understanding the point of this app is to make use of the fact that data from many services can be automatically pulled together in one space, and used as context to prompt reflection and pattern discovery.

Some information I was expecting to be prompted with and/or allowed to attach in an entry:
- State of Mind enteries
- Changes in Sleep trends
- Medications, Diet activity
- Hormonal cycles
- Other Health symptoms I've logged
- Weather conditions, especially significant events like large storms & pressure changes
- News articles saved & read
- Links I added to the Reading List
- Pre-recorded Voice Memos
- Links to Notes
- Links to Emails, Messages, Voicemail
- Reminders I completed & missed
- Events scheduled in Calendar
- Contacts added
- Screen Time
- Notifications I opened

It's possible some of these integrations are present but at the moment it is unclear.

Some other features I'd like to see:
- Manual tagging
- Grouping entries by date in a different view, possibly in columns
- Drag & Drop support for text, Voice Memos, Photos, Notes, Reminders, web links
- The ability to set goals in a separate section of the app and prompting on how my work towards those goals is going
- iPadOS and MacOS support

The way I log info about my day and thoughts is still being served better by general purpose document writing because of its versatility. Journal needs to plant deeper roots open more windows and give me more tools. It needs to double down on putting my data in one place and accepting data from Apple's own software. I don't want to screenshot everything or write it out by hand, and if I have to, I'll use use Notes or something 3rd-party.
How do I set a passcode? Put a lock on it?

It’s important for me to categorize by topic. Speech-to-text dictation option on the audio notes would be great, but is more nice to have. Categorization is table stakes.

Like I love the idea. Just it has to be improved.

It is a great application, but as its name says it is a journal, so it would be great to have the possibility of having the app on the iPad, approaching the physical experience of having a notebook, in this digital case where you will not lose any moment of your life.

column10:
It was January 17th when this app randomly appeared on my phone around 1am EST. I was never really one to have a diary since I grew up in a household that thought personal privacy was some sort of sin.
I’m happy to have this app though…it may be a bit simple, but I actually really like it’s simplicity, and was happy to see it even recommended new prompts daily.
I’m currently trying to pick up the pieces of me that have broken ever since the start of 2020…it’s 4 years later and I’m in a new chapter of my life, but being able to write down all my thoughts and emotions in this app (with its own privacy settings) has been very wonderful (and definitely cheaper than therapy, lol).
Thanks Apple, for this random app to come during a time I didn’t know I was in need of something like this…

I rate this 5 stars because it gave me a journaling medium that finally works for me. I’d had a lot of journals over the years but I could never stick with them. For some reason, this app puts it in a form that just works for me. 

Here is how I journal: Growing up, I always treated journaling as a journal prompt the way we would do it in grade school. So I would sit down to write about something, but instead of letting my thoughts flow, I would answer like a prompt if that makes any sense.  The way I journal is I ask myself a question. It could be a very simple question like how was your day or what’s on my mind right now and all I do is I take what pops up in my head and I transcribe that into the app. So I am literally transcribing my thoughts and what I have learned is that my thoughts flow and I’m able to process thoughts instead of just keep them up in my head and that’s how I use this journaling app. I hope that helps. ❤️

May you heal from the traumas you don’t talk about. ♾️

column9: Missing auto transcript generation from audio and video notes
column10: I would say is a pretty good app but it lacks a common functionality nowadays of creating a transcript automatically, using natural language processing, for the video and audio entries. That would make it game changer!

I was so excited when I saw this automatically downloaded on to my phone and anticipated all kinds of neat features. But when I opened the app I was disappointed. In reality, it has fewer options than the Notes app has. I think it’s a great concept but could be so much better. 

For starters, there is no easy way to format the text, as there is in notes. You have to do the infuriating double-tap, highlight, tap the arrow, tap “Format” and click italic/bold/underline instead. There is no option for bulleting or numbers for outlining as the Notes app has, and I use quite frequently. I would like to see a markup feature like there is in Photos and Notes. I feel like this feature should be a given with any journaling app. Having the option for different fonts would be phenomenal. I also think there should be an option to title entries with something other than just the date it was written. Folders you can label would also be great to organize different types of journaling. For example, I don’t just use a journal to write whatever is in my head; I keep separate journals for daily reflections, story writing ideas, prayers, devotionals, notes, and other such categories. I would like to be able to keep them separate instead of just one jumbled mess of dated entries on one page.

There are some bugs that need to be worked out with this app, as well. After typing a certain length down the page, I will be typing on a new line and then find the whole page quickly scrolling all the way up and down, every time the cursor automatically enters to the next line. It is extremely annoying and a rather unsatisfying typing experience. Also, I tried several times to add photos to my entries, but was only able to select them. The photos would not appear in the entry and would uncheck itself after going back to type in the journal. There is also no easy way to go back to the main screen except by choosing “done” at the top right. I feel like a back button would make more sense.

Also, would have given 3 stars, but I found out Journal is not available on iPad, which is a shame because I would have preferred to use it on there vs. my phone. Being able to have the journal app and use the scribble feature with the Apple Pencil would be a dream!

That being said, I do like the journaling suggestions and the lock feature so that the content can’t be seen by others. For now, I will stick with Good Notes to do my journaling. Hoping to see some improvement with Journal soon. This is something I could see myself using regularly if features were added and bugs were fixed!

It’s very early days obviously but these are just a few things u feel are missing. I’m currently using it for the prompts, screenshotting my entries and adding as a photo into Zinnia or then printing the photo to add to my main paper journal. So ideas…. 1. Ability to change font. Colours, bold, italic * Discovered whilst trying to copy this in the app for the review you can select text and then choose format for very basic formatting. Bold, italic etc 🩷 emojis I guess for bit of colour 2. Able to write your own title and to choose the background colour. So it matches the ones promoted 3. Be able to filter by your own titles colour. I want to be able to have codes for different entries. Work, home, creative 4. Templates for entries. Even simple ones like a calendar. However tapes, shapes would all be good. 5. I want to be able to draw / colour in - one of the biggest things I do is keep a track of my mood I can’t do that here unless I write it in text form 6. I want to “shape” my photos, circle, rounded ages, heart - simple shapes but I want to be able to do that, place them where I want on the page 7. Tags, something that has been brilliant in notes and reminders 8. Printing 9. Missing connections to other apps - if you were sporty you might want to add in fitness entries 10. Needs to work across everything, not sure if it syncs with my IPad other reviews suggest it doesn’t. What it really needs is a lot of the functionality that has been put into notes and reminders At the moment it is only good for being prompted to write text, I really like this feature but if it could be more tailored to a person. For example I don’t listen to music I can’t and I’m constantly being asked about music. If when getting the app I was asked to pick five things I love, 5 things I hate/ don’t want to write about that would be great. I’d pick for love; Family, Cats, Crafting, good food, am at home all the time (disabled, be good to add that in so tailored, never going off for a long walk) then dislike/don’t want to write about would be music, outdoors, travelling, socialist with friends and sports - as these are all things I am not able to do or really dislike It needs a lot of work, it is no Zinnia for sure but it’s free and new and will grow I hope in time. I’m liking it for is writing out thoughts but you can’t search so I am then ScreenShotting and printing text for my “written” journal or Adding into zinnia as a snapshot What it does have so far is srautuf as Apple always is but it needs more “oomph” and to be an actual journaling app. It needs to be more in line with the newer version of pages, reminders and notes which have really changed to excellent Thank you Apple but it’s not quite there yet

This is crazy! How is my lovely mature brain meant to cope with finding key memories over the last 50 years 🤦🏻‍♀️ if I go to all the trouble of creating entries I need to be able to find certain things!
Its great app I like it. But then i cant customize fonts and font sizes and such. Hopefully in the next update they add that.
Very barebone app, no added value compared to the notes app. Expected a better software from the Apple itself, honestly.
I LOVE the app. I just really wish it told you what time of day you posted instead of just the date.

I just started using this as a place to put thoughts as they occur. When I go into make notes in previously written content in the journal, I start writing and it automatically moves my cursor to the last typed character…for example: if I were to go back to the first few words of this post and make a change, I would get a few words in before it automatically moves my cursor while I’m still writing, right here
It is good for details but they lose points for not having the thing I want

The app seems very simple and pale. Doesn't have interesting user interface. It's just scrolling to get to a particular day. It needs to be more organic yet informative if I want to go to a particular month or a day or a year. I hope the Apple team works on it in future to grow this app into a better one.

column9: good app but please add more features
column10:
I love it how you can add music if you have an apple music subscription already but i wish that you can choose what music you wanna add
For example i made an entry and the vibe just fits a song that i havent listened to in a few days 
The music feature only lets you add recently listened to so if i wanted to add that song to an entry i had to repeat it many times so it would be in the options kinda annoying but ok tolerable 

Please also add functions where you can make multiple journals and change font size and stuff

column9: 😊I’m so glad to rate this a five star

column10: This App looks promising. I’m excited to use it and see how the developers at Apple improve it. Things I look forward to are more customizability (although simplicity is what encourages use), an App for iPad and Mac, and a smoother navigation (tapping to expand and minimize entries is easy to become frustrated with when you accidentally tap while reading), and more optimized and robust interface (it seems very simplistic, not searchable, and UI could be touched up).
This has been a great way to log how your day is and the events that happened so far and on my iPhone 11 Pro no mishaps.

column9: Please add import function from Day One
column10: Love using app so far but been using Day One prior to Journal app and have over 500 entries in there. I really want to keep continue those memories. Please make amazing app even more amazing by adding import function!
No point until it’s available on my laptop and iPad. Terrible rollout.

1. Search function
2. Tags
3. Ability to share entries
4. Allow users to create their own suggestions; let users find photos in albums, pull text messages and write their own prompts
5. Allow user to edit suggested prompts
6. Basic word processing functions: bold, italics, headings, indent (everything that can be done in the notes app should be in this app)
7. Mac, iPad, web app
While the app is amazing, one of the few flaws is the lack of Mac and iPad support. Besides that, the app could use having some more recommendations as well as customization.

lol I had the same experience, this app just randomly appeared on my phone so I rolled with it and I love it! It’s so fun to use and it is nice, but, could you add a few more options for journal entries ideas please? Thank you, love the app!

I really like the all, as I was using my notes app previously. But I wish it had the ability to create different folders or different sections of a journal (eg travel, therapy, gratitude). Organizing my journal pages into folders or sections would be great

column9: It's great but does not allow enabling notifications
column10: I'm using it a lot but the scheduling does not work as it does not allow to enable notifications for the app. Please get this bug fixed!

After many attempts of refreshing my phone, restarting, and offloading my cloud space; the app is unresponsive and not refreshing. All i see is a blank homepage where i cant even click on anything. The whole thing is frozen. Deleting this app would be my last resort because I hate to lose all my data and entries. Truly disappointed and frustrated. I hope the IT team could reach out and help fix my case.

I really love the idea of this app. It makes so much sense with how much time I spend on my phone and how easily accessible it is. For me though I would love more time video journaling. I’ve made a couple videos and they don’t get saved to my photos which I appreciate so much! but there is a limit of time recording in order for it to save in the Journal app. Can we make this longer? If we could make that change this would easily be a 5 star review.

column9: Still exploring, should be on iPads as well
column10:
First impressions is it keeps it simple and I like that…

BIGGEST DRAW BACK, it is not on ipadOS as well, I would prefer to journal on my iPad Pro.
Some of my family know my iPhone password, so can you allow it to give us a chance to change it to something else?

Beautiful app, easy to use, but boy does it lack features:
what about books read, time, location, …
Loving this app, but it would be nice if we could also add files to it. Itll help for people like me who writes with attachments etc.

The fact that you can use photos and audio voices and everything is so smoothly integrated is great. 
But
1. Once I started writing more than a few lines I started experiencing real slowness
2. You can make lists/ tick boxes/ mark words/ create tags
It’s a great start and I hope we’ll see it gets better
i love it but wish i could add some music snippets that i heard during my day, maybe as an attachment it doesnt even have to play the music.

column9: Like it…but I could love it!
column10: I like the journal app for iPhone however if it  were available for iPad I would love it and this would be 5 stars easy for me.
im loving it because its simple and to the point but that said.. theres  no way to export anything? Am i missing something?

column9: Lots of potential! Missing features and bugs
column10:
I really like the minimalist design, it makes journaling very approachable. But its pretty bare bones in terms of features and has one really annoying bug.

Features it should have:
Naming entries 
Tag entries by categories 
Search entries 
Import/export
iPad support 
Mac support (really? I have to write on my tiny iPhone?!) 

Bug:
When typing, it auto jumps back and forth from the top and bottom sometimes, I can’t always see what I’m typing.

I will be using this app in hope that it will be improved over time, hopefully sooner rather than later. I would love to change this to a 5 star rating!

-It's one journal I can't create a different one for different experiences/ideas

-Doesn't let you organize it freely, has to be sequential by date

-When things are together like: images/sounds/locations/etc. they're laid out in a way you have little control of which is lame
Amazing app! I don’t generally like journaling because I don’t know what to write. This app has suggestions on what to write! It even offers reminders to write!

This app is a great start for journaling. Would be nice to have the option to have multiple journals and also to be able to share them. Not every journal is private and I would like to be able to share or even collaborate with my daughters.
LOVE how it needs my location.

column9: Good but I want it on IPad
column10: I enjoy it but want to use it with my apple pen
I like the app but recently, I can’t type more than a certain character limit because my text is not visible after that when I am typing?

Every time it prompts me to write about a visit or event, I click start writing now and it does nothing. But when I go to the Home Screen, it has added the event multiple times!!! And there’s no way to select all and select. So I had created sooo many blank entries as I thought the button wasn’t doing anything but it was creating them in the background and not letting me type. Please fix

I don’t usually write reviews but this app is phenomenal. I usually do my notes on Notability and Goodnotes since I am a student but as a new app the added features are great to have. I think that it would be beneficial if you could provide a handoff between all Apple devices. Looking forward to seeing how Apple may develop this app in the future.
I like the built in journal so I don’t have to write in my notes app. However, it’s painfully basic! It would be even better if you could also track your mood/emotions everyday.
I love this app

I feel like using the Journal app on my phone is a bit underwhelming having it on all Apple devices such as MacBook or better yet the iPads because of how natural it would feel being able to write your thoughts out using the pencil, I would love that and I think a lot of people would too! It has a lot of potential for what it could be.

Room for improvement
- search bar
- anonymous posting 
- title
- bold and italic writing
- colour writing
I do a lot on my phone, and am a fast tester, but journaling is not something I want to do on my phone. Make this available for MacBook and it would be great!

So far I have been mindfully able to do daily journals, capture & revisit memories without the urge to fake and paint for the outside world. There’s so much peace. It feels comforting while providing main character energy vibe where I can relive memories with sneakpeeks. This has been a great initiative. I will more so appreciate if there were options to categorize and sort the reflections along with additional formatting options as well as calendar view formatting. It will be great to have more lock features something like in app passcodes instead of regular Face ID or iPhone passcodes. I am literally excited for the app updates though & hopefully the overall app won’t end up consuming much storage🤞🏻
Apple please make more wellness focused apps/products. Well done.
I love this but please— can it have an iPad version too?! It would be prime use for the surface area & Apple pen use, etc. otherwise, digging in!!

I dislike how the entire entry turns to bold text. I turn it to normal, it turns back after a few seconds; it’s weird. I also think a timestamp button/feature would do this app good. I, like many others, journal periodically throughout the day and the keep things neat marking the time is a necessity. I could always type it out but a small button is very efficient.

column9: It has the potential but it’s far too simple at the moment.
column10:
It’s fantastic having a Journal app preloaded on an iPhone. The app has so much potential! Just not yet… at the moment, it’s far too simple and really only offers you to make a journal entry, and that’s it. it does recommend what you can do in your journal, such as reflecting on your day a workout you might have logged on Strava and perhaps some photos you’ve taken a day. 

I believe the real strength with the journal app is to possibly combine the mental health app where you can record the state of your mental health from very unpleasant to very pleasant in journal entries. For me, that’s a great way to visually see my mood and what I did that day and see common patterns to help how I can improve in the future.

Another great feature would be to add tags, I’m categories. this is so you can search back through your journal entries for certain life events or anything specific that happened.

I honestly don’t think it’s a bad app, it’s just not quite complete yet… hence the two star review for now. As it involves I will happily change my review. I possibly think it was released a little bit too soon and too simplistic. The mindfulness part of Apple health is truly amazing. If the Journal app can be bought up to that standard and perhaps even combined, then that will be truly a game changer for Journal apps.

column9: Super excited this is finally available
column10:
So happy this finally got released. Great starting point, but like lots of the reviews say, there’s some key features missing

1. Text formatting - when I use one of the prompts, the text associated with it is bolded but I can’t apply any kind of formatting to any of my own text. I also use bullet points a lot so would be nice if that was an option, almost like what’s built into the notes app. 

2. Picture location - they’re nice at the top but I would like the ability to have photos partway down entry so I can write next to the right photo

I know it’s brand new, so I’m happy with what it is for now!

This app would be a 5/5 if it wasn’t for the bad writing experience. First of all, typing has a lot delay. It takes a bit of time for the text to start appearing on the screen after I type it. In addition, once you get to a certain part of the page, the keyboard ends up blocking the text so I can’t see it and I am not allowed scroll up.

I also believe be in-text images should be allowed rather than them only appearing on the summary of photos.

Other than that, great app! The suggestions are amazing, the reflection ideas are very interesting and diversified and the design of the app is overall amazing. I also enjoy having notifications for Journaling Time. The fact that this is completely free is crazy. I’ve learned so much about myself in just 1 week and I am so appreciative of that. Once again, beautiful app!

column9: Why does it collect so much info?
column10:
I mean... it's ok i guess and the prompts are nice but not much different than the notes app. Also i read the privacy policy and from what i could understand this app has access to a lot of sensitive info... I know there'll be folks who say "i have nothing to hide so I don't care" but everyone wants SOME privacy, right? Do you lock up your house at night or what?
  Well, what I'm trying to say is that I wouldn't put every detail of my life onto one app- don't put all your eggs in one basket, ya know? And be careful what you trust with your information online, cause just because something is super popular doesn't make it automatically safe (tiktok, for example.) Have a good day.
Please add search capabilities within the app - thanks!

column9: Who created it? Why is it installed without permission?
column10:
I installed an iOS update on my iPhone and found this mystery app on my Home Screen.
Did you notice there is nothing identifying it as an Apple product? There’s no “About Journal” anywhere. Who is seeing my personal notes? No idea. How could Apple possibly think this is ok?
I understand there was a lot of API work under the hood, but it’s missing a couple of really basic features I use in my journals. Tags, for one thing.
Please make it available in ipad and macOS too
Auto-installed itself on my iPhone.
Please allow to create separate journals and allow for collaboration. I would love to use this for my home renovation and myself and my partner don’t really use social media so this would be perfect.
A great  system its set up to inspire you to write when you feel stuck ! It has really helped me 100%
What I would love to see is intervention with the Apple health state of mind.

It’s a great idea but we need more freedom in formating and cresting the layout of the text. 
I need the ability to choose the size of the text (to have different sizes in one note), to insert lists with bullet points, to insert images inside of the text, to change colors of the text…
Please add password protection. Thank you.

column9: Promising App, a Few Things Would Earn 5 Stars
column10:
I’ve seen a couple of folks on YouTube say they broke their social media addiction by micro-journalling with Notes. I didn’t like using Notes for that, I do like this. But it’s lacking a few things:

1. Timestamps. It adds the date to an entry but not the time. It’s odd that such a basic thing was overlooked.

2. Journalling is a mindfulness activity, yet this can’t be linked to Apple Health. Really? Isn’t this an app created by Apple?

3. No iPad version? Come on now!

4. Being able to create more than one journal.
 
5. Hashtags. Easy to add but optional for people who want a minimalistic journal.

I thought I’d downloaded this and forgotten, but I learned from reading other reviews that this is a new built-in Apple app. I agree with others that there should have been some sort of notice. People are concerned about security. I think Apple is pretty good with security but I understand people’s concerns. No warning this was coming and no in-app menu/settings. Only settings are the ones you find by going to your phone’s settings.

Apple, pleeeeease! I get it: you want people to stay in your ecosystem. But providing no option for export of journal entries - that‘s seriously lame and a bit over the top. 

I‘d really love to use the app, but only if I can make use of what I‘m journaling outside the app. 

Thanks in advance for a fix!

column9: It deletes sentences and even paragraphs.
column10: You would have to input details 4 to 5 times before it saves.

column9: Why is this not on ipad
column10: This could be a game changer for digital journals, however i refuse to use it until it is available on the ipad. Seriously. What a pain.

What is the point in the personal “confidential” diary if it is protected by my device passcode and Face ID? Some people know my passcode and can access my personal diary. Add a feature to change security methods.

No tags or filtering

No calendar and health integration

I was going to look for the Indeed app in a hurry bc I was upset and wanted to fill out new applications and found a new app waiting for me to click it all by itself on my Home Screen. Low and behold a journal to type my angry and sad feelings on. I feel so much better, now that I’ve wrote and read what I said to reflect. Also the butterfly cover is really what made me write this review. I have a thing about butterflies. They’re very special to me. Thanks for the new app Apple.

I really enjoy writing in my journal, but it’s difficult to set aside time to sit down and write. This app allows me to journal whenever I have a free moment. It pulls photos from my photo album automatically and so I can write about the day with photos which is great and beats a handwritten journal. 

My one piece of advice to the developers is to include reminders for each journal entry. For example, if I write about a holiday and what went well and what didn't go well, I’d like a reminder next year to read last year’s journal entry.
Hope this is available to the pads soon!

I think that it’s a good app, but it’s still very basic.  It needs search functionality and the ability to highlight entries with different colours. Otherwise it’s currently impossible to find past entries using keywords. Plus there is no iPad version of this app.

column9: bug where it skips up whenever you write a new line
column10: I have a screen recording of this bug but i can’t find where to submit a bug report. other than that one very annoying bug, i like it. the vibes feel secure enough to write whatever i want
I would use this app more if it were available for iPad. It’s too tedious to try to write much on the iPhone.

It should be easier to pick which song you want to use from your Apple Music library when making a new entry. It should also allow the option to select music from Spotify. Spotify is not even an option right now. Great app and great idea overall though.

a mood tracking feature would be great! like choice of what emotions you’re feeling that day and a scale of how strong those emotions feel so you can look back and correlate what happened that day with your mood.

I never leave reviews on things but when i tell you my notes app is my baby, my pride and joy, and this is just an even BETTER notes app !!
Being able to edit the note and NOT delete the date or read it WITHOUT editing it (automatically)! Adding photos is way easier and MUSIC??!! Reflection suggestions??!! Beautiful. They took it from feeling like a google doc to something to really write stuff in.
God send to journal-ers who were just making do with notes app. 
Only thing that could make it better, CUSTOMIZATION OPTIONS !!! Being able to change the colors maybe even add a little graphical theme to the background would change my entire life.

I love this app and have used it regularly since it was released. I really hope Apple supports it long term. It’s been great to pin songs, photos, locations and even contacts to entries. I only wish there were more journaling prompts and I don’t necessarily feel like they all need to be so simple, like “talk about a good thing.” I would love to be asked to reflect on how I overcame something tough, or what it took to fix a relationship or learn to say sorry. Let’s get deep!

column9: hopefully features that the notes app have such as table, search will be added!
column10: see above

The app is a great idea but, as many have pointed out, almost useless without Mac or at least iPad availability.  I would love to use this if I could make meaningful entries with a keyboard and also catalogue moments on the fly with my phone.
Very ergonomic. No fluff. Everything is where you need it to be. Thanks Apple for such a sleek & useful app.

I think this app is not necessary because it is better and more traditional to actually write on paper; it helps with penmanship, it’s more authentic, etc. This app is only good for people who can’t get a real journal. Apple is just trying to give us more reasons to be on our phones all day, when really the main necessities are keeping in contact with friends/family, and Google. Some other stuff too, but they are not that important. Therefore I think this app is useless. 🙁

Extremely frustrating that copy paste function is disabled as I planned on moving entries from another app into this one. Also, syncing across other devices is essential as I’d like the ability to be able to write from my macbook but that isn’t available either.

Seems like a lesser version of the Notes app at this point.

I love the UI + color palette! Super cute! I just think it’s missing a couple key features such as folders to organize your entries in by categories or a better way to organize in general. Anyways cute edition to iOS! :]

Videos and photos that were taken in the app cannot be viewed or used outside the app. It needs a share/export functionality for all information.

Needs a MAC version to continue, an entry or start a new one with details.

Phone edition is too limited for some entries, as they need a keyboard to make life easy, even typing this review is a pain on the phone.
I am love that I received my phone with this app. I was excited, but as I was typing my page kept scrolling back to the top. It keeps doing it!

column9: A Good Idea but a little too buggy.
column10:
I like the idea of a journal that reminds you to fill it. I needed something like that. However it’s odd to find that the keyboard is always open while editing or each new paragraph causes the screen to jump to the top like the developers didn’t expect long entries
Also text mysteriously disappearing is very odd. 
Then again, it’s very nice. I don’t know what the bookmark function is for though. Also perhaps allow users to choose where to put their pictures (while also showing a preview on the main menu if necessary); everything jumping to top is odd.

column9: Love it, hope it allows to print or save as a PDF
column10: Would really love this to allow you to create a PDF or make a book. Been using it to save all my sons activities as he grows up / would love a way to save/print/share this.

column9: New update deleted all of my old diary entries
column10: Please retrieve my old entries

column9: Great impact on my personal wellbeing
column10: I established a routine that really improves my mental state and helps me appreciate what I achieved and experienced!! Super cool that the app recommends moments i already almost forgot again😊

We need tags, folders and calendar!
Work needs to be separated have to delete 😭
This app is so good
Please add this for the Macs!

column9: Why was it auto-installed on my phone?
column10: Who knows.
Even can't add header.

column9: I woke up to this app
column10: When I looked at my phone. I Saw a notification that’s says that my phone updated to the latest IOS. And This is now my diary! 📔

I will never understand why Apple doesn’t make apps compatible with all of their products. This app would work so well on the IPad or the MacBook but is only available on the iPhone. Apple, please please PLEASEEEE get this onto the iPhone!

column9: The Best Gift EVER from Apple
column10:
I absolutely love, love this app! Thank you for the gift. I use it daily and it’s nice to not try to out it all down on paper for anyone else to see. The app is face protected and like that. It’s simple and easy to use. The settings for it, is understandable.
I like the suggestions of what to write about. Thank you!

I find it great that this app has been created. The app looks appealing. Unfortunately, some fundamental features are missing, such as:
- Text formatting is not possible.
- Journals cannot be exported.
- There is no search function.
- The hashtag function is missing.
- There are no options for a travel journal with a route map, etc.
- Journals cannot be shared with others.
- It's a shame that no features from the Memories and Notes apps were adopted.

I really hope the app will be optimized; there is definitely demand for it!

🙏🏻🙏🏻🙏🏻

column9: Good but just one thing to add
column10: When I think of journaling, I think of writing in a diary. I love journal because I’m able to write and not lose what I was writing. The one suggestion I have is to be able to lock some of the more personal entries. Again, journal is one of my favorite apps and I recommend it to anyone that likes to write!
I really hope an iPad version with Apple Pencil is coming soon, as my use of the app so far is very limited. Would love to see drawing, sketching, bujo capabilities.

column9: It’s pretty good apart from one thing
column10: It doesn’t automatically put the time in when you make an entry. It would be awesome if you could change that. Would also be awesome if you included weather and moods. But I do like the fact you can record yourself. Most journal apps charge you for that.

One thing that would make this app fantastic, would be the ability to search for keywords in the journal so that you could look back and remember when things happened on what dates. I’m really amazed that they haven’t thought of doing this when they were writing the app. For this reason I won’t use it until the search facility is available.
I find it a good source to write down whatever I like. But when I tried to edit my journal, it keeps moving to the end, which is very annoying.

column9: A great start, but could be improved
column10: Would be nice to have options for seeing/sorting previous entries. Examples include a calendar view, by location, sort by time incr/desc. A search field would be amazing for text/links, etc.

column9: Amazing idea just add more things
column10: Make the time you start writing it appear and stay. And ad cool things like rate your mood with a scale or emojis. And maybe let it combine everything that happened on one day. But journal is a great idea for an app just let it be for free please we buy y’all’s apple products anyway they’re the best

column9: Wish I could add journal categories
column10:
It would be great to be able to categorize my journal entries - then I could have entries for books I have read and segregate them from daily entries. Or categorize for movies, thoughts, hobby progress, and other random things. 

Otherwise, I’m only 2 days in but I like the app so far.

column9: Where did this app come from???
column10: I have no idea how this app got on my phone.  Do better Apple!

column9: Love it!! Hope they add more features
column10: I was so excited when i woke up to my phone freshly updated and saw this new app on my phone. I like to journal and i love the fact that you can add pictures. I do wish they add the ability for you to create your own prompts that you can do daily, not just the suggested ones. Kinda like a template you can make for your entries. Other than that i love it. I plan to not only use it as a journal for my thoughts but a digital scrap book as well. It would also be nice if we can create and name multiple journals. But i do get that it’s supposed to be a simple app.
Just like U2, you force another app on us

I love the idea of this app- to track and write about the little moments in life. There are just a few features I would add…
- pick the music I write about more than just the suggestions
- have folders of entries so I can track different things
-  add curations of photos from an event
- mix and match mediums (like add music with a photo or location)
- be able to change the color, font, size of text
- be able to move around the content so I can write about each thing individually

I’ve been looking for a good journal app like this, and I think it can be great!

column9: Needed tags and to fix glitches
column10:
Love the app so far but it could use an update with a few extra features. It needs tags of sorts possibly emotion tags, maybe emojis? Even just tags we can label our self and search or filter we can use to find our entries later. Also a calendar with you emotion for the day would be so enjoyable to have!

Apple, keep the cursor in my line of sight. I enjoy writing and I can get into a zone where the thoughts are just flowing.  In this Journal app after most words and definitely when I hit return it automatically scrolls to the top of the page. So so so ANNOYING!!!  I’m in the zone and focused on the letters spilling out and with a little pause BAM! it’s at the top of the page again. It’s disorienting and pops me out of my flow and irritates me. Keep the cursor in my line of site. I’ll scroll to the top when I am ready to. It serve no purpose other than to annoy.  (This happens with long texts in Messages, too, btw… keep it cursor focused!) I want to see where I’ve intended to place my text all the time. 

May this post help improve the app. It was just released this week.  May later versions remedy this issue. I really want to like this app. It has so much potential to be an amazing, daily use app.

column9: Great idea but needs a lot of improvement
column10:
The good: 
Journal entries are easy to make. 
It’s easy to attach photos and other items from a select few apps. 
I can backdate journal entries. 

The not so great:
There is a very little functionality around finding past entries. 
There is no search feature. 
I can only filter entries by attachments from the few select apps that Apple has chosen.
I can’t select other apps that are important to me to attach content or use as prompts. 
I can’t add custom topics or tags to filter by.

I have been using the Notes app to keep a journal, and this app has a few huge improvements over the Notes app, including suggestions and being able to set the entry date. However, it’s missing so much of the functionality that the Notes app has, that I think I will stick with Notes.
Please update to let us have an option to set a separate passcode! If someone got in our phone with one password, they can surely get into our journal with the same code!

1. This app should be compatible with iPad’s as well.
2. This app needs Face Lock I’d unlock feature.
3. If we would be able to share with friends/family of that particular day would be helpful.
4. Reminders, how do the person feel, how is their mood such can also be added

column9: Very cool, some general ideas though
column10:
This app is a really cool concept. Taking daily notes on my laptop is hard to keep track of since I don’t always use it. So an app like that being on my phone is very useful!

However, some key takeaways that other apps are just simple quality of life things. Such as headers, links. Also didn’t really acknowledge the quota thing, but that’s a bit of an odd thing to do. I really hope this is stored on my iPhone and not iCloud. Just seems like something that should also be an option. 

Since even one of the suggestions is to write something about a friend maybe being able to add their contact the same way you do with iMessage could be cool. Or adding songs from like Apple Music and Spotify. Just things to make this more than just a journal, more like a blog on your phone?

column9: Great idea if i could copy paste from notes to here
column10: I thought this would be great because I previously used my Apple Notes app to journal. I attempted to copy a note and paste into the new journal app. However, it allows me to copy content from my Note,  with no paste option to put it within a Journal app entry! Please fix.

- Would love more writing features, similar to the options in the "Notes" app that Apple has. - Also, I copied and pasted some text from a photo into my Journal app, and it glitched out...now nothing in the app works at all, even after deleting and downloading it again. 
- Also, I tried adding a photo to an entry, but it only lets me add it to the top of the entry instead of where my typing indicator is currently located. And when the photo does attach at the top, I'm unable to move it anywhere else.
I thought Apple learned their lesson with the U2 iTunes fiasco. Never load something onto someone's device without their explicit knowledge and permission. But this dystopian garbage is even worse.

As a huge Day One fan, I love that there’s some competition because the annual fee is stupid high. First impression, I like the clean simplicity ui. The personalized suggestions feature seems cool. Love being able to add multiple images and media without subscription model.
My recommendations are to allow for headers. And I haven’t tested it yet, but please make it as simple as possible to transfer journal entry data to a PC if not already. Saying this because I hate iOS photo transfer system to PC.
Otherwise, I’m super excited to see how this app evolves overtime and to have another solid option for e-journaling.
It would be great if we can have it synced & on the ipad as well. Also I wish we could add entries from ‘ state of mind ‘ (health) or events and format text

column9: Why not the same for ipad
column10: Too bad latest ios update 17.2 does not include journal for ipad.  Journal entries and reflections at the end of the day are easier to enter on an ipad with larger screen and key board.
Sometimes I write too many things, it's a pity that there is no sorting. The functionality of the application is disappointing.

column9: Make My Memories Searchable: Feature Wish List
column10:
I absolutely love this Journal App! It's such a valuable tool for capturing my thoughts and memories. However, I have a few ideas that could make it even more amazing:

A powerful search bar would be a game-changer! It would be fantastic to instantly find specific entries based on keywords, and see the total number of relevant journals at a glance.
Visualization dashboards would be super helpful! I'd love to see stats like the number of entries, photos, audio clips, and even visited locations. This would provide a great overview of my journaling journey and let me track progress visually.
By implementing these features, I think the app would become even more intuitive and enjoyable to use. Thank you for your continued development, and I can't wait to see what you come up with next!

My Journal app worked for a moment, but now opens on a blank entry screen and I can’t click anything.

It seems like a great app so I’m disappointed it’s not working.

column9: PLEASE LET US CREATE A PERSONAL PASSCODE RATHER THAN OUR FACE ID & IPHONE PASSCODE!!
column10: This is extremely crucial because I don’t want the people who know my iPhone passcode to be able to view my journal!! Please do something about it!! Let us have the option to create a separate passcode!
Not even backed up to icloud and synced for other devices.
This app was much needed and minimalism is nice but it would still be cool to change the color of the font and page background!

column9: Streamlined and Simple, with much room for improvement
column10:
The app itself is designed well enough. The UX is incredibly simple and the ability to generate entries with prompts from your day’s activities is a cool feature that not even Day One has. That said, there is plenty of room for improvement, both in terms of function as well as performance:

- most importantly, we NEED the ability to set a passcode that is different than our iPhones. I don’t mind my girlfriend reading my texts but I do NOT want her to have access to my journal
- when typing, the screen often bounces back to the top of the page with no warning which is confusing and annoying
- an integration with BeReal would be great

I just got the app with the recent update. Initially, I was excited, but I can’t edit the suggestions for the subject in journaling. I’d like to have 2 topics that always show up to remind me to write about such as “Who do you want to be?” “What did you like about today?”, but it’s automatic. I can refresh it or turn it off. But I can’t make them.

Really need the option to set your own password and not faceid/pin code

My kids and wife use my phone regularly and thus know my pincode which makes it a bit pointless for me to use.

I’d like to suggest adding a mood rating to each of the journal entries to better track one’s mental health and mood.  It would be cool to be able to pull up a chart or graph that shows your overall mood ratings over a month or year.

column9: Make available on iPad and other things
column10:
Add lines and grids. I like to journal but I like to hand write my entries.

I am currently using the Notes app.
This is amazing. Love that I can add videos. But please! Make available for iPad and ability to use Apple Pencil for handwriting or sketches!!! 💜
This app is so good really nice app
Is there any way to lock the app to keep it private?

Great App. 
Would be great having an option to lock the entries too.

There’s potential there.

I think the most urgent fix is to be able somehow label your journal entries. Tags, subfolders for bookmarks or something, so it would be easier to go back when you are looking some specific entries.

column9: DO NOT PUT JUNK IN SECURITY UODATES !!
column10:
I DID NOT REQUEST THIS RUBBISH YOU PUSHED ONTO MY DEVICE THROUGH A SECURITY UPDATE ANOTHER  WAY FOR YOU TO SPY ON PEOPLE HOPING THAT THEY WOULD TYPE SENSITIVE INFORMATION IN THIS APP

DO NOT PUSH JUNK ON MY DEVICE WITHOUT MY AUTHORITY

I’ve just started using the journal to keep a diary of my holiday as in the past I easily forget where I have been and what I did, so it will be useful to look back and remember. I would like to be able to add hyperlinks to my walks or insert QR codes into the images.

column9: LOVE IT BUT ONE THING THAT SHOULD BE ADDED
column10: i think there should be a folder option added in the future. (for example: personal, gym, work, ideas, etc) just as a way to see your entries as a specific topic other than all at once which could get overwhelming or messy. :)

I was really looking forward to this app but was pretty disappointed.

I like the minimalist design but it went to far. The prompt suggestions are nice but when you want to journal with a specific song you are out of luck if it not one of the suggestions. You should give the user the ability to add specific songs or specify other workouts or locations etc.

In short, the prompt/suggestion should’ve replace the ability to customize your own journal entry. 

Another thing I missed right away, was text formatting. It is possible through long press to do some simple formatting but it needs more features. And easier access to the formatting.
I just started using this app 10 minutes ago and everything I write is in bold. I don’t want the entire entry to be in bold so any help you could offer would be much appreciated.

column9: OMG THIS APP IS AMAZING! But…
column10: Ok so, super good app. But it could use some things, perhaps like a way to sort your notes, like put your notes into different categories, or choose what order your notes will appear in. I love this app, I have been using it for a while, i have many notes. After a while, it takes a long time trying to find an important note that you wrote a long time ago, So maybe a sorting system would help me… it would be a 5 star, but this is the only small issue.

column9: Another mediocre Apple release. Not impressed. Bugs. Little feature besides smart suggestions.
column10:
Needs to have options for titling and easier access to edit the date of entry as I would like to transfer over some entries from the notes app that I have used like a journal but keep the original date of posting. 

It is buggy right now and keeps jumping to the bottom of the page in the middle of voice dictation or typing. This is very annoying to have to scroll back up and click in the correct spot. Voice dictation normally jumps back to the right spot when you talk again after a pause but it constantly spastically jumps from your spot to the bottom and then back up. 

I guess we need to get used to having poor feature update for Apple products now (phones, apps, watches). Been very disappointed with lack of technology upgrades.
Have all my data or whatever but, let’s hope you have the servers to hold.

Add share content function with friends contact, user can choose private or share contents with friends and family, this will definitely to help connecting family and friends very well. Glad to see Apple launch this apps, which can record daily life.
These are the creative and loving ideas that I expect from Apple developers. This is what sets this company apart in my opinion.

column9: THIS IS APPLE’S NEW WAY OF PRYING FOR SENSITIVE INFORMATION
column10:
BE CAREFUL EVERYONE! 

I have tried several times to toggle off notifications and journaling suggestions, yet I have still been receiving them for weeks now. 
Absolute violation of privacy. Will be uninstalling.
I loved the app until I realized I can’t password protect it.  Just it being secured by the phone passcode isn’t enough.  My family knows my passcode, they don’t need to know my thoughts.

I love journaling, with or without prompts. I so so so greatly enjoy this app. As someone who is very busy, I find this app an amazing idea because I would like to journal more often but I rarely have time at home. Features I believe are great would be responding to the prompts, adding location, and adding pictures into the entries. The pictures are a unique addition because whenever I journal in a book, I never add pictures since it’s tedious to print pictures and go pick them up from the store, and it’s a long time to wait for them to be shipped. 

Definitely recommend using this often!!

An unexpected new addition after an update. It actually looks quite decent. Nice, simple interface, easy and tidy. As a new release, I hope to see Apple add some more features, such as customising the colours and some more journalling suggestions. I’m looking forward to actually using this daily, where previously I’ve struggled with aesthetics or interfaces of others. Would have given 3 and a half stars, but would be happy to increase the rating after more use and if more features are added.

Get the app right now it’s so good!!! It helps my mindset and everything. It’s literally a free journal! Thanks Apple.

column9: Good start but needs some basic features
column10:
I like the idea and direction of this app. The automation aspects by way of suggestions has a great opportunity to be extremely useful and effective at prompting and promoting reflection. 

What’s missing for me is some basic management features. I’d like to be able to Search context with my entries. Ability to organize my entries by topics or buckets to separate journal entries that are specific to a particular activity or topic. Also the ability to organize or pin bookmarked entries to make allow me to make some front and center.

Additionally I would like the ability to create templates where I would like to provide some prompts for my entry. 

Lastly, the ability to sort and group entries over periods of time such as Months or Years so they can filed away in an organized way and avoid a never ending list on the journal view.

I imagine this app will continue to improve and I look forward to what’s ahead.
Huge potential in one app, but its only for iphone…

column9: Wish it was on my IPad
column10: I love to keep a journal. I just wish this app was on my IPad as well. So I can type or write with my Apple pen.

I found most of the journaling apps out there to be overwhelming. I liked the idea that it would bring memories into it, and I could have thoughts from years past. 

It wasn’t suggesting the photos I recently took so I created a new blank entry. Either I don’t know how to do headers or headers are only available for suggested journal entries. I created a new blank journal entry, but I never got the header option so everything I wrote is in bold header format. 

I put a lot of time into an audio note and when I was finished, I loved that it was there. However, I didn’t see any way to export it to any other application or save it anywhere. It’s a safe and secure way to store your journal but there’s no way to export it or give anyone access. It’s a note for an ongoing idea but I have no way to tag it or export it. Share ability? What if I want to share this with my kids? Do I have to give them access to my full iPhone just to get it? I have no way of putting this in any other format? In my opinion journals are for future generations. Yeah, it’s nice to look back on your own history but I want it for my kids and one day grandkids, I’m not sure what the point is if I can’t export anything, I can’t customize it, and I can’t share it. 

First and last time user.
Didn’t ask.
Would be awesome if the next update was released for the iPad.

I love this app. The suggestions are great to remind me to talk about events. But I want the ability to share entries with family and friends. Some sort of share function would make this a 5 start app in my book.

column9: I can’t export my journal in any way
column10: It’s a major problem because it means that I’m stuck using an iPhone

I’d life to first say, I like the aesthetic. The app is clean, fresh, and overall has  nice vibe. 

I enjoy the ability to add images, voice recordings, and location. 

Ofcourse I live the fact it’s password locked (that’s my favorite part), but I feel like it’s somewhat lacking.

I feel like for journalling it would be nice to have multiple mini journals, maybe with a limit of 5 or 10. As someone who writes a ton, not only about my day, but dreams, people, and wishes. It feels like that would be a lot more organized.

I also felt like fonts would be a nice touch to add. I usually find normal text typing very harsh on the eyes. And the small “format” changes don’t really help, as there is only 4 options.

So I love the concept but I’d love to see more organization and customization options.

It has so much more potential, but isn’t reaching that. It is very basic without the option change much at all.

The biggest con is that you cannot set a separate passcode for this app specifically. That would make it much more secure.

This app still has glitches, if i write until the bottom row it always glitching.
Appel please fix this immediately, thanks.

Something is wrong with the cursor. When I hit the space bar, it’s taking me to a different part of the page (top or bottom) where I don’t want to be. Very frustrating as I’m losing spot while making edits.

column9: Being able to customize would be nice
column10:
I’ve been wanting to get into journaling but just never did.  With this new update, it’s now right there and I have no excuse not to.   It is nice to sit and reflect on your day or your week and if you get stuck, they have prompts to help you along.  

My only critique would be to allow the user to customize their entries.  I like to color code things and being able to use different colors or fonts would be nice.

As someone who has journaled on and off throughout the last thirty years the idea of getting back into it appealed to me but this app is a real let down. 
Focusing too much on pulling your data from pictures and not enough on what a Journalling app needs, this app is missing too many features to make it worthy of your time. 
You can’t add timestamps, so multiple entries in one day will be out of chronological order. 
You can’t format headings or paste images into specific sections of the entry, so at this point Notes as more functionality but you can’t customise the date on Notes. 
There’s no tagging feature. Maybe you could use hashtags but there’s no search feature anyway so, again, Notes is better. 
No templates option for recurring entry styles. 
No version available on iCloud so you can’t update it from any other device. 
It doesn’t even fully integrate with all the native iOS apps on your phone. I thought the wellbeing notes from the Health app might be something that I’d be able to pull through to Journal, but nope, it can’t do that either. 
All in all, this is probably the worst execution of a journaling tool I’ve ever experienced.

column9: Would love to add titles and tags
column10:
Using the journal app. Is pretty minimalist and good to use. But I’d really like the option to add titles to my journal entries and add tags to kind of categorize my thoughts to come back to review them. 
For now it feels more like a locked version of the notes app with suggestions.
Will this app ever be available to ipad. It’s ridiculous that its not available in all apple devices.

This App appeared after an ios update. Why would I want to post my personal life on a hackable thing like a smart phone?   Journaling on paper helps the brain put things in perspective. Posting crap memes and short sentences on a phone is just a form of self-aggrandizement. 
Get it off your phone and don’t waste your energy/time/morals.

I think the app has a lot of potential. The suggestion feature is handy. What I’d like to see is the ability to search the content for text. Maybe even set some tags or sort journals into folders based on their topics. Maybe even give the journal entries a title. Heck it could even suggest a title based on content, location, people in images.

I see no share button!?! How could that be? 

Let say I wrote a poem into the journal app but want to email it to myself for further editing - why can’t I do that?!

Why can’t I even ‘select all’ ?! 

Seems pretty simple stuff I can do in every other app on my phone

column9: Not allowing me to set a day and time reminder
column10: This is saying I should allow notifications on the app in settings but all notifications is on and still not allowing me to set reminders.

column9: Stop downloading apps to my phone during mandatory updates
column10: I did not ask for this app, but it appeared on my home page after having to do a mandatory update by apple.

So far it looks good, I haven’t used it too much but, the first story it suggests is a nice walk I did which, it pulled in for from my outdoor walk from my Apple Watch (which is also a problem). My nice walk was 3kms and took me over 3 hours to do… meanwhile I hadn’t stopped my outdoor walk on my watch and it decided my 23km drive to the beach and back was a 3km walk?!? It even showed a map of the drive and had 3kms… I wish the beach was 3kms away. First, fix the watch. I’m kind of tired of it racking up kilometres while I’m DRIVING. Second, the map, distance and time is completely incorrect… kinda bummed about Apple AI. It’s as bad as that moron Siri 🙄

Positives:

Apple claims that it is private and encrypted, which means that my inner thoughts will hopefully be safe from any possible prying eyes
I can set a daily pop-up reminder to prompt me to post
Negatives:

I’m a big fan of formatting to help keep my thoughts organized (bold, italics, underline, indent, numbering, and bullets) The Journal app doesn’t offer any of that, which is seriously frustrating!
Part of me thinks that if this becomes something that really matters to me, I’ll want to print it out and save the pages somewhere in a notebook… But it isn’t possible with this app
What happens to my journal if I don’t stick with Apple in the future? Will I still have access to what I’ve written?
There doesn’t seem to be a way to organize or group posts by subject or category… so unless you know the date, you’ve written some thing, it’s basically impossible to find it again without reading through each and every entry

Good. Would be better if it is on iPad as well. Is this planned?

absolutely love that it focuses on the point of a journal app. nothing distracting u from beginning an entry. reflection prompts are fantastic. 
would love a widget!
I been waiting for Apple to bring us this. I’m impressed. Obviously like any other app we can use new features but overtime I’m sure they’ll deliver!!!! THANK YOU.
I like the journal app but i would much rather journal in my ipad than on my phone tbh
I'm happy with the app, but I just wish it was available on ipad and support apple pencil. Sometimes, you just want to handwrite instead of typing, you know.

I've been using it for the past week and honestly this is the first journal app I'm consistent with. I wanted to use the app as it seems exactly what I am looking for - journal entries enhanced with different sorts of media. 

However, there is a definite show-stopper: I am unable to export the journal (or parts of it). This said, I am afraid that access to my entries are inevitably subject to the journal app. A user-friendly export possibility (be it pdf or a different format) is a prerequisite for me to use this app, so that I know I will have access to the content in 5 or 10 years, independently from the journal app.

I love everything about this app except for one major pain point. I recorded a 12-minute stream of consciousness video. Once I was done recording, the app mentioned I’d exceeded the attachment limit and must delete larger items i.e. the video in question. There are so many solutions for this. 1) Why didn’t the app warn me WHILE I was recording that I’ve reached the limit? 2) Why can’t my Journal storage be linked to my iCloud storage? 3) And if none of those are possible (they are), why can’t I save the video in my camera roll before removing it? Please fix this.

column9: A lot of room for improvement…
column10:
All the comments from other users  about missing functions are true and valid (filtering, classification, timeline, etc.)… there are some important points to add:
1) I’d like to write my posts from a given PC interface (iCloud, a dedicated webapp…), 2) use a password different from that used to unlock the phone
3) being able to export the posts to a txt, doc or pdf format 
4) assign a title to posts
I like the potential of the app! I think I would use it way more if it was available for the iPad.

I need to start this review by saying that I’m someone that has kept a journal every day since 1990. That’s over 12,000 days. I’ve already imported all of those entries into the Day One journaling app because of its functionality, including the “On This Day” feature, adding the weather, what music I’m listening to, how many steps I’ve taken and much more. If Apple wants to compete for my attention, they need far more functionality, including the ability to import entries from other sources. The barebones is okay so far but nowhere near enough for me to give up Day One. I’ll increase my score when the app provides more functionality.

I’m loving the app so far. Here are things I love about it: 

- I love the reflection questions, journaling suggestions and highlights from my photos memories.
- I love that you can put a lock on the app.
- I love the color of the app when using my phone in dark mode. 

However there are a few points I wish there were:

- I wish I could change the format of the text quicker and easier to select more formats in one go (without having to select the text over and over again) like the section on the Notes app, to make it more customizable and easier to read.
- I wish there was a search bar to find my entry’s faster.
- I wish I could organize my entry’s in folders, without having to filter all the time.

In overall, I’m still going to use the app! I wish there will be changes though, because it’s lovable! 💗

Hello. I think the app is great but it would be better with a feature that let us to connect journals or create a journal for a journal. It’s common to have a reflection and come back later to it, sometimes month or years after you write it. In those scenarios, it’s common to have new insights, new experiences, or new reflections, and it would be great to connect both, it’s different to just edit the old one. Also, journaling is about materializing, in some way, the abstraction of our minds, emotion, and thoughts. A lot of good ideas comes up when journaling. By connecting them, it easier to connect the dots and create “aha moments”. P.S: I like the background color of the app when it gets dark

I use this nearly every day. First time journaling digitally and loving it. 

New feature suggestions: 

- A search bar to search words or dates in the app. 

- Multiple journals (You could mirror the books app for this, and have the ability to make custom covers) 

- the ability to add more data to each post, or in all compression so that the pictures and videos we upload take up less space 

- the ability to add different kinds of bookmarks, similar to “Tags” on Mac 

- 🌺 the option to Link our “State of Mind” flower from the health app to our journaled days as an option in the corner of posts. Further enhancing Apples promotion of mental health and utilising the app as an “at a glance” mental health tracker. It would also allow us to see if our mental health and the content of the day correlate. 

- the ability to jump to the date of a post in the photos app

- the addition of custom font choices and backgrounds for the journal app. Especially if you allow multiple journals. 

I have loads of ideas, I think this could potentially be one of apples most promising new apps!

column9: app frozen despite failed attempts to fix it
column10:
i love the app so far! unfortunately, it still needs some updates. my app is frozen!

while editing an entry i had previously saved, i tried shaking my phone to undo (as this had previously worked on the app). seeing that it wouldn’t give me the undo option upon shaking, i closed the app without saving in hopes it would return to the last saved version of the entry (thus undoing the edits i had done and wanted to undo).

after that, i tried opening the app and it was blank for a long time. now it only shows “Journal” with the plus button and three lines at the top right, with no button working. i have offloaded the app, uninstalled the app, and restarted my phone. i went as far as uninstalling the app, restarting my phone, then reinstalling.

since it’s a new app, i’m hoping that a future app update or even ios update will fix the issue. i came to really enjoy using the app and i hate having to wait to use it without a clear reason. i also have no idea if my previous entries will even be saved. i hope they are, though i have a suspicion that the last entry i had edited is now corrupted, so if the journal app isn’t working, it might be due to the previous entries still existing within it.

thank you for reading :))

column9: Very good if your like simplicity

column9: Huge potential, too basic still to be useful
column10:
The concept is amazing and exactly what is needed, a great journaling app through which to capture, enhance and round out the way we immortalize, organize and relive our memories. Many of which happen via our Apple devices already. 

However, for it to truly be useful a number of basic things are missing, amongst others:
1. The ability to attach an unlimited amount of photos and videos
2. The ability to show Photos and videos on a map view like in the “photos” app to see where one was that day or week and click through it that way 
3. The ability to attach voice recordings from other apps, especially including from apples own “voice memos” app 
4. The ability to tag entries and organize them into folders etc
5. The ability to tag sections in entries with things like: ‘thought’, ‘todo’, ‘personal development thought’ etc so it becomes searchable and groupable 
6. The ability to have custom templates for journal entries 

Etc. 
Apple, please implement these, you are onto something great, but only if you make this a broad featured app rather than keeping it minimal and high level like you prefer keeping your apps. Particularly important on this one as you Apple have the trust of users to keep this kind of data and the ability to connect all of the information sources.
Very strange that the consumer centric ideals of Apple didn’t think of making this available for an iPad?

Started journaling and then abandoned it due to some key missing features. No ability to export your entries in any way, and can’t have more than 1 journal. This is basically “Notes” with some smart prompting. If that’s your jam, this app is ok. Sad, as I had high hopes for this app. Sorry, Apple. You can do much better than this.

As many other reviewers mentioned, the app is a nice addition, but definitely needs some improvements. The “find” and “search” capability for sure is the number one problem lacking. Apple, if you’re listening, we need that!

column9: Okay, Hoping for Improvement Through Updates
column10:
I think the interface is pretty enough, and straightforward enough. I don’t hate this app, but after hearing rumors that it was coming and anticipating this for months, and updating ALL of my devices to get it once I realized it had been launched, I’m disappointed overall. 

Firstly, this app is only available for iPhone. Neither my MacBook or my iPad have access to it despite running the most recent iPadOS and macOS. 

Next, this app also seems to have extremely limited function. I can’t edit the background color of each “page,” I can’t edit my font, I can’t edit the font size, spacing, or color. I pasted some “entries” in from my Notes app, and they have a totally different line spacing than entries typed within the Journal, with no option to edit the spacing to make them consistent. I tried to insert a photo in-line, and discovered that isn’t an option. It placed my photo at the top of the entry, and the only option available was to remove the photo. If there are more options for photos, I can’t see them, because every time I click the photo inside the editor the entire app freezes. 

I had never tried the Freeform app before, because I don’t like the idea of a massive board with no set page size, but my disappointment in this app led me to try that, and I was blown away by the difference. 

If we could have customizable pages in the Journal app with similar functionality, this would be a huge hit. I loved that in Freeform, I could customize my font, font size, and font color, and move things around the page. I think the Journal app is majorly missing out by not including stickers, and I was glad to see that Freeform includes them. A function I would love to see brought into both is the ability to rotate text, photos, and stickers. 

Bottom line, would love to see this Journal app include a lot more customization going forward. I like the customizability in Freeform, but I think a “book” or “page” layout for journaling would be ideal - not a huge board with unlimited size and funky zooming. I would love to see this app become a hybrid of what it is now, with certain customization elements brought in from Freeform. 

I love what Apple has done as far as creating a portfolio of their own apps (Photos, Health, Freeform, Books, etc.) so I can sync across devices seamlessly and enjoy the clean, intuitive interfaces Apple is known for. For that reason, I don’t want to branch out into other journaling apps (if you are interested - I’ve heard great things about Day One). 

For now, I think I’ll use this for text-only writing, and start using Freeform for photos, stickers, and as a more creative outlet overall, but one day I hope to be able to keep all my journaling here, instead of split between two apps, and keep Freeform’s use more towards its intended Productivity purposes.
I love the UI and ability to add music and pictures but I would love to be able to add my mood for the day. For a journal, it definitely needs more thought provoking prompts.
