I love how it collects moments with pictures, music, places visited etc.  it makes writing about my day easier as I am not one who can think things to write about without prompting. I would like to know that it’s being backed up somewhere. It would be cool to have the share ability to share memories with friends and family. It has lots of potential and I hope you keep this app around. Journaling can be so good for you.

column9: Good Start - Needs to be on more platforms
column10:
I was excited when this app was launched, and it has A LOT of great features but the reason I like Apple is not because of the individual devices but how they all integrate and become part of the Apple Ecosystem.

I want to journal on my iPad with the Apple Pencil or maybe on my MacBook because the phone screen is small and the digital keyboard just does not feel engaging enough
I love it. And I would use it even more if I could use it on my iPad with my keyboard or pencil.

column9: Enjoy it and would enjoy it more with a few more features
column10: I didn’t want anything too fancy so this has been a great medium for journaling over using Docs. The features I’d like to see are multiple reminders, a calendar view, and a way to export the data (hopefully I didn’t miss any of those). Overall, it’s a good start.
I would love to save everything online on a webpage so I will never loose this memories. When is this feature going to come? Thank u for this experience
It would be nice to see a monthly view showing which days you added an entry and which you didn’t
Simple to use. But why isn’t there a Mac integration? I use notes interchangeably between my phone and Air. This would easily be a five star app with a multi device integration.

column9: Needs an iPad and Mac app
column10: Great app if you only journal on your phone. I will only start to use it once it's available across all iPhone, iPad and Mac.
This app is really good except you can’t make titles
The app is very easy to use and organized nicely. I wish you had the ability to see the full calendar and to be able to color the text.
I see the potential here, but without it being on the iPad, I probably will not use it as I would like to.

I tried to find out sharing option but I couldn't 
And will it sync with iCloud?
Please tell me there's a share option and a syncing option 
Because if there's not 
Writing a journal and keeping it as it is would be an issue.
Please help out ..

column9: Search bar and iCloud+ web access please
column10: It would be great to have a search bar to see what date have you done a specific task and everything else. Also, it would be great if you can do your entry for the day in your computer via iCloud+ for those who wanted to continue journaling in case of a lost phone.

Strong potential for a journaling app. here is what is missing that I hope will be added:
1. The ability to link apple notes to your journal entries.
2. Putting tags in your journal entries in order to categorize them, with integrated syncing to your Apple notes and Apple reminders tags.
3. saving journaling templates that you can easily pull up to fill out a daily log, such as a gratitude template.
4. A toggle option for how you are feeling with the emojis
5. Expand the ability to import other data, similar to other journaling apps, such as weather, location, workouts, etc..

column9: No mac app - useless for me
column10:
Apple got lazy... In former times every app they did was finished to the last touch... Now they throw out apps with missing translations or without connection to their own ecosystem. Just disappointing.

The app has huge potential, but there are like over thousand journaling apps out there that are mobile-only. I prefer writing my journal on a keyboard, because if you know how to type with 10 fingers you'll finish your entry in 5 minutes instead of an half an hour.
This app needs a password protected option. I won’t be able to write freely until then

column9: I have been surprisingly an avid user
column10: I was kind of excited when I heard this was coming out, as I wanted to do journaling, but I didn’t want it to become another chore. This app certainly helps it not be. It’s so easy to capture my thoughts and sentiments when I want to get them down, I appreciate that I can do voice typing and also add pictures and images and videos to augment my entries. I’m actually finding it very therapeutic and very helpful and expressing in words how things make me feel, and to capture memories.

If I continue typing and when cursor moves to next line sometimes text disappears.
This is not case if I click return. Once text disappears I need to go to last visible line and at end need to press return then in new para text is visible. Please correct this issue.

column9: A severely downgraded version of the Notes app
column10: Apple is really starting to fall behind. Why release a Journal app, if there has no search feature, keyword feature or available on the iPad. I might as well use my Notes app. I was hoping to have a daytrading journal set up with some great features. Instead, it’s a basic useless app that has a privacy facial recognition and bookmark mode… I can do the same on my notes app… So dumb… #MissSteveJobs.
I’d like to be able to save my own prompts that I want to use daily instead of typing the same thing every single day and answering the questions.
I hope Apple updates this app frequently with new features. At bare minimum, tags and search options that include the ability to search by word, by date, etc.

column9: Good First Cut but Need Folders!!
column10: The app is well designed and the suggestions are really neat. But, there is no way to organise the different types of entries. Please please please bring folders to easily sort and organise different types of entries!!

It’s not objectively 5/5 app, but I give it 5 stars to counter BS reviews, that give it horrible rating just because its not on iPad and so on. I believe the improvements and en route. Would be great if you could add specific music to your entry.

Its great combined with mood tracker in health app. Mental health is becoming a huge problem and Apple is on its way to offer a great tools to its user base.
Add the ability to search in journals and export a certain time frame as an pdf.
I wish there was a way to start separate journals, not just separate entries. I also wish you could title entries without a prompt. Similarly, I wish you could better organize your entries.

It does its job but it really needs some more options for customization. It’s a bit boring to use. You get a similar experience typing in your notes app. I’d like to place photos in specific places in my entries. The swipe to bookmark or delete is a bit too sensitive? That might be just me but… I still find the app a bit lackluster.
At the end of the day, I often sit down with my iPad, rather than my iPhone. And yet, it’s not available on iPad.
I would like to have this app on all the devices that are in ecosystem, so i can update and add across all devices, and not just restricted to one.
At least if I wrote in a “journal” I can be more expressive than on social media without becoming a celebrity or having my entire life be filled with hate by people who have jobs.

I love the app. Only thing is. I wish it was on Macintosh as well. I’ve tried to find it on my intel MacBook Pro, couldn’t find it. I haven’t checked to see if it’s on M1 iMac yet. Wish it was universal.
Very basic flaws that even the cheapest apps don’t have.
I can't find a way to lock the journal entries
This is really useful application, could be if you will add formatting, searching and other functions from previous comments. Please don’t stop!

column9: Waiting for the app on the iPad and Mac
column10:

I’m sure this app will evolve. Hope to see a lot of improvements soon :)

When you copy something from the note app to it and you try to comeback and write or re-write it always direct me to end of the page. It is very weird.

Seems that once you start writing it you can't change anything.

Need more space as the cursor approaches the end of the page.  Pretty basic stuff. Surprised they shipped it like that. 
Otherwise no complaints so far. I’m on day two of using it.

I've been jumping right into this app as I have been using it to record some holiday reflections. I use voice to text. When I go back to correct a word or change something or add a new line it jumps down to the end of the text. I'm assuming this is a bug that will be fixed?
I like it, I would like it even more if I could write my journal using my Mac.

You need to improve A LOT in this app asap. Make some folders so that we could group the entries in the way we want, categorize different topics, bot just a solid page with entries. Add calendar function as well as search bar. Make it so we could access it via browser on Mac as you did with icloud. I mean, you have one of the best developers team in the industry and you give us an absolutely raw product.

First attempt at "journaling" overall. I like the app very much and it offers a lot of options to help build the habit of journaling. 
I would like to see cross platform integration with the iPad and Apple pencil. Perhaps this is in the works with future updates.

Using this as an entry to start journaling, layout and usability seems great but hoping for some more features as it’s developed further. Business option would be great and options for personal & business goals etc. Hoping it develops into a great app!

column9: Great to write but could be way better
column10: This app has so much potential but is so not there yet! The recommended entries are amazing but besides that, a lot of features are missing. I’d love to write in a browser or my Mac but still not possible. Would love to create my own entires with titles, not possible as well. I believe it will be better and I’ll be here to use it
When i type it keeps deleting words and i have to retype the same words a few times until it stops. Its extremely frustrating!

I currently journal in the notes app where you can create a password that is more secure than the 4 digit code to unlock the phone. I would love the option to enhance the password. Also, eventually options to sync apps like Spotify or screen time would be great. Also, more formatting options like bullet points and titles.  So far notes seems like a better option.

This is basically a worse version of the notes app. The only addition is the unhelpful starting suggestions. Why would I want to write about a song I listened to? Or a creative activity I did as a child? Needs better onboarding and value propositions - what are the benefits of journaling? Why is writing about your trip to the beach useful? Also, importing notes from other apps is a must if Apple is serious about replacing other journaling apps.

I was really looking forward to the arrival of Apple Journal App. On the face of it, it looks like a very clever app with some very good features, however, there’s a few things that let it down for me.  Some basics are missing, I couldn’t paste a paragraph of text, there’s no share/export feature there are no tags, I would like to have the option of adding data from more Apps. I’m sure the Devs will only improve on this as time goes on, but considering we were waiting for this app since the realise of iOS 17, the app still feels unfinished and doesn’t seem worth the wait.

WHY CAN’T I PASTE TEXT INTO JOURNAL?

i love it, but when i take notes on a book im reading and the journal page gets rlly long it lags. when the page gets too long the typing gets super laggy and sometimes the spacer will glitch to the top or to the bottom while im typing. 

but i love it and i love the suggestions it provides too, hopefully we see more things.

Great app for journaling, quick and easy to get started and love the “suggestions” and links to photos, maps, fitness etc.

Very disappointed the app is not linked to apples health app - “mood logging” though. Seems a very natural fit to bring this data together and link it so we can see how journal entries and mood are linked.
How to change face ID to device password? Tq
Still I don't understand why i need to use journal if i have notes ? Also you can control where to add the photos or between 2 lines ! Which notes can do

App works ok and the suggestions it makes are good. However it is missing basic functions - I have 2 entries for one date and can’t reorder them chronologically. I’d also like to have multiple journals so that I can track different things separately

This Journal app does nothing that Apple Notes can't already do. Unfortunately it offers a lot less facilities than Notes. You cant export to other apps. You cant annotate or markup any photos. There is no document scanning facility. And there is something weird going on with the predictive typing. Probably many other problems, but I can't be bothered to find out. Very poor effort for something that has been hyped up for months.
Please make this available on the iPad that is where I do most of my journaling. I would love to be able to write with my pencil when journaling! Please add this!!!
I love this!! Just started using it for a while now but I think it’s so handy and useful to write or jot down daily things and is such a great tool to use!!!
There’s always space to improve. Please add an iPad app.

Is there a way to add a title?

Furthermore, with many years of Day 1 entries, i would like to import it in one app. Day 1 has become to « full featured » for my needs. Otherwise, i like the idea of integrating Health, Notes and activies.

I love this app. I can talk to it to journal. 
I can use it to log my day. 
I can vent to it to get my feeling out. 
I can use it log art projects concept. 
This app had been a game changer in my life.

Hope everyone uses full benefits of this app. Thank you
Would like the app to be available to sync with my I Pad pro  like using it
So far I like the app but I would like it better if you could use a passcode that is not the same as your Lock Screen on your phone.

column9: Have to keep manually expanding journal note when switching between other apps
column10: When writing a long journal and saving i noticed if you view it (full screen length) and switch between other apps and return back to Journal then the long journal collapses to a small view and not a full length view this is frustrating as you have to keep clicking on the note to expand it again. It needs to stay expanded even if you switch between other apps and are multi tasking.
Simple and easy to use. Hopefully more features are released in the coming months. Please bring this to Mac so we can journal from laptops.

This is so unfinished, it’s mind boggling. Almost no options to format text, cursor is randomly moving around, making text input almost impossible, photos are cropped at random with no option for change or reverse…

I appreciate that it locks, but that’s about the only thing that keeps me from just using my notes app and locking an individual note. 
The notes app allows me to create heading, bold, italicized, and bullet point. This customization is essential in how my mind processes information.
Make these updates and some addition options for the style of each page, and I can give it a 5 star.

There’s also a little glitch I’ve noticed that when I’m writing for too long, the cursor will sudden skip to another spot. Not a fan of that.
Such a cool app

I’ve had this app for a minute but just started today using it and I like it so far..I was gonna get me a new journal to actual write in but I may just stick to this. 

I would like to see some updates to make it even better as possible. I do like the pics that come up for specific days n u can write down what u remember about that day..I like that it asks you questions to make u think and evaluate certain things I like it ! Lol

column9: A couple more features and this app is gonna be awesome
column10: Great app, i’ve been loving to use it. It would be nice to have time stamps, visual links (preview of content from links), links to other apps such as notes or music.

column9: Great app with photo, music & workout prompts
column10:
I really love this, it makes journaling feel more natural as it’s integrated with your photo memories etc. 
I love that you can even voice journal - what a beautiful touch. 
The only thing I’d change/improve is adding an iPad app that can be integrated with Apple Pencil, so you can write (rather than type). This is more personal and more mindful IMO than typing.

This app has a great concept. However, it is terribly annoying to use. If you want to add a photo, you have no option of where it goes. It automatically goes to the top of the entry. This is VERY annoying. What if I’m referencing several memories and how they made me feel but all of the photos are organized at the very top? I guess I can say “in reference to the six picture at the top, blahblahblah.” However, that is annoying. 

In an actual journal you can write (in cursive or print or however) and tape Polaroids in the location you desire and add doodles, write/draw in different colors. You have the creative freedom to express your feelings and desires however you like and however you aesthetically please. 

You cannot do much on this app. You can make your text bold or italicized. At this point the notes app on iPhone offers more than this app. With notes, you can add shapes, draw in different colors and thicknesses, add lists or tables, and add photos wherever you want them to be. 

Another annoying aspect, which I’m sure is something within the coding and with new apps there will always need to be adjustments, I get that. So, I wanted to bring attention to how annoying it is to type. Say you made an error a previous paragraph, you try to click in that area and it always brings me right to the bottom of the entry. Then, if I want to start a new paragraph, it bounces back up a paragraph and I can’t even see what I’m writing. Lastly, the current line of text being written is so close to the bar with the photo, camera, and suggestions. The cursor is literally cut off. Which makes it annoying to click anywhere within that line. 

One more thing, the app is just boring. You click to open the app and you are faced with all your private entries right upon opening. Sure you can have a password, but there are no options to create a folder to organize your entries by year or moments. 

It just needs more…

Love it so far, very simplistic design. However, I think there can be improvements made: 
- adding a search feature to easily retrieve past entries. More filter & sort options for easier accessibility & organization 
- being able to add music or podcasts we listened to on the entry date, or people we spoke to via phone or FT 
- customizing each entry by being able to change the font, text size, highlight or underline words, text color, etc. 
- being able to add stickers 
- landscape vs portrait mode entries
- making it available on iPad and MacBook

column9: Please make it available for iPad
column10: I loved the app and I was looking for something where my private thoughts are kept private. And thanks for that! I trust apple’s privacy a lot so now I don’t need to shy away from writing private thoughts and incidents here. But please make it available on iPad as well. I believe it’ll be a great addition as many of us are iPad users as well. And I’d love to work on it either via iPad or MacBook.
Unable to insert a table
The Journal app desperately needs a search function. So much functionality otherwise.
I put in a system update on January 1 and found the Journal after installation on my homescreen. It has been a real gift! The app is amazing! Thank you for developing it 🩵

This app overall is decent. It’s easy to use, doesn’t have any extra features you could distract yourself with. There are some improvements that I would like to see, however. 
When I am typing, there are times when the text is too low on the screen, and almost covered by my keyboard. I hope that they change this so that the text remains a good half inch above the keyboard. 

Also, when I add photos in, I like that they are at the top, so they are viewable when you’re scrolling through us a list of your journal entries, I wish I could change what is shown in the preview for the photo. I also wish I had options for the layout of the photos when you add multiple. 

I also hope that these journal entries will be grouped into weeks or months instead of being one long list of daily entries.
Please add the ability to reorder entries (based on time), especially ones that are added in the same date.

This app has everything I want in a journal app, its simplicity and end-to-end encryption and that it’s locked. Available reflection prompts if I want it but not in my face. BUT… please fix the issue with the text jumping and disappearing behind the keyboard when reaching the end of the page! It’s super annoying and feels very buggy and unfinished. Writing is the main feature of the app, so it’s a bit surprising to me that it works so poorly. Add a bit of space between the end of the page and the keyboard so it’s comfortable to keep writing.
I have just started using the journal app, but would love to be able to have a print and send function.
Honestly, I didn’t have high expectations for it. But I genuinely love it! Before this I just used the notes app and I think this tops it! Down the road I would like to see more features for it.
I’m supposed to use a journaling app on my iPhone which isn’t available on my iPad? Apple has taken some dumb decisions in its time, and this is up there with the dumbest.
The kind of app its is much needed on ipad. Would be really great if we can have it there . And some sticker options as well
erm i did not exchpect a jernaling app but shlay i gess 🤧

So disappointed
This journal is now just a recording app. No interesting questions anymore. Waste of my time.

column9: Why isn’t this available for ipad
column10: I don’t understand why this app isn’t available for the iPad.  Seems like it would be a “no brainer.”  Very disappointing.
I am loving this app I just wished it was an app I could use on my iPad as well.
Was surprised to see this after an update but I am loving it so far.

I really like this app and wanna to use daily but have a lot of bugs and issues. I can’t change any format like in notes, it is crashes

column9: More blog than journal. Hopefully enhancements are coming.

I don’t want to see collage of entries.. it’s not really a linear organized journal. People who journal would typically be a bit OCD or looking for discipline, and they’d surely appreciate an organized view rather than a “blog” of sorts.
I recommend you to put a classification button/option according to our needs

why would I want to type journal entries? i want to just write my thoughts in my own handwriting. maybe there's a technological reason why, hopefully, because if not, extremely dumb. Just dumb.

Looking forward to the evolution of this!

I log all of my habits on my Habit app. Apple should make Habit app that can automatically update when I use certain apps. If I journaled today, it marks down that i wrote in my journal. If I have a “read my scriptures” habit, when setting up the habit, I can choose the app that will trigger this; If I’m actively using my “Gospel library” app for 30 minutes, without switching to another app, then the habit app will log that scripture-reading time in habits app (“Scripture Reading”) (eg- 23 minutes out of 30-minute goal). Look at the awesome “Habit” app to get some ideas. It’s so awesome.

Currently, when I meditate using the TM app, the amount of time I meditated is automatically recorded in the Habit app. It’s awesome.

Apple’s Journal app has a good look and feel, but it needs more features to live up to its full potential. Three things in particular would make it a much stronger experience;
* Allow adding timestamps to journal entries. When looking back, it would be nice to know if you wrote about a picture just after it was taken or later in the day
* Allow adding tags to journal entries. It would make it better organized 
* Add some more text styling options, like bullet points, tables, numbered lists, etc.
In addition, I would like to see it integrate with more Apple service. Two that stood out to me were Books and Game Center - it should recommend reflections on a recent chapter you finished, or reflections on newly unlocked achievements in a game

I downloaded this app in High Hopes thinking that maybe this is my calling to start journaling, I wrote for probably an hour and a half in detailed summary about my Christmas Vacation and then I clicked done and thought it was so good so I wanted to send it to someone so I went in to copy and paste and send it to someone (because there was no other option to send entry to someone) and for some reason I clicked it and it highlighted all of it and then DELETED ALL MY PROGRESS, I’m a huge fan of Apple but with this app and NO UNDO BUTTON I felt like crying because of all the hard work I put into it, the only thing that could change my mind is Bribery at this point that’s how bad this app is, go to Google docs or something I would recommend that 100x over this, Apple send me a gift card for this terrible experience or something like I am so disappointed.

column9: Sleek and simplistic, but feels half baked
column10:
It’s slick, minimalist, easy to use and focused on the entry (as any good journal should be), but lacks a few critical features to convince me over from 7+ years of using Day One. 

The main one is the lack of import/export - meaning I’d have to either abandon 1,000+ memories on another app, or manually move them over (no thank you). There’s no search functionality, nor any way to separate journals (for those of us who keep more than one) - a simple colour code or tag would do the job. 

I want to like it, and a few simple additions would be all it’d take, but for now it’s wait and see.

It has good UI but it needs to add more features. It’s too baren right now.

Suggested features:
-Integration with the Apple notes app!!!!!!!!
-Ability to change background of app
-Change font style, size, and background colour of each entry
-Tag or colour-code journal entries (tags or folders?)
-Integration with other music apps like Spotify and SoundCloud
-A more useful AI system to help me parse through thoughts, provide insight

column9: Feels like a student course work

Honestly, I have no idea what Apple thought about making this app. This app is good and useful, but in my perspective as an ex-developer for a level company like Apple making an application like this is like killing their loyal developers outside (Since they made review guidelines 4.3 which sometimes sounds ambiguous and unfair for some developers).

column9: Too Limited and antisocial in feel, why?
column10: This journal works well at recording daily events and circumstances, but it is limited by the fact that it feels hermetically sealed, given that it is only available on the iPhone and not, for instance, available as a syncing Apple Watch or iPad or MacOS app. Also the lack of a sharing facility with a trusted relatives and friends list makes this journal psychologically isolating, as though one is talking to the walls in solitary confinement. Human beings are social animals and this application seems quite unsocial. Please add a human sociability dimension to this App. I shall continue to use this useful and clever app occasionally, in the hope that Apple will make improvements which will allow it to link with other people and sync with other devices, in some way... Thank you in anticipation. 🙏

This is a very simple app that does a few things nicely. The suggestions are useless and there are a few missing features that are sorely needed especially as entries multiply over a year or more. 

There is no way to search your entries for an event that you don’t recall the exact day. You are forced to scroll from newest to oldest. No way to jump somewhere in the past.

column9: Please make it for macOS too
column10:
I’ve been enjoying since the day one it was released. Writing journal was never fun before. It is so nice that the app reminds me what I did on those days, so I can just write on top of its suggestions. I just want to make two suggestions:
1. Please let us put more than one suggested entry into one journal. I had to write three journals for one day about three different activities. I mean there are times I want more than one journal entry for a single day, but I want an option to write about multiple activities in one journal entry too.
2. Please make macOS version too. Phone is not the best tool to write a journal. I want to use my Mac with keyboard to write better and faster. Please don’t tell me to connect bluetooth keyboard to my phone. I do that from time to time, but seriously, I don’t want to do it if I don’t have to.

New features like tags, changing the wallpaper, allowing more photos and so on need to be implemented. All the journaling apps that I use have these features. I am sure Apple will update the app to include more of these. But it is a bit frustrating that Apple hasn’t included these. As they spent more then 3 years creating this app!
Text options menu and possibility to place image at required place in the journal if available will make the app best

This is a great app! The best of all the journal apps I’ve used. 
Some things I would change or add:

- Make a title where you enter something in and when you click out of it the title is that only thing you’re seeing. Reason why is because I don’t want to have to create a title myself and then see all of what I’ve written. If someone got into my phone and saw my entires, they’d immediately see everything I wrote.

-Have the option of locking your entries. If people got into my journal app, they could read everything I’ve written. I don’t want that especially if some stuff someone had written is very very personal. A friend could see the truth within seconds. Having a lock on the entires where you have to enter a password or something is a good idea because it secures some what protection for your personal information.

I despise writing anything beyond a text on my phone.  So any journal app that you can’t use either on a web version or iPad /Mac is pointless.  TOS could be a great app. But what’s the point in releasing an iPhone version only. I’ll stick with DayOne which is far superior.

Great work, Apple!
I loved it!!
Make available to ipad

I wasn’t into Journaling until Apple introduced Journal app, I am enjoying the app and now it’s my fourth day since I am using the app and I can attest that I have managed to integrate journaling to my daily routine and I can’t wait to journal. It brought back some memories that I had to make peace with and made me have a clearer understanding of some situations. All I can say thank you Apple yet another milestone 🫰🧡

column9: Potential and Limitations: My Experience with Apple’s ‘Journal’ App”
column10:
Edit: that is a lot! The app is not reliable at all and full of bugs after I type like a paragraph it gets deleted ( disappear ). On many days it doesn’t send recommendations or the places I visited or the steps. I am migrating to notes again for now. 

I’m genuinely excited about Apple’s new ‘Journal’ app, as it aligns well with my previous habit of journaling in the ‘Notes’ app. It’s great how Apple consistently prioritizes mental health, evident in their Health app. However, I find that ‘Journal’ falls short in terms of basic functionalities. For instance, it lacks essential features like search and sort capabilities, an intuitive way to add photos (preferably beneath text not similar to email attachments), tagging options, and more versatile sharing capabilities. Presently, sharing an entry inside the app leads to the creation of a new entry, even if it’s for the same day, which can be confusing. Additionally, I see a missed opportunity here. Integrating these journaling features into the existing ‘Notes’ app could enhance its utility. Imagine a dedicated ‘Journal’ category within ‘Notes,’ combining the best of both apps - suggestions, location tagging, voice recording from ‘Journal’, along with ‘Notes’’ robust text features. Also, I was hoping for integration with Apple’s Fitness and Health apps, which would have been immensely useful for my lifestyle. This integration could provide a more holistic approach to health and wellbeing tracking. In summary, while the ‘Journal’ app is a step in the right direction, it would benefit significantly from expanded features and integrations, enhancing its utility and user experience.

column9: Pretty barebones but it’s a start.
column10:
Things I’d like to see soon:
* Rich text like in the notes app.
* The default date being today feels weird. Idk about most people, but at least for me, I journal about yesterday, not about the stuff I’m currently doing.
* More views to see all notes at a glance.

It’s a decent first start at a journal. It really could use the ability to label the entries to help better access key entries later. I also would like the ability to have some tags or sort categories. And a Home Screen that lets you choose what type of entry. Also it would be nice if you could embed pictures or attachments similar to what notes allows. Last ask is that the weird screen hop that occurs when you’re far down the page of a long entry.

10 attachments isn’t enough. Why is there a limit? I wish there was a setting where I can default to the attachment date instead of the day’s date. 

There’s also a weird bug with the entry date. If I set it and change any media or write any text, it reverts back to today’s date. Please fix!

I like how easy it is, and how clean the interface is. I wish there was grouping by month. I wish I could tag contacts from my phone so my entries could be connected to people and I could see that in the contacts app. 

I wish there was a rich text formatting bar - selecting the text and then dealing with that tiny menu to select “format” BLOWS. I expected better UX from Apple!

The main reason I opted to use this app over the independent ones is because I want something thats fully integrated with everything else I already use. The share sheet working in so many apps is great, but I want more connected data.

column9: I wish I had this Journal app for my iPad
column10: I’m really loving this journal app and have been using it practically every day. However, I would love it even more if there were a version for the iPad or the computer. It’s sometimes very difficult to type on the iPhone.
Good. Would be even better if I could search through the entries.

As others have mentioned, it’s a good bare-bones journaling app at the moment. It would be good to have it on iPad and Mac.

Another feature I would like is a bit more formatting—the ability to indent, maybe make headings and the like, the same way we can with the Notes app. 

It’s still early, so I can’t give it a full review, but these are just my thoughts at first glance.

i know this is a new app and so i can see the growth potential which im excited for! i think what’s missing is a way to zoom out and categorize your journal entries by viewing them in “folders by month”, that would be cool. it’s also missing a title spot (i know you can just type one out and hold the letters too) and i would also want it to link it with my spotify to play my recent favorite songs. Oh and i would love to be able to crop and edit my pictures in the app!! i can’t wait for it to get better!!

I always wanted to write down what’s on my mind, but the fear of the content being read by someone else, especially a close family member, always made me never write anything down in a diary.

It all changed when this app downloaded onto my phone. I don’t care about the pictures or all the other features where I can add my location.

I only care about two, which are the blank piece of canvas you are given and the passcode/face locking system it has. 

 All my worries are gone, and now I can write my true feelings in peace, which will be locked away until someone gains access to my phone who would also need to know my passcode.

column9: Would like to see a search feature
column10:
Currently, I keep a symptoms journal in my Notes app—a single note with multiple journal entries dating back from 2015. I have multiple chronic illnesses and it’s the best way to keep track of symptoms. It has a lot of features where I can do hashtags and find certain words in my note. When I saw this new Journal app, I was really excited, hoping that it would be just as good as Notes, but be able to organize it based on date. However, there are no functions in the Journal app that allow me to search for certain things like I can in Notes. So, unfortunately for me, I will not be using the Jornal app. Rather, I will be sticking with Notes. Add a search function and I may come back to it.

column9: Has potential - No widget nor iPad
column10:
I’d likely use this as intended if it were a widget. I’d definitely use it if there was an app available for the iPad and the app would sync between the 2 devices. 
Otherwise, the little I’ve done with it I like it. I like the prompts from phone calls, photos, locations, etc They motivate me to write. 
But it needs more.

This is great. For writers this is a very convenient app with the auto-date naming, while still being able to set a custom one.

It misses some features though. For me, mainly the possibility to make several journals, to sort the entries separately, is missing. That way you can start a new journal, end one, dedicate one to a particular subject or more rarely recurring event—centering a theme around it. You could potentially have a “view all entries” to get a continuity and totality feeling, so that it is bound by you personally. But if it allows that customization, there’s more expressive and creative capabilities. 

I also think its text should be readily exportable, so that there’s no hassle in copy-pasting, if we were to use it somewhere else. Because I like this app for its convenience: immediate sorting and a simplified interface. It forces you to write (mostly) one thing at a time, while you can also reference a voice memo or other files that went along with an event, conversation, or thought trail. A totally new way of journaling, on the whole.

I’d really like to be able to type (like at a keyboard on a desk) and have that feeling like I’m an author of my own story. OR Simply being able to rotate it and (With Apple Pencil) write like I would a piece of paper or being able to sign something at the bottom of my entry. Or maybe a side note written on my entry sideways. It’s just the Collaging/Journaling Experience for people to be able to express themselves without the Need for Social Media and others. Even A place to Open up about Very personal and Memorable Life Moments. EDIT: Also Add the time of entry next to the date. Sometimes I want to put multiple like “note entries” throughout the day, sometimes something comes to my mind and I just want to talk(write) about it but it may not have anything to do with an earlier entry.

I can just type something, but it doesn’t make it bold like the ones I’ve made in the moment. My OCD is irked by this a bit.

Also, PLEASE bring this app to iPad and Mac! I would love sitting down at my Mac at the end of the day to type these entries on a real keyboard instead of the virtual one on my iPhone. I’m sure the Suggestions API may need some translation to these other platforms, but the Mac can already see iPhone widgets, so just copy and paste the existing iPhone Suggestions over please!

column9: Very nice but please improve suggestions
column10: When creating an old journal entry I want photo, fitness suggestions to be of that day. Pls pls add to iPad, add sticker support, search bar or date delimited scroll bar. And perhaps a journal share / colab feature where people’s life lines sort of merge for that day, kind of like in the git version control visualization. Being able to add expired plane tickets would be cool too! Making it a sort of memory scrapbook. There’s so much potential to make something beautiful here!

After constant use and troubleshooting for the past 2-5 days I have to say that the app has a completely different approach to personal journaling than most people would do with just the notes app. The notes app is simple and plain, but we will come back to this later because of the key features that make this app not so favorable in the face of the notes app. The journal app is amazing for its unique features. I suggest, to any user, to try taking more pictures when going out, then the journal app will suggest you to talk about the pictures — it is the most fun feature of the app, genuinely. I was grocery shopping and took a random picture for a friend of mine, then the journal app suggested me to comment on it and it made my day so much better. But the feature that creates a completely unique feeling to the app is / are the reflection tabs. You can sit anywhere, at the bus station, at a cafe, at your desk and can benefit from this feature almost instantaneously. You press a button to refresh, you select and it’s almost as if you’re instantly mindful about you, your thoughts and your surroundings — imagine syncing this with your health app! About being in sync with other apps, maybe we’ll see connectivity with our screen time stats, health trends, taking a walk out of our homes, fitness trends, changes in our BPM, our delayed reminders — this might become a life-changing app for lots of users in the future updates. It might ask you questions such as “We’ve been noticing a significant increase in your BPM and we just wanted to know if you have been stressed lately? If yes, why?”. Back to the notes app! The notes app has some features that would benefit this app too, such as text formatting, collaborative pages, a wide-ranged search function. As a person who reuses his stashed thoughts for conversations, podcasts and essays, not having a search function is a major factor downside. Thus far, the notes app is present on all devices and we have no fear of it being discontinued. With the help of other functions such as drawing, tables and doc scanning, the notes app can work a powerhouse of systematized thinking. So, at this very moment, there isn’t much reason to switch your journaling from notes to this app. So, let’s connect the journal app with books, with health and with whatever Apple might consider. Let’s connect a person with its good habits and empowering ideas or practices. It’s fun, it’s exciting, it’s simple and it clears your mind with ease. Let’s see what Apple’s got ready for us!

Day One is celebrating! _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 
 This app was one of the biggest releases of 17.2 and it was significantly overhyped. _ _ _  Apple has never been strong on the software and they proved it yet again with a substandard app. _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _  _ _  _ _ _ _ _ _  _ _  _ _  _  Here are just a couple of the bigger misses. _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _  _  1. No integration with shortcuts is a joke. (P.S. Notes has shortcut integration) _ _ _ _ _ _  The real value of a digital journal is it doing a chunk of the work for you. And these suggestions are a weak replacement. _ _ _ _ _  _  Take a note from Day One, include it all, or at least give me the ability to do it via Shortcuts. _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _  2. The audio notes should do the audio recording and transcript at the same time. _ _ _ _ _  _  Everything is easier said that written, there is so much emotion in verbal language.   _ _ _ _ _  _  Having said that audio is not nearly as searchable. Having both is a must for a great journaling app.

_ _ _ _ _ _ _  _ _  _ _ _  Updated: I wrote my review prior to reading as I didn’t want to be swayed. Seems like most think the same thing. _ _ _ If Apple hadn’t overhyped this the reaction wouldn’t have been nearly this bad.

column9: My honest review of Apple’s Journal app: The pros and cons
column10:
I have been using Apple’s new Journal app for a few weeks now, and I have mixed feelings about it. On one hand, I like the simplicity and privacy of the app, which offers prompts and suggestions based on my photos, locations, and activities to help me journal my daily entries. On the other hand, I feel that the app lacks some features and polish that would make it more enjoyable and useful.
• First of all, the app needs some improvement in UI design. The app is mostly a white screen with a “+” button, which looks bland and boring. The suggestions are often repetitive or irrelevant, and there is no way to customize them or filter them by category.
• Secondly, the app needs more features to make it more versatile and fun. For example, I would like to see more options for formatting, such as fonts, colors, or bullet points. The app also does not have any social or sharing features, which would be nice for those who want to share their journals with friends or family.
• Thirdly, the app needs a calendar view to make it easier to navigate and review my entries. Right now, the app only shows a list of entries sorted by date, which is not very convenient or intuitive. A calendar view would allow me to see my entries at a glance, jump to a specific date, or compare different periods of time.
In conclusion, Apple’s Journal app is a simple and smart companion for your memories, but it has a lot of room for improvement. I hope that Apple will listen to the feedback from the users and add more features and polish to the app in the future. I would rate the app 4 out of 5 stars.

Also, I can’t export my entries. It keeps on nagging “Quota Exceeded: You’ve reached iCloud storage limit.”

Why should I have available space on my iCloud when I have gigabytes and gigabytes of space right here on my iPhone? Who will pay for the extra iCloud space?!

I don’t need iCloud. I have my external hard drives for my backup needs.

Such a ridiculously annoying app.

I was waiting and excited for this app just for it to be a one person twitter. Doesn’t feel like a journal, no organization or compatibility with ipad or mac so i cant even handwrite or draw in it, also the suggestions are meh

I updated to 17.2 and noticed a new privacy setting on my phone turned on by default “DISCOVERABLE BY OTHERS”!! I didn’t even open the journaling app. 

If I was asked to turn this on I would have said no and been fine… but Apple turned this on by default just by updating to 17.2. 

Open 'Settings'
Scroll down to 'Privacy & Security' and tap on it
Scroll down and open 'Journaling Suggestions'
Select each option and turn them on or off with the switch on the right
To clear the data the app has collected, tap 'Clear History' and confirm the choice when prompted 
To disable location-sharing, turn off the switch labeled 'Discoverable by Others'

Too simple. no customizations no colors no notebook style no customizations no date stamp. It’s too simple and it’s a disappointment.

Love this Journal. Easily records my dairy and can also add photos, location etc in this Journal. 

Can I request Journal for IPad as well? 
More convenience for me to write diary anywhere

I love this concept but hate that it’s only for iPhone. I do a lot of my journaling on my iPad, never on my phone. Please get this on iPad ASAP.

But  Notes has more features than this… so even with the iPad version, it’s going to take a lot more for me to make the switch if this is the extent of the app.

Obviously it’s like brand new and it just came out so I’m not aspect it’s really good but at the same time there are a few improvements I would love to see one of them being the ability to have different journals and maybe eventually wear on the iPad. You can hand write your entries

I see huge potential in this app. What I missing is ability to change the order of photos, add widgets, stickers.
I would like to think of it as a diary - one new entry per day. I’d like to be able to add items in the area I want. For real if the app is more flexible I feel it could get a big value in the market.

column9: Should be happened with other device
column10: I will Waiting this apps for iPad and Mac

column9: Just like notes app but less features
column10:
This is no different than the notes app. I have used notes app for years and have 105 notes. I like notes app better because: 1. Notes uses folders to organize and easily refer to past notes written. I have categories like recipes, health, teachings, important records… 2. Different fonts, headings, italics, bold, underline, etc. 3 automatically synced to iPad. Plus I can still add photos, links to internet, even music from my iTunes Music app. I don’t see anything that Journal has that Notes cannot do.

On my iPad I use pages and keep a journal every year. This year my Pages journal it is about 40,000 and 50,000 words. That’s hard to do on an iPhone. And that’s just one document.

i would give better note if that app would not come from a billion dollar company.

besides very limited features (no proper formatting, no 3rd party services support in highlights, pictures are only on top - impossible to make a log of a day, if you have travelled), there also is no support for shortcuts (i wanted to make a template to fill out every day; i am aware that i can copy it to clipboard), which is very weird. but even the writing experience itself is not satisfying - i constantly need to hit enter several times and put cursor several lines higher up so that the caret is not too low.

knowing how much time it took to add many basic features to apple notes, unfortunately i do not expect this app to be updated anytime soon. currently it seems that besides extended security, there is not much to love in that app, for now.
ever since I downloaded the fourth beta of iOS 17.2 I have been using this app like an addict. SO good!

column9: All the simplicity of Microsoft’s notepad app, and nothing more
column10: Turns out Day One had nothing to worry about.

column9: Too basic, worse than a physical journal
column10:
It has a very feminine look to it unlike a moleskine or any paper journal. Notes is more asexual than journal. Is like a period app.
It is great that i can add a photo, however just one……… 
I cannot search anything. No search is bad in a digital world…
I cannot see calendar.
I cannot scroll easy
I cannot share a moment
I cannot export to print or something
In fact the list of cannot is so big, i deleted the app after 2 entries. 
Also no mac/ipad. Is like apple does not like people to use keyboard… then how can i sum my day in one photo? 
I don’t understand why people say is top 5/5… maybe they don’t write…

Whole point of journal is that it should have a separate pin for locking mechanism.
These days regular faceid and screencode isnt enough security.

I like the simplicity of the UI, but I see no way to get my journal entries out once I’ve written them. I’ll check back in a few months but my guess is the only way to avoid lock-in will unfortunately be to avoid this app.
I really like the minimalist design, and its lockable with face id. Thanks!
For example if you can change the theme not only purple or draw in it or the aspect. To feel it’s yours something private and personal where you can say everything you want without someone judging.

I think this will greatly help people to remember and journal more. It has some great features right away and as more time passes, I’m sure more will be added. Allowing the device to use suggestions to help you write is a great idea. Privacy is also great with Face ID to lock the journal app and keeping all data securely on-device. Excited about the start, and can’t wait to see this grow.

column9: Does not carry over to the iPad
column10: Typing on the phone is mot as convenient as doing it on the iPad it would be nice if this app was on the iPad and could use the handoff feature.

column9: Great App, Needs to be on iPad ASAP
column10: I thoroughly enjoyed using this app and found the interface to be very new and refreshing, I liked the way in which elements can be organized and overall I feel as though the app does what it wants to do perfectly. However, despite this, I have one problem, IT'S NOT ON iPadOS!!! Why that is is something I struggle to understand, but I initially tried to download on the iPad as soon as I completed the software update but I found that the device was not compatible yet. I hope this can change later on when the app develops more, maybe even integrating the pen writing and other features that can be useful on the iPad. I think it is essential for this app to be added to the iPad as soon as possible so please get working on it, team! Appreciate all the great work, though :)

column9: Add the option to change the app name from Journal to Diary.
column10: I think it would benefit some female users if the Journal app had the option for name of the app to be changed to Diary. Hopefully this gets implemented to appease both demographics.
Apple lost his mojo!

I'm replacing my iPhone 13 mini for the iPad Pro. but when I seen the new journal app I was excited to be able to use my keyboard so l could really use the app to its full potential. I love everything apple is doing so far but I noticed the app is not available on iPad. a lot of people would use the journal app if it was more accessible. If there is anyway possible to get something like journal for iPad I would deeply appreciate it. I love the concept but not being able to use such a powerful app like that on the iPad Pro 12.9 m2 makes me a little frustrated. I know I have a beast of a machine. But why can't I use it for the one app that I want to use so badly when people were talking about the concept. All l'm asking is please. Do your best to get notes to work on the iPad pro 12.9 I can give you honest feedback on your apps and your devices. The app looks like it can go a long way.
Let me know if there is anything you need to better understand where l'm coming for in this situation. sincerely Maliki Crump. Love the app still but I can only give it a 3 star for now.
It would be great to add “moment/widget” from calendar, notes, apple books or Apple TV..

It looks very clean, but I use the notes app to journal and will continue as this is a bit too simple right now.

Things that need added.

1. Filter by date - month, year etc
2. Lock individual notes not the whole diary
3. More personalisation tools to have different colour schemes, folders for different topics etc.
4. Be able to doodle in the journal entry like notes.
5. Be able to list entries instead of seeing preview - optimal, you should be able to choose whether you want this view or not.

Nice sentiment to see it added, but seems like not a lot of prep work went in, or not enough user testing.
The app is nice for me as basic journal person, but I really would enjoy it more if it had the ability to add weather and how I was feeling writing that entry.

column9: Need to have templates (pre defined and custom)
column10: It would be nice to have templates like thank you journal, daily goals journal etc . Should also allow to create custom templates

The suggestions feature was too much, so I ended up disabling it, but the lack of the searching feature was the dealbreaker for me, I’m better off saving my journals in Notes or even the Reminders apps.

Dear Apple you are the biggest tech giant company in the world, with one of the most powerful and creative development team.

And what we see in the Journal app:
- no search
- no calendar 
- no tags 
- no folders 
- no support even inside the ecosystem 
- no export / import 
- even no text formatting

I hope these simplest features will be added in the near future

column9: -5 stars - Notes is better than Journal.
column10: If the app would allow the users to add Music from their own library then I could possibly look past everything else the app is clearly lacking, but it doesn’t.   Honestly this has got to be one of the worse journal apps if not the worse of them all.  After reading the comments, I am convinced that those are obviously fake reviews or that those who left comments have never ever experienced a journal app before.  Notes is better than the journal app.

Lacklustre feature set paired with a middling UI topped off by a lack of iPad support add up to another poor software effort by Apple. If this is all that could have been delivered since the WWDC announcement it should have been kept in source control and never released.

column9: Missing any integration with third party apps
column10:
Love the idea, but it won’t allow you to post updates for activities from Strava, headspace and so on as it’s currently limited to allowing you to journal from apps in the Apple ecosystem, despite for example Strava activities showing in Apple health, unless I’d recorded by activity using Apple it wouldn’t get me an option to post in my journal. 

So in summary, great idea but fundamentally flawed.

column9: A great app to use, i Recommend this
column10: Great app!
Like recommendation based on calendar
This app is exactly what I have always wanted and it will only get better with time
Love that apple finally came up with a journal app! Pls make it available on the ipad too so i can type faster there, and also add widgets please!!!!

Big expectations but floppy delivery. No tags. No export.  Entries are failing to save fully. 

I was expected more from Apple. 

I should’ve continue using DayOne.

Rate it one star, because the central “+” FAB (Floating Action Button) is a bad design for an official Apple app that ruins the new app.

The current + button is not the most frequently used action but it stands in the way of main contents. It steals the  main focus from the main content.  Users view/edit journal more than adding.

It is inconsistent with all other existing apps like Message, Notes, Mails, etc., which keep add/new/compose button on the navigation bar. It looks like Apple is trying to rush an app out with compromised design that it tries to bright developers working for A…d app to write this one.

Another thing not related to FAB. It is so inconvenient to tap the journal item and choose edit/bookmark action. This is so bad for user to tap many times for a frequent operation. 

Overall this app is poorly designed. Why not just merge some new features into the note app? 

The reason I write such a long and critical comment Is to discourage the poor design style by a builtin app that might be followed by more and more third party apps, which would finally ruin the iOS ecosystem.
Works well, looks nice. Love the connection to photos and maps. But why is it not connected to State of Mind in Health? Or Health in general?

column9: Bug - typed text doesn’t show up
column10:
A bug prevents typed text from showing up once it reaches the keyboard :(
Also I was looking forward to using this app on the iPad with handwritten notes. :( it feels incomplete right now

column9: Making an app or buying an advanced one
column10: Maybe making an app is so enjoyable job that everyone can do. But for a huge company like Apple, past experiences have shown that buying a bug-free and optional app is the better choice; Shazam, Shortcut and... Provide this idea. The Journal has a long way to being a complete diary app and the energy could have been used on other cases.

First of all I just want to say that it’s a good start. The reflections generated are fine but there are just so much stuff that could be improved. 

First of all, why is there NO formatting options. You can not bold, italicizes, underline, strike through, or indent. That should have been some of the first things added. 

Second of all, why is there no option to view the entries by month. Instead they are in a long list you have to scroll through. 

Third of all, why can I not place locations, photos, or reflections in the middle of a entry. Instead they are shoved at the top. 

This app feels unfinished.

This app looks promising and I hope it’ll feature more options such as tagging, searching and memories
Also, there’s seems to be a bug where you cant set a reminder as you need to allow notifications but the app doesn’t show on the notification list
Will change the review once this app comes available for iPad. 😤
This is one of the most basic apps I’ve ever used. You can do the exact same things with the notes app apple already has out. Needs lots of improvement. Uninstalling until it gets improved.

column9: This app could be made even better if you implement a folders feature like day one does.
column10: I use folders to separate my personal entries from other ones
I like it but I need to try out the ai suggestions first before I give an accurate rating, it’s 5 stars until I found out if it’s good or not
Lack of basic features and no iPad version which is needed most.

Please add a simple word search function so we can search for basic keywords. Even a basic plain text file has the capability of searching for specific key words. What if I wanted to search for when I went to a specific place but can’t remember what day it was on for example? Please add this one feature. I’m certain the Swift code base will support it.

column9: Poor Attempt at a Journal App
column10: It does not allow you to look up an entry by calendar date, there is no search, you can not change the journal name, you can not set a separate passcode and must use the same password/pin/unlock method as your phone, there is only one journal type so you can not have a separate personal and work or project journal, you can not delete multiple journal entries at the same time, when you delete the app you are told it will delete all data but when you reinstall it there is all the previous data, and you can not change the style, color, or background.

column9: Great app, but something's are missing
column10: Hi, I really like the simplicity and the suggestions of the app, but I would love to see a search function and a way to have a template in addition to the other options to start a new journal entry. The app has cool integrations with workouts and photos, but seems unfinished and unpolished. No search, no tags.

column10: Decent intro app, but would love to see integration (2 ways) with journal apps like Finch care as a hub vs competitor. Would have a lot more value for journaling and storing memories

Useful to use but could still do with being improved a bit more, such as by improving the app lock feature, including some more journal prompts, being able to add own journal prompts, being able to add a location without having location services turned on and for the location to try and be a bit more accurate, being able to have different types of journal and even the ability to categorise journal entries or even entire journal(s).
Expected much better. Not got an ability to search entries. Suggestions won’t work so not getting anything to prompt an entry. Thought Apple had this in the bag but disappointed
iPad version please!

I use notes with a lock to journal. This is good because I can add notes at any date with a. Simple title but also journal from phone, iPad or Mac. 

This new app looks good but I hear it’s not available on Mac so I am forced to tap away on the phone only.  

Not cool. Probably won’t use.
It should have been great if you have folders so some of them can be separated or tags just for Journal so it can be great for sorting

No iPad version is a major fail in my book, it would have been such a good fit for this app. Instead you’re left two thumb typing your day into the journal totally exhausting I gave up half way through an entry. I’ll be waiting for the iPad version,
Not for iPad. Omg, what a crap company!

I tried to insert a video into my entry but for some reason, it only comes up at the top of my entry and not at the place I want it to. Is this the default setting or am I doing something wrong? Also, there is no indications to inform me whether the media is being uploaded or pasted.

Apple Journal is a colossal failure. So oversimplified it’s a useless frustrating waste of time. No flexibility. No query capability. No tagging. Rigid layout. A better system is easy in Microsoft Notes. Apple Journal is an embarrassment to Apple’s digital ecosystem. I was hoping for something to replace an  overpriced subscription journal. Apple Journal might be  another example of Apple’s unfortunate future. Over and out.
Can’t select photos to add to the journal. If I click the plus button to start a new entry and then try to select photos they will not select

The recommendations and writing prompts are interesting but when it comes to the actual journaling part, the app is severely lacking: entries don't have titles or tags, you can't organize into folders, no search functionality whatsoever, and no way to go quickly go back to a certain date apart from endless scrolling
Decent journaling application but disappointed that it wasn’t brought to iPad at the same time. iPad feels like a better fit with its keyboard support

column9: Hard to believe there’s no search function
column10: This app looks so primitive and even the basic search function is missing. I can’t believe this is Apple App

I can see myself using this app if there’s going to be some sort of navigation and ability to see all your entries in a form of a monthly/yearly calendar. So far you just have to scroll and scroll and the app doesn’t allow you to quickly get to an entry you’d like to go to.

Nice app but it needs some develops: Search bar, hashtags, maybe categorises etc.

column9: Bring the app to iPad and Mac
column10: Please port that app to iPad and Mac

This is filling a tiny slot for me, as I have wanted to add context/notes to the voice memos I journal with for some time (but wasn’t interested in paying a fee for with other apps). 

No organizational tools or customization whatsoever. No options for multiple journals. 

I’ll still be using my other app for the day to day pennings I have, but for my longer audio monologues about a general theme, I can see using this.

I’ve been eagerly awaiting the release of the journal app. Except surprise it’s not on the iPad. I literally bought and iPad because typing anything more than a few sentences with my thumbs is just stupid and cumbersome. You really expect people to “journal” on their phones exclusively?? Honestly of all the decisions Apple has made thus far this one is the most blatantly stupid.
Thank you apple for this great app🙏🏻

I was really hoping I can replace the Day One journal app with this one but can't because apple decided to create the most basic app with no features at all to help search and edit journals proper. I could have prob created this app within 3 hours.

You can journal in the app, but the focus is on micro journaling, integration with other iPhone content and not much else.  This needs many more features which help organize a collection of journal entries like separate journals and hashtags.  This also needs iPad and MacBook support as those apps are better suited to type longer entries. Disappointed because these types of features exist today in the Notes app but seemingly no one felt they were important to repurpose that functionality for Journal. This app needs to mature A LOT before I’d consider giving up my current journaling app.
This is what I've been waiting for last few months? It's a joke Apple. Really.

column9: Search function is just forgotten, isn’t it??
column10: An app looks as MVP. It’s highly required to add the search function at least. And it’d be nice to see here a calendar view, location on a map, groups for notes and text formatting features.

Womb-womp
I was hoping for so much more in an Apple journal. Instead I got a 2009 droid journal. It’s like 2008 called and asked for the Shein copy of Evernote. 

This is just so boring. The Ui feels like it was thrown together. I keep getting g suggestions to journal about photos and screenshots from 2019. The prompts are lame.

This took month/years to develop? I meditated and used the Waking Up app thinking “maybe it’ll ask how the meditation went?” Nope. 

I was hoping there would be a screensaver widget from the Lock Screen. Nope.

It just feels like like it was a high school kids project. Maybe that’s what it is? Maybe someone at Apple said to their teenage kid “hey! You can either mow the lawn or make me a journaling app and I’ll let you borrow the car.” 

I was expecting more. 

I ended up downloading DayOne again. I wonder how much money Snapple made from DayOne subs after launching thjs? Very smart!!! 

Anyway- I’m sure it will be decent by iOS 21.3!

Nice

I was looking forward to this app. Unfortunately, it lacks 3 things: 1) navigation, 2) importing entries from other journal apps, 3) the ability to connect to other applications from Apple. This app despite being new to the iPhone has become my favorite after its launch.
Please add search feature to Journal. Imagine we used it for a year and need to find one day.
Pls add export to pdf and other app, and add search menu
Rating this a one star. Because I want to put this on my iPad.
Use notes instead it will feel the same … i was using day one journaling app and still gonna use that because thats way better than this… need features to feel more useful

hope in the future there are new way view my journal such as ”timeline” 

And a feature just press a person face , and it will show me all the events that i have hang out with him/her.

The app dropped in as a part of the much hyped iOS17 release and is a part of the 17.2 upgrade. Used the app to give a shot to journalling switching over from the daily writing regime I am used to. The app is too clunky, buggy, lags a lot, the keypad hangs and for a considerable moment, I could feel is heating up my device (which again is a latest iPhone apple launched in September ‘23).

That said, I believe there is still some work which needs to be done here to provide the user experience apple is known for.

This app needs have an equivalent on iPad 17.2. Dissatisfied that I updated my OS on the iPad just to discover that the app that Apple created wasn’t even there. 

As it is, though, it’s a fine app on the iPhone. I like that it takes various activities on the iPhone as prompts on what to write. Surprisingly intuitive. This is a great start but I hope to see more features, like the ability to hand write journal entries with an Apple Pencil …. Like, on an iPad 🙄
App without a point.

column9: Did I get a dud copy?
column10:
Doesn’t suggest or do almost anything 

Just a basic text / photo entry with no formatting or sorting of any kind that can see

Hasn’t suggested anything, where I was, photos or screen shots etc 

Seriously the notes app is like a million times better. Just create a folder for the year, then folder for each month & a post for each day. With 3 taps you’ll find what your looking for & can format it almost anyway you like

Could you please add search function and also put the calendar at the 1st page with allow us to add some different bookmarks, then we can choose which day we want to read again or easier to edit. Thanks so much. But I like this app so much!

column9: So what’s different from Notes app?
column10:
This app is basic and not intuitive enough. First of all, there is no way to insert a freaking Header!!! How are we gonna suppose to insert a header when there is no option for it?!!
Where is iPad version of it? 
There are no tags or anyway to keep entries separate into different categories.
Unable to customize any of the app settings.

Apple only made this app for iPhone. No, Apple Watch, iPad, Mac or Apple TV versions? Not even a way to interact with HomePod? No way to log over the internet? I thought Apple was about integrating services with its hardware. By confining the app to iPhone, this makes it very inconvenient for me to make journal entries. I hope they seriously consider adding other platforms. 

As for the actual app as it is? It needs more options. If they did ever create an iPad version, it would thrill me if I could use Apple Pencil with the journal app and in my own handwriting, which I hope could be searchable. 

I also truly hope to be able to log entries with HomePod or AirPods. I would love to see some sort of integration between journal and CarPlay. I can see that as having wonderful potential if done correctly. 

I guess an app needs to start somewhere, right?

I’ve been a Day One user for ten years. I was happy with my paid app until they took away the ability to add videos to your entries. This feature is only allowed now via a subscription. So I would love to import my data from Day One. Also, I can’t set a daily notification. The option to turn notifications on or off is simply missing. When I try to set a date and time for a notification I get a pop up telling me to turn notifications on inserting. When I click the popup it takes me back to the Journal app settings but there is no notification setting available. Sure my iPhone 13 Pro isn’t too old to get notifications now.

It’s great to finally have an app I trust enough to journal with but, for me it needs shortcut support, search, and ways to organise the views etc. for my use case. I’m currently forced to use a shortcut template to copy the data (health stats, weather, and some API data, I want to track alongside my journal data to clipboard and paste it in. I’m amazed that none of these features made it into the initial version with it being an Apple app and not some indie app just breaking out. I’m sticking with it though as I expect these features will come soon.

column9: Good start, needs more basic features!
column10: Honestly super happy did this so I can get away from Dayone. I only hope they will expand and add tags, exporting, multiple journals, etc!

column9: the best minimal journaling app! minimalist & OCD approved!
column10:
as someone who struggles who hyper ocd, i have tried nearly every journaling app in the app store even the minimalist ones. i tend to hate the layouts of traditional journaling apps or they just have too many buttons lol. whenever i type or journal on my phone/macbook i normally use pages/notes, but i tend to bother with the settings & fonts for hourssss which distracts me alot, if ykyk. this app is amazing. you just type, add your entry & that's it! not to mention i love how SIMPLE the entries & the collage when you add pictures. i love the simpleness & neatness of this app, and it's prefect the way it is. the only thing i would add is that you allow up to 20 photos for one entry :) but other then that ... thank you to all the developers who developed this app. it's really going to help me & others with my mental health & tracking memories. 

- with love,
annan
Have it available on all Mac/iOS device. With the option to use pen/scribbling. Please please please..
I will not use this until it can have a password independent of the phone passcode.

column9: Jobs would never release such garbage

column9: Great app, but need some tweaks
column10:
I loved this app so much! I bet every iPhone user is grateful for having it right now after a long wait. However there are some features and tweaks that if addressed soon in this app, it will be ever greater:

1. Adding Years and Months Headlines Section breaks—sort of, to group them in a neat way rather than having dozens of them collapsing that requires endless scrolling to reach intended time point (especially for those who writes on a daily basis or who will manually transfer their old journals from somewhere else)

2. Adding Search tool.

3. Fixing intermittent freezes during scrolling in the app.
But I would like to use it rather on iPad than iPhone.

There is no app for Mac- so this is iPhone onlyThe app has a bug, when you slide an entry to the left, you will see blue icon with a pen meaning an edit option just beside a trash-delete. Keep sliding left and right and the icon will disappear.

A very good start, but lack of essential features, such as searching for keywords, calendar view, filter by Month, format text etc.
I’m sure these features will come but until then it is no more than a good start with great potential.
