Also, it would be great to see more stats and data like places where we wrote entries, the weather, the music, etc

First of all, I want to say thank you for this amazing application. I am still learning about this application and hoping Apple adds more features in the future (lots of features). 

With Kindest Regards and Happy Holidays to you all-BR
It’d be really useful if it had a calendar to find the notes faster. And also, it’d be cool to be able to change fonts and wallpapers to make it more artistic 🦋🙏🏼
Super
I really like the idea of the app and I've been so excited for it but when I try to set up scheduled notifications I can't because the app doesn't have notifications??? I'm very confused

Used the app for the first time today with iOS 17.2 released. I chose to write about a collection of photos the app suggested. When I tapped on the suggestion, a message appeared telling me the number of attachments had reached its limit, so I’d suggest an update to only include a supported number of photos in the recommendation. Then I couldn’t save the entry with the ‘Done’ button being greyed out and nothing I did could change it so the entry was wasted. I suspect something to do with the attachment limit but even removing some didn’t alllow me to save it.
The privacy issue I refer to is that when in the iOS App Switcher view, the contents of the app isn’t blurred like with other sensitive apps.
So a few issues but the promise is there and I’ll keep using it.

Although it’s the starting of something new. I only updated to beta 17.2 for this app . I was excited to see what’s coming but I am not satisfied enough. I think you should add more features like :

1. Text Formatting Options 
2. Adding timestamps 
3. Adding images at any positions , not only at the starting of the entry
4. A search feature
5. Proper organisation feature , now it’s just a notes app
6. Displaying no of streaks 

I am trusting you on this. That’s why I feel like I will be using this app for a while.
I want to like this, but it is definitely missing some features like collapsible entries. I wish you could do that. But other than that, it’s pretty cool.

I get the idea and purpose but for me it defeats it all with limitations:

1) iPhone only - Really? I am a heavy user of my iPad mini (like I rarely use my Mac mini if it’s not about site changes, spreadsheets or app dev lessons). The iPhone keypads are tiny and irritating.

2) This would be the perfect scenario to use the stylus. I actually use pencil calendar & good notes because I can freehand with the stylus. 

The cloud sync option in those apps is nice as well, but for me, it’s the writing on the iPad mini that is the electronic substitute for writing in sketchbooks.
It is a good app, but it would be appropriate to have greater security, such as a cover not to show the latest notes and even have an additional passcode.
It would be amazing to be able to also draw in the journal!

column9: Great as a built in option
column10: Works pretty well as a default/first party option.

This transforms what built-in journaling can be on an iPhone. Wonderful app. I would love to use this on mac but I think this specific app deserves five stars. We’re supposed to rate the app itself, which is regardless of whether it’s available on the macOS/iPadOS 🤦
please add a format and tagging system and allow us to add whatever apple music songs we want to from the journal app

column9: Beautiful UI, needs a few simple features
column10:
I pay for Day One premium. Day One is a great journaling app, but now that I’ve tried Apple’s Journal app, I’m definitely tempted to switch. The UI is simple but very beautiful. The app feels great to use, I love the automatic prompts based on workouts and locations, etc. In order for this to be something I’ll use long term, I need to be able to search for posts by title, body, tags (or folders or labels), location, etc. my journaling style is many short & sweet entries on a number of topics. So I quickly get a lot of entries and I need to be able to find something when I’m looking for it. 

Lots of potential here! Please add Search and organization tools (folders, or tags, or labels).

I have friends and family with access to most things on my phone. I don’t want them to have access to my journal. If my journal can only be secured by the exact same password and biometrics as the rest of my device, then my journal can’t be secured at all. 

Let me make a journal password that isn’t my phone password. Until then, this app is precisely useless to me.
Unfortunately there's no search options by date or by a keyword - only basic filter by type of entry.
At the time of writing this review (beta 4), it is so basic that it seems developed by a fifth grader.

Amazing. Truly. Helps my mental health slot to just get things off my chest. Sure there are a few features that could get added to improve the app like folders and themes but overall it’s spectacular. You can add pictures, locations, voice memos, everything. Hope they keep updating it soon.

But it turned out to be not anywhere as good as the Day One app I was using previously. Even in it’s free version, which I used for the last three years, Day One is far more feature rich than this Apple contraption. Most interesting: there is no way to import your previous notes from any other journaling app! That is just plain stupid omission if they ever wanted to pull other customers over. Day One does not need to worry about being “sherlocked”!
I want it to interact with more apps and be merged with mindfulness!

column9: This should be an ipad app
column10: This could be a great app on the iPad but on the iPhone it is too  small

I feel like this would be something I would want on my iPad to work with Apple Pencil. Not just for my phone. Boeing able to use it on both would make me use it more. Personally. Also I agree with reviews that it would be cool to make it work with the health app more. I love when my apps interact. You could use it as a weight loss journey and/or a mindfulness tool.

I think this is a very good start. I’m looking forward to improvements. 
I’ve read other reviews about how it’s not Day One etc. It’s not supposed to be. One reviewer wrote it is not as good as notes which they are using as a journal   
Use Journal and give it time. 
I like the app so far.
i use button +, don't work
At the moment it has the same functionalities as Apple Notes. Great job indeed.
Even though this is the first version of this app, it should be much more equipped. The fact that there’s no search though, that’s inexcusable.

column9: Exactly what I was looking for
column10: I never write reviews and I never expected to write my first one for an Apple app. However, Journal app gives me the opportunity to do exactly what I've been looking for journaling apps to do for a while now. It's simple and very easy to use. At first the lack of folders bothered me a bit but I a grew to appreciate the simplicity of having all of my notes compiled and being able to filter them by category. I still look forward to manual tagging and being able to start an entry on things that I choose specifically instead of suggestions of a song I listened to recently, a friend I phoned recently etc. I especially appreciate the connection with Apple Music as I like to write about music I've been listening to. I'm sure this app will only get better and is my favorite feature of iOS 17 by far.

column9: Decent journaling app for what it is, could be better.
column10:
If you are looking for a way to log your experiences throughout the day and/or respond to some mindfulness journaling prompts, this app does the trick.

You can add photos to your entries if you want and even lock the entire app behind a passcode or FaceID.

Some feedback on what I’d like to see:

What I would like to see is the journal app be more integrated with the Health app for mindful journaling instead of having to open the health app separate to input relevant data or data points users want to track.

I’d love it if I could also include how I am feeling in that moment in the journal entry and have that added to my overall health profile. This in turn could also help medical professionals diagnose and track behavioral health issues such as depression, anxiety, etc.

It would also be nice to see included with an entry the amount of sleep that has been obtained as this can dictate mood.

Meal tracking and caffeine tracking could also be included and really help those who want to mindfully journal track everything.
I love the app but until it has a pin that’s different from the unlock pin, I can’t get to deep into using it.
Very funny create the journal with the butterfly fly as the icon. Next time just send my money via check.
Poor app vs other available. Not available on iPad or Mac, no navigation, imports from other apps and exports. Positive that Apple made it, but require some more work.

column9: I really want to like this
column10:
Apple with all of its engineers and talent could surely put out a journaling app with a little more to it.  You made a big deal of it on stage and then gave us a journal app with no search, dates, tags.  And most egregious and frustrating, no ability to write on my iPad or from a computer.  

I really want to like this cause the layout is cool and the potential to serve up interesting elements is engaging.  

Please Apple, do this right and fast follow with improvements.  I definitely don’t want to wait till ios18 for basic improvements.

I want to like it. It’s clean but it’s just to basic. No way to search past entries. No way to export, can only use on your iPhone. 

It doesn’t seem to consistently detect where I went or who I texted with each day. 

It’s still technically in beta but in the month I’ve had it there’s been no updates or improvements.

The layout is beautiful. Would be great to see a journal for both personal and work but separated. It would massively help documenting easier and to separate the 2. It’s early days but just a idea. The current edition works flawlessly but just needs that separation.
Also would be great if it could be passed down to my kids when time goes by and they grow up. But also for business too that could help when I do colleague reviews. That would be a game changer. I also agree that more pictures should be added and not set as it’s my own memory I’ll be using on my device and also think it could add too the printing features I mentioned 🙏
I like the idea of the App. But after writing in the journal it doesn’t allow you to print copies. I lit should you to print.
Good app. 5star if it were available on iPads with ability to handwriting with Apple Pencil.
For me, I rarely journal on my phone. It fact, journaling is a way get away from my phone.  Needs an iPad app or a watch app where I can dictate. No use in its current guise.

I have a suggestion that journalling sections can be added. Like for a book journal I can have a section. So later when I want to look back it would be easier (section wise) or also tags can be used. Overall nice experience .
Need a search feature to search keyboard. Also need a calendar layout to view in calendar
More than one journal, not everyone takes notes of everything on only one.

column9: It sure if glitch or feature
column10: When I type out any entry about an even, the “Done” button is greyed out, can’t select it. Not sure if it’s requiring more, if so, how much more? Why can’t I write just a paragraph? This doesn’t feel intuitive and it’s taking away my desire to use the app anymore.

This app aggregates a lot of content from your iPhone interactions to assist in recalling life relationships & events. It also helps with privacy. Who wants to feed so much information to a third party. So why isn’t there an iPad version? Even better a version that supports Apple Pencil. I’m sure it will happen.

column9: Where’s the iPad and MacOS versions!
column10: It’s okay but using an iPhone to journal all the time is irritating and gets in the way a bit of the journaling process. The needs to be ported to iPad and Mac to be a serious offering. Staying with Day One

column9: Why no transcript of voice memo?
column10:
Given the notes ability on dictation, disappointing that a transcript is not available for voice recordings!

Overall app feels good to use and given the data Apple has on the phone some good data points auto captured/suggested. 

Some basic AI chat with open questions also are needed.
This app requires specific features not available on this device?

The app is great and I am grateful for using it. But I would like to see a much useful app.

But I have some suggestions:

Implement a search function to easily find specific notes.

Introduce filtering options to categorize notes based on media content (photos, videos), tags, and other criteria.

Integrate drawing capabilities similar to the Notes app.

Establish a connection with the Health app to track fitness activities, and also the ability to log state of mind as on Apple watch

Provide monthly or yearly statistics on mood and fitness trends for journaling purposes.

These suggestions are well-aligned with the goal of enhancing the app's functionality and providing a more comprehensive note-taking experience. I'll relay your feedback to the development team for consideration in future updates.
The app has a great minimalist design, I like it. Yet very very poor in functionality. And cross usability between devices is needed.
Such a good app! No more writing/typing on the notes app thing or writing on my notebook. This is soo good and I love that you can add a lock to it so no one has access to it.
I really like the app, but honestly... Well, I was expecting a bit more...

Great app. If I could make a simple suggestion it would be the ability to add a title to your daily journal. I also think adding prompts would be nice. So you could have a daily prompt for gratitude let’s say. Lastly, if you had titles it would be nice to collapse the note into the title not a small preview. I don’t necessarily need to see my daily journal as if it’s a Facebook thread. Great app guys!
This helps me so much to write down how I’m feeling in moments where I can’t get to my book. This is an amazing thing Apple has done.

It’s a weird app. Well for me at least. I never had my own personal journal before and using this is basically using a normal journal. The difference is that I can put music and photos into it which I find very interesting. Although it’s very barebones.

column9: Needs IPad and Mac OS support.
column10: Decent user experience, but no iPad or Mac OS support is a complete non starter for my needs.
Definitely thought it’d leverage AI a bit more to help flesh out some things about my day or places I’ve been to

I have uninstalled and reinstalled, restarted my phone and made sure I was on the latest update. Once I open the app and click the plus sign to add an entry the screen stays the same. Was really excited for this app but its trash.
its cool how it recognises that i’ve walked, the route i’ve taken and who i was with

Otherwise I would give 4-5 stars for the app. 

While I appreciate the app's overall concept and functionality, its current lack of availability on iPad devices is a significant deterrent for me. As an iPad user who values the convenience of journaling on my preferred device, the app's exclusive presence on iPhones raises concerns about its long-term compatibility with my needs. The ability to personalize the app's features to suit individual preferences would further enhance its appeal. In its current state, the app's limitations on device compatibility and personalization hinder its potential to become a truly indispensable journaling tool.

column9: Needs option to transcribe audio recordings into text
column10: It’s a good start, but we need the option to automatically transcribe the audio recordings we make for each entry, like the app Day One. I’m acutely aware that it’s possible to dictate using the microphone on the keyboard, but if one uses that it doesn’t capture the audio for the entry. Only the text is typed out and there is no recording to play. Please add this, it would make the app perfect.
Love This
I thought that this app was going to be ground breaking but every time I go to add an entry it doesn’t let me and it’s a very glitchy app, I know it’s beta but it should be better than this.

It took the first month for me to begin using the journal as much as the other journal app I use. The suggestions need a bit of priming, but I can see this app being a great foil for social media addiction.
I still tend towards the previous app.
The screen jumps around when I write which is just a comfort thing, but that makes a difference when jumping in for a quick note.
It’s got great potential to become #1, I can see myself savouring special moments with it, rather than trying to convince friends and followers that I have had said magical moment.

Looks it’s not perfect yet. But keep going Apple devs… it’s a great concept and so good. So please keep going on the enhancements and ironing out the bugs. I would love to see this come to the iPad ASAP. I journal now on Apple notes using the Apple pen… handwriting is far more effective for journaling than typing on a keyboard or phone. You’ll have me for life if you do that! Haha

Not sure if Apple waited to release because it’s embarrassing useless or that they never started on it.

Is this just another Apple Maps….

Would like to see features added like
- search 
- prompt from locations
- prompt from photos taken
- birthdays 
- prompts from Messages 
- prompts from calendar. 

I appreciate these would not suite everyone so maybe optional in settings. 

But like the simplicity too.

So far, this app is awesome! I would make a couple of changes, but fundamentally, I can’t think of anything right now. I’m sure something will come along in a future point but bottom line is this app is awesome and I prefer it over every single other one. This app has a ton of potential!!!

Lola promising but would like to add multiple different journals so I can have a fitness and food one, travel one and crafts one. Enjoying using it so far just keep adding the functionality. 

On this day would be great too 😄
Very basic. Missing very basic functions, such as tagging, filtering (only Image can be used as a filter) and export. Not sure what is the purpose, other than having the Mindfulness app transcribed.

Would like to browse through days-weeks- months like in photo,s. 
Add search please.
Journal Recommendations haven’t been working

I was really hoping this would be a DayOne replacement but sadly at this point it is far from that! I can see why the folks at DayOne were so excited for this app to come out. It totally shows you how awesome the DayOne app is. This app has no organization to it at all. I will say that unlike others my suggestions have been pretty good for my daily activities. Keep trying Apple cause I really want this to work as it would be one less 3rd party app on my phone.

I find this app very good for my journaling needs. I am a beginner and have not developed good habits of journaling. My memory is bad. This app helps me to remember what is important in my life. Like family and functions. I really wish it had a search or smart tag to help me search items that I vaguely remember.
Really needs search within it as the first enhancement so you can re-find reflections.

I did One entry. Since then, when I tap the plus sign, it flashes and nothing happens. Tonight, tried it again and it acted like it was loading and then went away and tried it again and it flashed again and still nothing. I was so excited for the release of this app! SO disappointed. I really hope this issue is able to be fixed soon!!

There are lot of bugs, one annoying bug of all is when you type, it automatically scrolls to top. And erases what you wrote in last couple of seconds.

Sometimes it removes the words, sometimes sentences. I have to type it over again.

This very bad for apple’s standards

I’ve been looking forward to Apple journal since I heard whispers about it. Initial release is significantly more basic than I though. I still have very high hopes of iterative updates. I’m excited for the journal to intelligently pill in data from my other apps and activities but so far my recommendations do not work. Hope to update to 5 star soon! 🤷

The fact that the app isn’t multi device, ie iPad, at the moment is killing me. I’d rather type longer entries from my iPad but the photos I want to upload are always on my phone.

A journal app should be available on every device we might use to encourage writing. During most of the day, I have thoughts while working remote and it would be great to be able to use on my Mac. While traveling I’m more likely to be using my iPad at the end of the day while in the hotel and that is the ideal time to capture my day. Both Mac and iPad are more conducive to typing long entries so the Journal app should be a no-brainer for those devices.

This app has so much potential but I think it will take some time to get there. I’m usually an early adapter so I decided to give it a try. It worked for a few days and now suddenly won’t allow me to add anymore entries. Thankfully, I only had about 5; which are now useless. It also doesn’t seem to have a basic search feature. I think I’ll put this back in the oven to finish baking.
I love so much the app

I was only able to complete one entry. The one entry as pretty good but when I went to make this a daily thing : clicking the “+” button did nothing. I almost deleted the one thought I never wanted to forget. I think it’s a good idea but it still needs to be developed to what it needs to be.

I was very excited about this coming out. I have switched between having my journal kept in Apple Notes, Craft and most recently Day One. 

I don’t think Day One need lose any sleep yet…

The Journal app looks great UI wise.  The way it integrates suggestions from other apps is great, and something only Apple can really achieve.  However, as others have already noted, it’s missing many other key features.  There’s not much in the way of text formatting options.  It’s lacking retrieval and reminders, streaks widgets and templates. 

Mostly, it’s lacking iPad and Mac apps. Out of the hundreds of diary entries I’ve made over the years, I would imagine less than 5 were ever typed out on my phone!

Be aware that your entries are not saved on the cloud. And I don’t get the suggestions anymore. 
Otherwise it’s cool to get such app from Apple
Worked once, after that every time I open the app it’s a blank screen.

There needs to be an easier way to add specific tiles to your daily journal entry other than just through the suggestions tab. I want to select a specific song and podcast episode, & it limits me to a seemingly arbitrary number of selections.
For a Journal app, this is very uninspiring

Needs ability to link activity workouts to journal, as well as music and much more.

Doesn’t really do all that was promoted at WWDC launch of iOS17.

Also needs proper search functionality of keywords and ability to tag entries.
The idea is great and the way it works is well implemented. It’s a journal that walks with you along the day. Cool!

For a long time I’ve wanted an app that could automatically catalog all of my activities, photo highlights, places I’ve been, moods, etc. There are apps that do some of these things, but I haven’t found one that brings everything together in a good way yet. Based on the way it was presented at the iOS 17 reveal, I thought that the Journal app would be at least *kind of* like that. But it’s not at all. Maybe it’s just because it’s a beta, but the recommendation feature seems to not work at all for me. It just recommends boilerplate writing prompts that I could get from any website. And as others have said, the app lacks any organizational features or text formatting. Crucially, it also seems to lack the ability to export my entries, which is about par for the course for Apple, but still a dealbreaker for an app like this.

Hopefully they’ll improve it over time, but right now this app is a huge missed opportunity.

Not what I expected from a journal app from Apple.

I expected each log to pull all sorts of data from your phone:

1. Places you’ve visited / travelled to
2. A snapshot of your calendar on that day
3. Exercises you’ve done
4. Your heart rate / other health data on that particular day
4. Key photos you took
5. The weather on that day

I was hoping to essentially be able to scroll back in time and revisit previous days of my life on top of writing daily journals.

Despite the above this app also lacks very basic features of any journal app:

1. Unable to search
2. No calendar view 
3. Unable to have multiple journals / categorise them
4. Unable to write your own prompts
5. No recently deleted / recovery
6. No templates
7. No text formatting / checklists

Some things simply don’t work:

1. My phone is not displaying any ‘suggested writing’ prompts

Disappointing…
When I press the plus button it tries to do something but fails so nothing happens. I’ve deleted the app, redownloaded and still doesn’t work.
I‘d love to see this integrated with Health Kit through adding moods. Separate journals or at least tags, to find related entries.

loving the app so far it’s the most i’ve ever been able to talk about stuff deep down, ain’t that wild? (5 stars for apple and their mission on health)

only two things i’d like would be a way to add folders so i can separate certain things i journal and for the recent suggestions to reference my mood log! a perfect way to elaborate on why i had a pleasant/unpleasant moment
The app is pretty basic for now but I’m sure as time moves on and it becomes a public release, it’ll improve. It does help me want to use it though.

I’ve been using it since launch and I love it!

Edit: I’m updating my review. I wish using Journal counted as mindfulness minutes with Fitness. It should also have multiple journals with different types of journals. And not only that, it should also require a different password than your Face ID or your iPhone password. It’s great but it leaves a lot to be desired.

After 5 minutes of fiddling with the app, I managed to break it. Pressing the + no longer allows me to create a new journal entry. Restarting doesn’t help. Uninstalling doesn’t help. Combination of the two doesn’t help…

Sad thing is I could have used this app at this point in my life and when I wanted to give it a go, the one thing that inspired me to start, refused to let me…

Hey Apple! I woke up and the app was installed in my iPhone as a wonderful good surprise gift in the morning that I desired so much. It’s an awesome idea bringing the new Journal app, it’s beautiful, simple, minimalist and of course, it’s Apple. I love everything in the app, I can change the date, insert images, audios, locations, that’s all useful for me, but there’s a lot to be improved yet. See my suggestions right below here. Most important: • Paragraphs • Password, not only Face ID • iPad, MacOS and iCloud.com versions Optional: • Integration with Mental Well-being (Health app) • Different fonts for typing • Background wallpaper • Initial cover when opening the app, like a real journal book📓 Thank you! 😊
There is a zero percent chance apple isn’t spying on your journal entries and selling data about you
No matter how many buttons I press, it just doesn’t work.

On a native Apple app, I would have expected multi device support (iPhone, iPad, macOS), a calendar for navigation and an ability to export/share. I was quite disappointed to get such a basic app instead.

I loved this in the beginning it was a great habit. After three days the suggested journal prompts disappeared and I have tried everything to get them back. It’s a promising start. I tried turning off my phone and going into the settings nothing has worked.
I can’t even write an entry because it won’t bring up a page when I push the plus button.
Missing a search function over all entries 😤

column9: App crashing already. Can’t make new entries
column10: I wanted to love this app. And it was great for what I need. But now the app is not allowing me to create new entries. This is my first time ever writing a review. I just need this to be fixed

Great idea and good way to write a simple journal. I personally love it but there are not a lot of feature or options. Please let us add more photos, and probably make it possible to comment or write for each photos, fonts, stickers, schedule, thumbnail and stuffs
Please also release app for Mac & iPad

I keep trying to press the plus button but it doesn’t make one for me o: it’s my first time using it and I kept having to restart the app so many times just to set up the app and then nothing I can’t even use it at all e.e

Underwhelming to say the least right now.  Day One is MUCH better and sophisticated.  This is basically like taking notes. 

No headlines, weak formatting, no calendar view.  Apple really needs to work on this.  

Did they not see what else was available in the market??

I’m hopeful it’s get better, but for now, I’m sticking with Day One. 

PS…Apple, in order get us Day One users, you better figure out how to have an import function.

I’m missing the ability to import data from other journal apps, so I have to start from zero.
Also notifications are not working, keeps telling me to enable notifications in settings and I’m stuck.

i gave it 3 stars because i have been using it and its quick to just write about a small moment in your life. but i was so excited and ready for this to come out and when it did, i was very underwhelmed. it's such a basic and boring app... it doesn't compare to a lot of journaling apps. granted apples journal is free, i would rather pay a monthly fee for a good journal with different ways to express myself when i journal.
It’s okay on my iPhone but I would rather have it on my iPad and be able to use my pencil with it.

1. Needs search
2. Needs widgets
3. Needs macOS app (I mainly journal on my MacBook)
4. Needs a calendar view
5. Needs templates

Not a bad early version. Just wanted to leave some feedback. I definitely see this becoming another reason to stick to the Apple eco system (notes and reminders have already won me over).

column9: Great app but one thing is missing
column10: I would like to be able to create my own template that I can use whenever I want.

I was holding out on a journal app subscription because I knew this was coming. It's a start, I guess, but it's way too basic to be useful. It's like using a dumbed down Notes. Can't even search entries. Hopefully they'll release more (core) features in future updates. For now I'm subbing to Day One
I open the app and click the +, and nothing happens. Very disappointed
It seems to be an advancement or improvement of its predecessor Notes. I like how it behaves different to notes. I would like ti see where it goes for its official release to public.

This is awful. No native support for iPad, Mac?
How does any legitimate journaling app get limited to the smallest keyboard/screen in the device environment? No stats integration other than location. Not even any text formatting options… and even Notes has that. You can’t even tag the time you’re journaling to look back and see how you’re feeling throughout the days. 
100% staying with Day One. Y’all should have partnered with them. 
I hope this release is truly an early beta and the full release has some major changes in store. 🤷🏻‍♂️
What a miss.
It can use a lot more, polished and detailled features.

You would think an app coming from Apple, that’s featured as part of a new iOS would come fully featured.

No widgets! No wonder other companies don’t bother their time with widgets when Apple can’t be othered.

Photos limited. You can’t make tag your favourite photos from a recent trip as it’s limited to 12.

Formatting is none existent.

So, Apple. Most people will delete the app before ‘features are added’ because it’s so limited on launch.

Why did you bring this out with basic functionality. Your Apple, you should be bringing out apps that fully exploit the latest features in the latest phones.

Not an app my son could make.

This is a veeeery cool app. You can put face ID to confirm it's you!

You can add photos, put a bookmark. Overall, this app is amazing.

I really like it, even though it’s really simple. But it has some issues that definitely need to be fixed: The recommendations lasted for about two days and now they’re completely gone & haven’t experienced some of the main AI-features yet. Also the photos are weirdly cropped, looking boring on the main feed.

To be honest…. I expected way more. But, let’s wait until it is publicly released. So far it feels very static. Nothing dynamic going on. I hope it soon will notify me to write about that trip I did that day, and show me all the pictures I took there. And suggest friends I met at the trip. Etc. This can be a super app. Right now it is just a text editor. Sorry to say.

It’s very frustrating to have to click the cursor, wait, move to format if it’s not listed, and only be able to apply one format at a time.

Ideally, there’d be little B and I buttons for bold and italics respectively. The same would be true for all common formatting operations.
But doesn’t let me add a second journal entry.

Better than use a note app for daily diary 
- Less button 
- fast
- simple
- beauty
- easy to use
- Cloud
- Free
Note: 
- Need a list view. For easy view and slide
- Recommend post like facebook.
 - Need a search for easy to look back
This app is helping me with studying and helping me in exams amd essays
We need to be able to export or share, we need to be able to search, but I love the interface and see where the vision of where this app can go!

column9: Too banal and no prompts/reflections after 1st entry
column10:
The reflections don't show up once you've made your first journal entry, you can't play around from a creative aspect to make it a personal creative journal. By adding prompts for the journal one can develop a healthy habit of jotting down their feelings and the app can simultaneously be tied to the apple health and fitness as well. 
Rest of my thoughts about this app echo with what others are saying- it's very straightforward and there are no reflections, etc.

column9: Clean and simple, but too simple right now
column10:
The app is clean and looks great. That being said it’s a little too basic right now. Hopefully they will add more options. Possible features:

• More ways of organizing/filtering like calendar view
• Adding tags so you can custom filter
• Map view to see where you’ve been like the Photos app has
• Adding locations
• Option for weather info for the day
• Option to include info from the Health app like a workout or weight for a weight loss milestone

Was eagerly waiting since it was announced, hoping there will be greater features and will be far better than other apps like Day One. But far from it. It’s just like taking notes. After a few days of usage, I found it very basic: 

no calendar, 
no streak, 
no in-app settings, 
no look back “on this day” entry, 
no tagging, 
no search, 
no import/export of data, 
no text formatting, etc. 
I wouldn’t know how many consecutive days have I kept the journal, or what are the missing days. Nothing just a + button to add a new entry. Also inside the app, there are no formatting tools, no commands to add time or date stamps, create tags, etc. Perhaps it backs in iCloud as there are no options that too. 

I assume this is only the beginning and more features will be added over time with app updates. So far, not good enough. Perhaps I need not have hurried to go for a beta version of iOS 17.2 only for this app.

column9: A clean app, but maybe a little too clean.
column10:
This is a beautifully clean design for a journal, but coming from ‘Day One’ this all feels more like a notes app without the functionality. Obviously we’re in early days and I expect Apple will add more. 

I’d like to see features such as ‘on this day’ to show past entries, it’s a feature I adore on other apps as a way to reflect, remember and reminisce over. I’d also maybe love to attach more content as it seems to tap out at 14 things, so if I wanted to attach my location, I can only then attach 13 photos of my time. 

I would love to have somewhere that tells me how many entries I have, maybe even a streak in the health app as this is one thing I love from other apps. I currently have over 2770 entries in my other journal with a streak of 1,440 days. I’ll be porting over these each day for a year to complete my transition, so please Apple add these features. Give us a reason to love journaling.
Where is any navigation ? How can I see entries by year or month or by… anything at all ?
Ya…Notes is better.

The idea of journaling is simply great. However, apple has implemented it so poorly. In the app, you can’t even have a text search if you want to search for a past entry. There is no way of tagging or classifying somehow the entries. It runs only on iPhone and you would expect it to run on all Apple devices. It really needs some usability improvements.

Until proven otherwise, Apple has managed my data the right way.
Even though it looks simple, the application is full of important features.
This shows dedication from the Design team, dedication towards us, the customers.
As a designer, I must tip my hat to that. I don’t have any objections when it comes to usability. if you pay attention, you can easily understand the hierarchy of available actions.
I hope this app along with other Apps of this kind will put a big dent in the social media share of attention.
This seems like a promising app but I do hope we get this on ipad and macOS too. Will change my rating as soon as it becomes available for both. 😊
I want this app to create a video memory, inspired by everything I did and an option to tag a friend or family member or someone in a shared journal note.

It’s worthless if you can’t create sections and questions in your own. I keep my own offline diary, with three sections to be filled in the morning (what I am grateful for, what would make today great, and a daily affirmation), and two sections to be filled at night  (the three highlights of the day, and what I learned). This Journal app does not allow me to re-create those sections and questions, so until it does, I am giving it one star.

column9: What a great idea Apple. Make the world a better place.
column10: Journaling is probably one of the most satisfying things to do and helps you to go forward with your life with confidence. Love the app. 👌🏼

I have been using Notes for many simple notes (journal, groceries list, long to do list, general notes, etc.) for many years and I like the fact that I can access from all my Apple devices. I need to be able to type with a keyboard for long texts. The Notes app is a very simple app, often too simple compared to other notes apps such as EverNote (which I use heavily for fancier notes that I need to keep “forever”) or even Microsoft OneNote is much more powerful than the Notes app; downside is that these other notes apps are not “free”. The Journal app looks prettier than the Notes app, but I am not sure what the value is if I can’t access it on my Mac and other deficiencies that people had listed here (lack of folders, labels, etc.); hopefully these will be available in a couple years, then I’d definitely consider it. If I can do away with EverNote by then, even better.

column9: This app is my life savior!
column10: After dealing with multiple feelings of different stuff in my life I have been using use a regular old notebook, but this app has it all and despite all of the negative reviews, there’s more updates to come this app is still baby so be patient you guys!

This just appeared on my phone while I was having an off day and really helped me vent my emotions into text. Awesome app for journalling beginners. 5/5

Won’t be able to replace my current app (Journey) as is. 

It’s missing some absolute basics like formatting of text for bullets and, most importantly, throwbacks. 

One of the most useful features of any journaling app is to be able to see previous posts from 30, 90, 1yr, 5yrs, etc. ago. 

Throwbacks help you see that most feelings are temporary and pass. To be reminded that a month ago you were in a real funk and now you feel great is a very powerful motivator for you next time you’re in a real funk. 

On the plus side, the provocations from the suggestions are quite good. Forcing you to reflect on something like a decision you’ve recently made that you’re proud of is not something I would do without provocation. 

Lots of work to do, but not there yet. 

I’d also like to see an import function when and if I do decide to switch to this so that I can see my entire journaling history in one place.
Would be nice to be able to record sound bits from your Apple Watch into the Journal app.
After two days of use now the recommended area is blank and doesn’t populate premade questions and topics. Waiting for this to get fixed for a full review.

I know that you can do better and have faith that you will improve the app to add more functionality. So this rating is largely to urge you to get those features out rather quickly and across all your platforms.
Can’t wait to get a few more functions, but I like the simplicity of it. Keep going 🙏

First time writing a review for the App Store, and it’s well-deserved. I’ve been anticipating this release since it was demonstrated at WWDC ‘23 since journaling is something I’ve always aspired to do throughout daily life, but I just never managed to hold onto. I feel this will be the key to that. Having a native App that has the potential to integrate with our other iOS features/services opens up an entirely new and immersive way to creatively express our daily selves for ourselves and for others. 

Journal is clean and simple thus far which keeps you focused on YOU when using it. The App allows you to attach photos to your entries as well as songs and location tags to further enhance and draw references to your experiences. It even allows verbal entries through the use of Voice Memos if typing isn’t ideal for you. The fact that it has built-in Face ID reminds you that security and privacy are still paramount in Apple’s design language for its native Apps. Truly a gift to one’s mind and routine. 🙂

As a person who journals a lot, I’m loving the app so far. It’s really great, and I especially love the design and aesthetic the most. Some features which would be nice to have for someone like me includes:

*The ability to input the current time (not date) as a text within the contents of an entry with one tap. Useful for people who time-block their journals. 

*The ability to insert images within the contents of an entry. It’s lovely that images act as covers for an entry, but that shouldn’t take away from the ability to place them within an entry. They can be two separate decisions.  
*The ability to set more than one daily reminder to journal. Helpful for people who, perhaps, journal in the morning and night, or do so at intermittent intervals of their day.

Thank you, that’s all.

First, the app is super basic which I find insane since it took months or even years to develop. It’s basically a blank sheet with minimal options.

column9: A good gateway app into journaling.
column10:
If what you’re looking for is a quick way to supplement your bad memory by keeping track of meaningful things you did, this is a great way to do that. That being said, there is plenty of room for 3rd-party apps to build on this with more advanced options like templates and tags for those who need more. 

This app will serve the journaling needs of 90% of users but Apple’s allowing other apps to use an API in their own, more advanced journaling apps to get access to similar journaling suggestion. Apple seems to be positioning themselves as a gateway app for more advanced journaling apps if you need them. 

There are a few features that can be added here and there, like folders, but otherwise it’s a great start and we are still early in the app’s evolution. I look forward to seeing how it develops over the years and expands to other parts of the Apple ecosystem.
I just wish you could make your own reflections and questions. Otherwise great app.
It's basically a text editor and that's it. I'm disappointed that Apple released something with such bare bones functionality.
I love all the suggestions, the layout, the color scheme, and the whole journaling experience.

The Journal App is a very nice app to note down your daily thoughts, wishes, dreams etc. This app does not allow Pages to copy paste into Journal. That’s very annoying and should be adjusted.

Please consider! 

Sync with Apple Health: Allow users to integrate health data from Apple Health, enabling them to track mood, sleep, or physical activity alongside journal entries.

Templates: Include pre-designed templates for different types of journals, such as gratitude, travel, or daily diary.

Collaboration: Allow for shared journals where multiple users can contribute, making it a collaborative experience if they wish. 

Export as iBook: Give users the option to compile their journal entries into an iBook format for easy digital publication.

Mood Tracking: Implement mood tracking features, enabling users to track their emotional state over time.

Custom Tags & Categories: Let users create their own tags and categories to organize entries more effectively.

Journal Entry Reminders: Offer users the option to set reminders for specific times to encourage consistent journaling.

Multiple Journals: Users can create and manage multiple journals, each with a different focus or purpose.

Calendar View: Entries are organized in a calendar view, making it easy to navigate and review past journaling.

Search Functionality: Robust search capabilities allow users to find specific entries or topics quickly.

Custom Journal Covers: Personalize journals with custom covers, photos, and color themes.

Activity Feed: Provide insights into journaling habits, like streaks, analytics and daily summaries.

Inspirational Prompts: Users receive daily quotes and inspiration for journaling.

Timeline View: Entries can be viewed in a timeline, allowing users to revisit past experiences easily.

Print & PDF Export: Entries can be exported as PDFs or printed for physical copies.

Social Sharing: Enable the option for users to share selected entries with friends or on social media, if they wish.

Cross-Device Sync: Implement seamless synchronization across devices so users can access their journal from smartphones, tablets, and computers.
So when I got this app I was so excited to see all the cool features but there really none right now I’m still waiting to get a notification to see what it will say. Overall great app
